shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: whoa. Pace, bounce and movement. Just short of a length, seam away, and Gurbaz does well to not follow it
preText:
7.30pm KKR have finally got Venkatesh Iyer back up opening. With him is Rahmanullah Gurbaz. Mohammed Siraj has the new ball. Two slips in place.

7.20pm This chaos is a good reason why the IPL should follow the sensible method. Teams announce a XII before the toss, and take out one of them after the toss.

"CricInfo, my word! Y'all almost gave me a heart attack with the wrong playing XI!" Bodhisatwa Kund, we reported what Nitish Rana said.

7.10pm Wait just a minute. Seems Nitish Rana has told us the wrong XI. There is no Suyash Sharma in the official XI shared by KKR. It seems Suyash would have started if they had been chasing. Now it is Venkatesh Iyer. We look forward to the 19-year-old Suyash bowl legspin as an Impact Player.

7pm Time for the toss. The match referee seems to have misheard the call. Sanjay Manjrekar, the commentator conducting the toss, helps out. So eventually Faf du Plessis has won the toss, and RCB will be chasing. As expected, David Willey comes in for Reece Topley.

Nitish Rana says he would have fielded himself. Legspinner Suyash Sharma makes his debut, replacing Anukul Roy. That is the only change for KKR.

Kolkata Knight Riders Mandeep Singh, Rahmanullah Gurbaz†, N Rana*, RK Singh, AD Russell, SN Thakur, SP Narine, Venkatesh Iyer, TG Southee, UT Yadav, CV Varun

RCB V Kohli, F du Plessis*, KD Karthik†, GJ Maxwell, MG Bracewell, Shahbaz Ahmed, HV Patel, DJ Willey, Akash Deep, Mohammed Siraj, KV Sharma

6.55pm Five minutes to the toss, and here is the pitch report. First let's tell you this is not the centre pitch on the square. One boundary is as short as 54m. Will pay to have right-left batting combinations. Danny Morrison, looking at the pitch, says 200 might be the bare minimum.

6.40pm Let's jump straight to team news. RCB have got off to a good start with a win in their first match, but have since received news that Rajat Patidar is ruled out of the season. Josh Hazlewood and Wanindu Hasaranga are yet to join the squad, and Reece Topley injured himself too. David Willey should take Topley's place for this match.

KKR have signed up Jason Roy, but he won't be available for this match. Lockie Ferguson still doesn't look fully fit.

6.30pm Day 7, Match 9. Finally it is the turn of KKR to play in front of their home crowd at Eden Gardens. It's KKR vs RCB, a rivalry - on top off my head - known for one-sided finishes and snarky tweets aimed at each other. Here is hoping for closer finish. They can tweet snarkily all they want.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, 5 wides

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

preText: "Why does teams name a foreigner as an Impact player list when they already have 4 foreigners in their playing XI? " Kamalesh, you can substitute an overseas player with an overseas player if the original player has had no part to play in the game. For example if they have not batted.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, FOUR
text: what outfield. Short of a length, some width there, Gurbaz throws his hands at it, Willey at deep third has not far to go to cover it, but he is rushed into it. He does so, gets behind the ball, is down to field it, but gets a bad bounce, which defeats him and goes for four

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

looks for swing. Middle and off, on a length, but it goes with the angle. Pushed to mid-on

text: slightly short of a length, pushed past midwicket for one

text: pushed to mid-on, sent back, and rightly so
good field placement. Gurbaz jumps out of the crease, flicks on the leg side, deliberately in the air. However, RCB have a deep square leg to keep them down to one. That is good scouting
pushes at a length ball, gets a thick outside edge past point for one

shortText: Willey to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, 4 byes

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, FOUR
text: this is poor bowling. His two deep fielders are on the leg side, and he is bowling wide. All Gurbaz has to do is steer it past short third

wkt_text: VR Iyer  b Willey 3 (18m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85
text: timber. This has jagged back in to hit the middle stump. He has missed this by a long way. Willey stays on a length, just outside off, Iyer likes to play off the back foot, and tries to muscle it through the off side. The seam movement beats him by six inches at least

wkt_text: Mandeep Singh  b Willey 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: and he is already the old batter. How has that hit the off stump? Left-arm quick, hitting the off stump of a right-hand batter usually happens when the ball is swinging back in or if the batter is going hammer and tongs. This one, though, is a wobble-seam delivery that lands on middle and off, seams away to beat Mandeep's defensive prod, and still manages to clip the off stump. Mandeep is squared up
preText: Mandeep Singh, former RCB, is the new batter in

text: length ball, at the stumps, played towards that short midwicket, but with soft hands
preText: Nitish Rana to face the hat-trick ball. A slip and a short midwicket

text: this one swings away, and is left alone
defends a length ball. That is a double-wicket maiden
preText: Two wobble-seam deliveries this over. Both have pitched and seamed from right to left. Both have hit the timber

shortText: Akash Deep to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run

Time for a time-out. Forty-six minutes to bowl nine overs so far (the prescribed over-rate is 4'10" per over). Two successful DRS reviews in those overs

Meanwhile, for the first time since 2007, a new world champion will emerge in chess who is not named Viswanathan Anand or Magnus Carlsen. The World Chess Championship is set to begin as Ian Nepomniachtchi and Ding Liren battle for the crown with Carlsen being the missing king.

not to the pitch of the ball as he steps out, and the ball is turning, but that only means Thakur has some momentum to drag this over deep midwicket for a big six. This is some batting from Thakur

text: phew. Willey does everything right. Bowls short of a length to disallow him the length to clear mid-off, but Thakur slaps it back at the non-striker's head, who gets out of the way to let the ball beat mid-off for four more

and when the lord mis-hits, he mis-hits it so bad it doesn't carry to the deep fielder. He is looking to go over extra but gets a thick edge over point for one

text: there are four fielders on the leg-side boundary, and they can all just watch. Thakur pulls this from outside off, and pierces the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. That is fifty for Thakur. An innings that began with an ungainly shot to a wrong'un first up. Joint-fastest fifty this IPL
preText: Over the wicket to Thakur

ha ha ha, what a day Thakur is having. This is his third mis-hit that has landed safe. And this has gone a mile in the air, but still lands right between the man inside the circle and the one on the boundary, both of them running towards the each other. It is a top-edged pull. preText: Into the last over we go. KKR stand a chance to get to 200. Who would have thought this when Russell got out with the score under 100

text: wide full toss again, but this time Thakur ends up slicing it to deep point for one
flicked for four first ball! Eden doesn't mind. Quite full and angled into his pads, as Kohli lets that go to short fine's left
preText:
9.40pm So the first ball of the chase is to be bowled more than 20 minutes after the KKR innings ended. Umesh has the new ball, and he will bowl to Kohli.

KKR bring in Suyash Sharma for Iyer as Impact Sub.

Kohli and du Plessis, fresh from their stand of 148 against MI, walk out in pursuit of 205. Eden Gardens has been yelling Kohli and RCB's chants in the build-up to this game, so let's see who they root for if this gets tense.

9.30pm Hello, everyone. I'm sure a lot of us were left wondering if that was it for KKR at 89 for 5, especially with only the bowlers to follow. But now we have an entirely different game going on: RCB's required rate starts from above ten an over; however, there are short boundaries around, and the dew could play a role too. Meanwhile, Sampath just pings saying that KKR's run rate of 13.53 after the fall of the fifth wicket today is the second-highest in IPL history when a team has been five down for less than a hundred, and the sixth-wicket pair has faced at least 30 balls.

text: dabs it on the bounce to point, as Umesh now goes on the shorter side of a length outside off
postText: Dipojjal: "Sampath: Interesting to know which team was the first" --- It's MI vs then KXIP in 2015

text: length ball on leg stump, and pushed wide of mid-on

shortText: Yadav to du Plessis, no run
text: gets good bounce off a good length, shaping it in to hit du Plessis' stomach on leg stump as the batter fends and misses
bunts it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket, as Umesh bowls on a good length just outside off
tucked between point and short third! Just uses the pace of the bowler in guiding that shortish delivery which is a bit wide of off to end the over with a four after starting with one

shortText: Southee to du Plessis, no run
text: goes flashing but withdraws his bat last moment. Good length slightly wide of off, and it darts away further
preText: Southee from the other end

text: again some away movement off a good length from outside off. Pushed to point for a hurried single
walks down, but is completely beaten! Length ball just outside off, angled in, but straightens after pitching as Kohli looks to flick but misses
postText: Rakesh Prattipa: "Why Cricinfo is so upset with the time delays? Can you give an explanation please?" --- So that we can go to bed earlier...

text: goes much fuller on off, and is driven to mid-on
now goes chasing this wide ball outside off. It's not called wide, and Kohli isn't amused. Shortish on sixth stump, and angles away as Kohli skips down, flashes and is beaten
gets across with a slight step forward, and dabs at this length ball just outside off. Single to midwicket
off the higher side of the bat, and just over mid-on. Kohli walks down again, as Umesh digs it into the pitch and just outside off. Kohli half-pulled, and without any timing
opens the bat face to stab this good length ball which pitched around sixth stump
again finds point with his poke, as this good length delivery is bowled outside off
drives this length ball around off between mid-off and extra cover for a single
lofted over extra cover! Sits deep in the crease, and Umesh bowls a near yorker in the channel outside off. du Plessis opened the bat face, and went inside out

shortText: Yadav to du Plessis, no run
text: punches this good length ball on off to extra cover
jumps down, and goes over the bowler's head! On a good length on off, and hints to angle in after pitching. Kohli lofts down, even as the bat face half-closes
preText: Imran: "Tim Southee is the most under-rated swing bowler of this generation. One of the very best who delivers in all three formats of the game"

text: length ball this time, and angles into middle. Again Kohli skips out, and clips wide of mid-on. Varun there chases the ball, and they pinch three
flung over mid-on! Du Plessis joins the fun in the over. Again he is deep in the crease, as this length ball arrives just outside off, and he swings across the line
clubbed to deep extra cover! Southee now went wider of off, but again on a length, as du Plessis opened the bat face to send that flashing over the fielder
the shorter boundary into play! Runs are flowing here. Slower ball from Southee, but his line and length weren't there: it was close to being a on a length, and around. Swung over midwicket

text: good length on middle and off, and pushed down

preText: Here comes Narine after Southee went for 23

text: turns in off a good length, and ends on his pads. Clipped to square leg
preText: Felix: "Timely jinx, Imran"

text: length ball on the stumps, and turned to square leg
good length ball, turning in and ending just outside leg. Flicked, but right to square leg again

wkt_text: V Kohli  b Narine 21 (20m 18b 3x4 0x6) SR: 116.66
text: gone, the off stump is plucked! Eden is up in celebration. Kohli went to play across the line, but missed this fullish ball which pitched just outside off. It was flicked from the front of the hand, and turned in nicely enough for Narine to strike in his first over. RCB lose an early wicket in a big chase

preText: Bracewell promoted. Narine around the wicket, and has a slip

That was bowled from back of the hand, and hinted to turn in, as du Plessis went for an expansive drive but got an inside edge. RCB's chase gets derailed just after they had started well
preText: From over the stumps du Plessis

preText: Maxwell

almost chops on! He also goes for a wild hack, as this ball is on a good length outside off and turns in. Luckily for him, the ball drops on to his leg off the bottom edge

preText: Required rate already nearing 12 an over

wkt_text: GJ Maxwell  b Varun 5 (9m 7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 71.42
text: bowled him again! Once again it's the off stump that is uprooted. From the back of the hand, and on the shorter side of a length. That pitched just outside off, and turned in and bounced nicely enough for the bowler's liking, as Maxwell went swinging hard and across the line, but was completely foxed. He lost his shape, as Varun struck again
preText: Obaid: "Michael Bracewell kinda target, and Michael Bracewell kinda situation."

Bowls from the back of the hand - and the googly - on a good length outside off. Harshal goes pushing hard, as the turn in finds the gap between his bat and pad. This time it is the middle and leg stumps that are disturbed

Narine went much fuller this time, angling it into the left-hander, as the ball ended on off stump. Shahbaz rolled his wrists and struck nicely, only to unfortunately find the fielder

wkt_text: KV Sharma c Rana b Suyash Sharma 1 (11m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33
text: An animated appeal by Suyash, and not given. The ball went to the slip fielder after Karn missed his sweep, and KKR review. That was bowled from the back of the hand, on a full length on middle and off. Karn swept but missed, and there looks like no bat involved. Ah, UltraEdge detects a faint bottom edge. But Karn is gone even then, since the ball had carried to slip. So he is given caught, and Suyash has his third

clips this good length ball on off to deep square, and they pinch two

bottom edge, and four more! So RCB won't lose by a hundred runs. Rather, they wouldn't have anyway after the previous single. Full ball outside off, as Deep went slogging across the line for third ball he has faced today
preText: Jai: "Yayyyy.. 100 up.."

postText: M Usman Mehsood: "Pakistan have won all the titles but given 100s of heart attacks..."

wkt_text: Akash Deep c & b Varun 17 (14m 8b 2x4 1x6) SR: 212.50
text: very good catch by Varun! He ended up where an imaginary midwicket fielder would have been, diving forward to complete the catch. There were two others rushing towards the ball, but Varun kept his eyes on it, not getting distracted by Gurbaz reaching so close to his left. The ball was flirted up right into the clouds, as Deep went heaving at this full ball, only to get a top edge. KKR win by 81 runs
postText:
A one-sided game in what was Eden Gardens' first IPL match in four years. KKR cruised to an 81-run win after hitting back from a position where everyone except Thakur had given up. Have a read of Monga's report from today's play, which included RCB collapsing from 44 for 0 to 61 for 5. That's it from us tonight, as this is Himanshu signing off on behalf of Raghav, Thilak and Monga! Good night.

Shardul Thakur is the Player of the Match for his match-turning 68 off 29: "Even I don't know where it came from! Looking at the scorecard, everyone would have said we were struggling. But your subconscious mind takes over. You also have to have skills to do that at the higher level, but we also work hard in the nets. Coaching staff do the throwdowns, and give us the option of range-hitting. And you know the pitches; they always suit the batsmen, don't they? Suyash bowled exceptionally well, and we know the quality Sunil and Varun have. They have fun, take wickets. This was a perfect day"

KKR captain Nitish Rana: "If you look at the last match, there were positives; we were in the game even after seven down. Even today, we collapsed, and credit to Gurbaz. And it was an unbelievable innings from Shardul Thakur! People will talk about Shardul, but Rinku held one end up, as we had planned. We had always planned not to give RCB batters pace in the middle overs. Suyash, playing his first match, bowled brilliant balls to such batters. Not even we have got to know him so far! He backs himself. It was always our plan to add him if we needed a third spinner."

Time for the presentations

Shrikant : "23 extras by RCB was another crime committed "

KKR coach Chandrakant Pandit: "It's a good win. Boys have shown the character. Looking at the initial stage, having lost wickets, and coming back to get 200-plus. We just expected the pitch to help the spinners. But you require enough runs. Shardul and Rinku counterattacked the opposition. We have seen him (Suyash) at trial matches. He is very quick in the air, and it's very tough to pick him. It's just the inexperience; but he showed a fighting attitude."

RCB captain Faf du Plessis after the loss: "We had it set up there in the 12th or 13th over... It was probably 20-25 runs too much. Shardul played well. Their legspinners got on top of us. It was still a good wicket... but the nature of mystery spinners is that they get wickets. They put the squeeze on us. We were pretty average with the bat. You learn lessons. Two or three days ago, you played brilliant cricket. It got away from us."

Afeef: "Shardul's knock will remain one of the best knocks when this season ends"

11.09pm Hardly a challenge here from the Royal Challengers. KKR were 89 for 5 in the 12th over of their innings - including having Russell back in the hut - but Thakur turned the screw thereon, and how! Strangely, only three KKR batters entered double figures, but you can imagine the impact they had as their side ended at 204. Add to that not one, not two, but three mystery spinners: four wickets for Varun, three for debutant Suyash and two for Narine, and that was it. Hang around for the presentation formalities.

text: full and swinging in on fifth stump, punched wide of mid-off for one.
preText:
7.29 pm The players are out. Prabhsimran on strike to face Boult.

We're not too far off from the start of play. But how long until the match finishes? Matches which now regularly stretch beyond four hours have become a source of frustration for some fans and observers. Sidharth Monga has his say on the issue of the lengthy duration of IPL matches, and franchise T20 games in general across all leagues, with prolonged endings which are starting to become unwieldy.

FYI - Rajasthan subs: Dhruv Jurel, Akash Vashisht, Murugan Ashwin, Kuldip Yadav, Donovan Ferreira.

Punjab subs: Atharva Taide, Harpreet Bhatia, Matthew Short, Mohit Rathee, Rishi Dhawan

7.02 pm The news from the middle is that Rajasthan Royals have won the toss and will bowl first.

Rajasthan are fielding an unchanged XI. Punjab are fielding the same batting XI they used in their first match, reflecting the Impact Player swap.

Punjab Kings XI: 1 Shikhar Dhawan (capt.), 2 Prabhsimran Singh (wk), 3 Bhanuka Rajapaksa, 4 Sikandar Raza, 5 Jitesh Sharma, 6 Shahrukh Khan, 7 Sam Curran, 8 Harpreet Brar, 9 Nathan Ellis, 10 Rahul Chahar, 11 Arshdeep Singh

Rajasthan Royals XI: 1 Jos Buttler, 2 Yashasvi Jaiswal, 3 Devdutt Padikkal, 4 Sanju Samson (capt./wk), 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Riyan Parag, 7 Jason Holder, 8 R Ashwin, 9 Yuzvendra Chahal, 10 KM Asif, 11 Trent Boult.

Trent Boult to the host TV broadcaster: "Tremendous start, our form has continued from the last year. New year, guys are excited to come out and deliver. A couple of new faces, the message is that the consistency around the dressing room is same. We appreciate it is a long tournament, nice to get one under our belt. [Secret to his first-over wickets] You've probably jinxed it! I am clear in my game plan - pitch it up and try and get early wickets."

In case you missed it, here's today's video match preview featuring Tom Moody.

You can also follow the ball-by-ball commentary of this match in Hindi and in Tamil.

6.30 pm Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live coverage of tonight's 2023 Indian Premier League encounter between Rajasthan Royals and Punjab Kings. I'm Peter Della Penna to take you through all of the action. To set the scene, check out Sreshth Shah's match preview.

Sai: "Can we see some new dance moves from Riyan Parag today? He is going to play in front of his home crowd."

Both teams enter today having won their initial matches this season. Rajasthan defeated Sunrisers by 72 runs while Punjab defeated KKR by 7 runs on DLS in a rain-shortened affair. Whoever wins today will join Gujarat Titans at the top of the table on four points after they have won both of their first two matches.

dropped! Half-volley on seventh stump is pulverized to extra cover above head height. Padikkal reaches up but only manages to parry it over his head for one. It was 8/10 on difficulty, mainly due to the rapid pace that it was struck at toward the fielder at short distance, but it was essentially straight to him. Prabhsimran has been a menace in the Powerplay. How much will that missed chance cost Rajasthan?

wkt_text: Prabhsimran Singh c Buttler b Holder 60 (49m 34b 7x4 3x6) SR: 176.47
text: Buttler with a sensational diving catch diving forward after charging in from long-off! Length ball on the wide guideline, Prabhsimran tries to pull this to the leg side but it comes off the toe and pops up over mid-off. Buttler has 25+ yards to cover but never hesitates and makes it almost to the edge of the circle before launching himself forward and pulling off the catch at ankle height. 10/10 on the judge's scorecards by the panel from Russia, Brazili, New Zealand, Lesotho, Panama and Iceland.

text: man down! Rajapaksa is nailed at the non-striker's end by a scorching drive from Shikhar. Full on sixth stump, Shikhar heaves this flat and Rajapaksa can't get out of the way of this as it drills him in the right arm.
postText: Delay here for Rajapaksa to get some on-field injury treatment from the physio. It actually hit Rajapaksa square on the right elbow/forearm. Initially he had his arm wrapped by the physio but the pain is too much to grip the bat properly and he's leaving the field injured. Rajapaksa retires hurt.

postText: AJ: "Only 11 overs in an hour. We are in for another long night. "

text: this is even better than the previous one! Full on the wide guideline reaches out and flays this high over the ring to the extra cover rope, one bounce over for four.

Shikhar charges a good length ball on seventh stump, nowhere near the pitch but swings across the line at this anyway and launches it high over long-on landing in the fifth row.
full on off, jams this out back to the bowler.
full on eighth stump, driven to wide mid-off, diving stop on the ring keeps it to one.

innovation from Shikhar! Good length ball on fourth stump, shuffles across and scoops this over fine leg to the rope.
length ball on fifth stump, miscues a heave through midwicket for two.
142 kph short ball down the leg side past a pull, wide called. Fumbled by Samson diving to his right so they take another run to put Sharma back on strike.
full on fourth stump, shuffles across to try to scoop this wide of fine leg and it dribbles behind square for one.
full on the stumps, driven down the ground for one.
full on the stumps, sweeps this to deep backward square, timid effort on the rope to stop it and it slips past for four.

Back to back boundaries through the leg side brings up a 36-ball half-century. Full outside leg, heaves this in the gap perfectly between deep midwicket and deep square leg to the rope. 50 career IPL 50+ scores (48 50s and 2 100s). Only Kohli and Warner have more.

close shave! Slogs a full ball from sixth stump high behind Chahal. Long-on won't be able to cover the ground so Chahal races back toward the edge of the circle and dives but it lands two yards out of his reach and they scamper two runs.
full and wide, slices a drive high over wide long-off to the rope.
postText: Priyam Banerjee: "Excellent acceleration from Dhawan. He was 30 off 30 a few balls ago."

text: full on middle, driven in the air down the ground for one.
preText: Boult returns for his final over. Left-arm around the stumps to Sharma.
postText: The umpires have an issue with the ball, which looks severely scuffed up. Delay so that a replacement can be brought out.

text: length ball on the legs, pulled behind square leg for one.

Extraordinary shot! Shot of the day hits the second tier facade over extra cover! Slower bouncer just inside the wide guideline, swatted inside out flat and somehow with enough timing to reach the second deck.
postText: Half-century partnership too for these two.

text: goes for wide yorker again, sends down a knee high full toss slapped to extra cover. Picks out Hetmyer on the ring who flings a tight relay to Holder trying to deny the single. A direct hit would've been out but enough time passes with Holder collecting and trying to bring the ball back to the stumps to allow the single to happen safely.

Kings are reviewing an umpiring decision given as not a wide. Shikhar shuffled way outside off, almost to the wide guideline outside off, to swat a thigh high full toss that was bowled off the pitch. It landed beyond the cut strip. This is an interesting call. It was technically within arms reach to play at considering Shikhar's position at time of delivery, but it landed so far off the cut strip that it is being given as a wide. So Shikhar wins the review with an assist from Shahrukh Khan at the non-striker's end who had a good angle to recommend.
137 kph length ball on fifth stump, slapped on the up to Riyan Parag at mid-off who dives along the ring to save three runs.
postText: MikeB: "I thought pitching off the cut strip was a no ball?" I think the umpire deemed it as a wide instead of a no ball because it landed beyond the 22 yards instead of adjacent within the 22 yards, which would be a no ball. Very slight nuance.

text: low full toss at shin height going for a wide yorker, but Shikhar gets outside the line of off to spank this over extra cover, one bounce over the rope.

shortText: Asif to Shahrukh Khan, (no ball) 1 bye

The previous catch he took diving head first. This time he slides feet first to get his body under control and takes a knee height catch in front of his chest. Technically very different from his first approach, but equally flawless.
now that's a way to get the chase underway! Length ball on the hips, just flicks this effortlessly over square leg.

postText: Ajith: "Calling it 'all-time worst DRS reviews' is a bit harsh, I think. The spike on UltraEdge wasn't so high indicating maybe the batter didn't feel the ball touching his thigh-pad. That or batter didn't know it's not a wide if ball touches any part of his body. In which case, I agree." You've clearly ignored the overall context. Imagine burning a review trying to get a dot overturned into a wide in the first few overs of a match, and then you leave yourself without a review that you actually need later on for a *wicket*.

postText:
11.44 pm And so after four hours and 14 minutes.... your winner is the Punjab Kings by five runs. Rajasthan really gave this match away with a series of strategic blunders. The total was well within their reach, especially after conceding just seven runs off the 20th over in the first innings. But they bungled a number of things starting with the batting order followed by two reviews lost - not on lbw decisions but on attempted reversals of legal deliveries into wides/no balls.

Rajasthan captain Sanju Samson: "I think it was a really good track to bat on especially in the Powerplay. There was not much movement. Their batsmen came with a really positive mindset and their momentum carried on with that. Our bowlers tried varying their lengths and speed. It's a high scoring venue but we did reasonably good job pulling them back after the Powerplay start they got. [On sending Ashwin in to open] Jos was not fit. He was getting stitches for his finger after the catch. The thinking was with Padikkal, they have two spinners, a left-arm and a leggie, and we wanted a lefty out there in the middle overs. [On Jurel] It's really a pleasure. He has been with us for the last two seasons. Lots and lots of work has gone behind him. We all are really happy. When you come to the IPL, it's a one-week camp before the IPL starts but these guys put in 5 weeks of work coming to our academy facing thousands of balls. We're happy to have a batsman like that in our team. Dew, I was expecting it come in the second half of the game but it was right there in the first innings. It was a high scoring game and I think we'll be a bit more prepared in the next game."

Punjab allrounder Sam Curran: "[On the final over] I think when it comes to those situations, you know if you nail your yorker, you'll be okay. Some days it works and some days it won't but luckily it was our day. I was trying to get our ball changed because it was like soap. I don't really understand why they got their ball changed but we can't. [On Prabhsimran] He's been amazing. I was with him at Punjab four years ago. He was very young and is still young. The team got off to a great start. Hopefully it's the start of a great campaign for him and the runs keep coming because he's an amazing player. The way we were playing, I was happy sitting in the dugout because the boys were playing beautifully. All that matters is that we won. [On bowling with a wet ball] It's amazingly hard. You try to train by dipping balls in water. It's incredibly hard to hold the seam. You try to bowl cross seam but it's not a natural ball to bowl a yorker cross seam. It's extremely tough but everyone has to do it so there's no real complaining. We just have to keep getting better because the batters are getting better, the bowlers are getting better and that's why this tournament is the best in the world."

Punjab Kings captain Shikhar Dhawan: "There were some nervous moments but I was keeping my calm and the same with the bowlers. There was a lot of dew. The bowlers did a great job. I was happy with the score we put up. They bowled well and bowled very good yorkers. [Asked what was the turning point in the game] My switch hits? [Laughs] Scoring 197 and then my bowlers coming and getting early wickets and keeping the pressure on and then Nathan came on and got wickets. We never let the game get out of our hands. There were some moments that were hard but I think it was a great team effort. These two matches, we've gotten a great start playing well and I'm doing my best to increase my strike rate. The wicket brings momentum back quickly. This year we have a deep batting lineup so we keep momentum going hitting boundaries and put pressure on the other team. You have to respect that the other team has come to play and will bowl some good overs as well but we have to keep the intent and aggression going."

Player of the Match is Nathan Ellis for his 4 for 30, including the wickets of Buttler and Samson: "It's one of those days where you can potentially bowl not your best and get rewards. There's some other guys in the team who probably deserve some rewards, but just stoked to get the win in another tight one with Rajasthan. To me it's just ball-by-ball. Each ball is a moment. I don't want to get too swept up in one over's time, five overs' time, ten overs' time. It's more about that ball's time. T20 is getting to the point where every ball counts and staying in the moment is key. Easier said than done, especially in a game like tonight. When I was bowling in the back end, I was really trying to focus on drying the ball - because it was so wet - and two to get my execution right so for me it was cross seam. I was calculating the best percentage ball for me in that time and to restrict runs. I'm stoked and really happy for Sam to get us over the line."

That's it for our live coverage of tonight's game where I can confirm that the PUNJAB KINGS won by five runs. Come back tomorrow (or is it today? It's now 12:12 am in India with the post-match presentation ending after midnight) for some more IPL action. Until then, take care!

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Loud, loud appeal for a caught behind, but the umpire says no! There was some sound as the ball passed the bat. Did the ball hit the stumps? Oh, it did! What a ball from Shami. Length on off, shaping just a touch away from Warner, who pokes at it, and should have been a goner.
Good length ball with a bit of shape but way outside the tramline. Saha has to move to his left.
preText:
7.27pm The two umpires stride out to the middle. The two Delhi Capitals batters, Prithvi Shaw and David Warner, who is on 5973 IPL runs, also come out. The Titans fielders are in place. Mohammed Shami will take the new ball. Watch out for the nip-backer into Shaw. All set. Warner to take strike. Over the wicket. One slip in place.

Afeef: "Tough call to bench Rovman Powell "

Subs available for Titans: R Sai Kishore, Vijay Shankar, Jayant Yadav, Abhinav Manohar

Subs available for Capitals: Lalit Yadav, Rovman Powell, Chetan Sakariya, Manish Pandey, Khaleel Ahmed

Playing XIs

Gujarat Titans: WP Saha (wk), Shubman Gill, B Sai Sudharsan, HH Pandya (capt), DA Miller, R Tewatia, Rashid Khan, JB Little, AS Joseph, Yash Dayal, Mohammed Shami

Delhi Capitals P Shaw, DA Warner (capt), MR Marsh, SN Khan, RR Rossouw, Aman Hakim Khan, AR Patel, Abishek Porel, Kuldeep Yadav, A Nortje, Mukesh Kumar

Toss: David Warner has the coin. Hardik Pandya calls correctly and Titans will bowl first.

David Miller comes in for Williamson, while Sai Sudharsan replaces Vijay Shankar. For Delhi, Rovman Powell makes way for Anrich Nortje, while Abishek Porel gets his maiden DC cap.

Pandya: Losing Kane, we are gutted as a team but more for him. We have to move on and Miller comes back for Kane, and Sai Sudharsan comes in for Vijay Shankar. We didn't play our best cricket, but we still won in the first game. We just tried to keep things simple. That's something we are focusing on.

Warner: Looks like a nice wicket. We have to come out with a positive intent and put up a good score. [Homeground] Its awesome and hopefully we can put a good score for the crowd. Rovman is out. Abiskeh Porel comes on. Having another left-hander is crucial . There have neem a few harsh calls. We need to bat better, bowl better and field better than the opposition.

Toss in ten minutes. Changes expected in both sides. Both Miller and Nortje are warming up. Titans will have to replace Williamson who has been ruled out of the IPL with a right knee injury he had sustained in the opening game of the tournament. He has head back home for further assessment.

Satyajeet : "There is a certain Australian who is commentating in this IPL. He is a potential replacement for KW "

Dave: "Reeza Hendricks as Kane's replacement. He is in red hot form. "

Glanny: "Travid Head should be a suitable option. Can be used at the top or as an floater. Has recent experience on Indian pitches and can bowl a few handy overs in desperate situations. "

Here's Aaron Finch with his pitch report: The dimensions are 64 metres either side and 70 metres down the ground. It is the centre wicket. Not a blade of grass when the Test was played here, but there is a nice even covering of grass. Unbelievably flat wicket and I expect there to be a little more seam and carry for the fast bowlers. There are a couple of parts on the wicket that are very dry, they are still hard, though and they will not have a huge influence. 165 is the average score here. The trend so far in the IPL has been to chase, but personally, I would not be against batting first, putting a big total and then put pressure on the teams.

6.50pm In other news, KKR's Shreyas Iyer and RCB's Rajat Patidar have been ruled out of IPL 2023. Iyer will undergo surgery on his injured back and will therefore miss the entire 2023 IPL, and the World Test Championship (WTC) final in June. Patidar has been ruled out because of a heel injury.

Nirmal: "@Kataria: Hold our Hello says Buttler and Jaiswal"

Bhavin: "Ashish - have any potential Kane Williamson replacements been lined up by Gujarat?" Nothing at the moment. What are the potential options? Let us know in the comments.

6.45pm David Miller and Anrich Nortje have been spotted on the outfield, smiling away. Miller should come in straight for Kane Williamson, you'd expect. Nortje's pace should come handy on this Delhi surface. But who does he replace is the question.

Kataria: "@Vasanth: Hello Says Virat and Faf!"

Vasanth: "@Shrikant: Hello says Ruturaj and Conway"

6.40pm There was a Test match played between India and Australia not long back at this venue, one that saw the ball turning square from the first session and collapses galore. Certainly, the surface for this game will be expected to be much better for batters. Both sides are also waiting to see if their South Africans will be available: David Miller, Lungi Ngidi and Anrich Nortje were on the same flights from Johannesburg to Delhi, via Dubai. All this and more, in Matt Roller's preview.

Arun: "Ashish any news about the other Pant joining the DC dugout today ?" There was a bit of chatter about that the other day, but nothing concrete at the moment. We'll have to wait and watch, I suppose.

Shrikant: "Mark my words - Warner and Shaw will be the most successful opening pair in this IPL "

You can also follow live commentary of this match in Hindi here

6.30pm Hello and welcome to Match No.7 of IPL 2023, where we have Delhi Capitals taking on Gujarat Titans as Delhi return to their home territory. Both teams have had contrasting starts to their campaign. While Titans got the better of Chennai Super Kings by five wickets in the opener, Capitals were decimated by Mark Wood's fiery five-for in Lucknow. Can Capitals stage a comeback at home or will the defending champions continue their winning spree? This is Ashish Pant, and S Sudarshanan will soon join me as we bring to you all the updates from the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Oh, cuts him into half! Zips into the batter, who shuffles across, and is beaten all ends up. Saha moves to his right and collects. Gill is shouting for Pandya to take the review, Saha is not sure. The ball seems to have hit the batters trousers.
Length ball sprayed down leg, called a wide.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Length that swings a lot outside of. He lets it go, and not called a wide.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Length ball just outside off, he comes down the track and then shoulders arms
preText: Goes around the wicket

text: Just past the diving keeper! Length ball that nips back in, but the radar is down leg. Called four runs, but the ball seems to have hit his thigh pads. Warner won't mind.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Good length ball on off and middle, he tickles it to the on-side. End of an eventful over.
postText: Arun Prakash: "such a beautiful high intense over messed up with extras"

text: Five wides now. Sprays the length ball well down leg. Saha can't do anything there.
preText: Over the wicket now

text: Short and wide to start off, he goes hard at it to get it to deep third, who collects it on the bounce.
preText: Joshua Little to share the new ball. Can he get the ball back into Shaw? Over the stumps.

text: Length ball that moves sharply back into Warner and catches him on the pads with the ball sliding down leg.
preText: Stays over the wicket. Two slips in place.

text: Some more swing, as the ball leaves the batter outside off. But that was a low full toss as Warner reaches for it and drives to covers, who misfields and concedes two runs.
Cuts him into half again! Back of a length ball on middle, he shapes up for the pull, and then checks his shot to eventually miss it.
Good length ball with a bit of a nibble away from Warner. He opens the face of the blade and plays it late past point.
Picks up a four now! Little gets that short and wide and Warner ain't missing out. Frees his arms and slams the cut past cover. Much more confident shot.
Short and enough width for Shaw to throw his hands at it. Gets a thick outside edge, but enough to clear deep  third.
Shami has not been able to control the swing today. On a length but strayed down leg, Saha dives to his left but can't rein it in.
preText: Two slips in place for Shami who is over the wicket

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Shaw, no run
text: Length on middle and leg, he flicks to the left of short midwicket, who dives to his left and saves important runs for his team.
Length that shapes back into Shaw, who looks to drive on the up, instead gets it off the inside-half of his bat through midwicket.
preText: One slip goes out

wkt_text: PP Shaw c Joseph b Mohammed Shami 7 (17m 5b 1x4 0x6) SR: 140.00
text: Short ball does the trick for Shami! Banged in short, and hurries Shaw, whose weight was forward. He still tries to got for the pull, but can only get a top-edge with the ball ballooning straight up for mid-on to take a comfortable catch.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Marsh, no run
text: Length ball with some swing but that was a quite a bit outside off. Marsh shoulders arms.
preText: Mitchell Marsh in at No.3. Was out for a golden duck in the previous game. One slip and a gully in place.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Marsh, no run
text: Length that skids through on off as Marsh defends back towards the bowler.
postText: Srikanth Pilla: "IPL misses the Warner jump. May be today is the day."

text: Good length ball that jags back into Warner, who is beaten for pace as he looks to slaps that away towards the on-side. Gets hit on the thigh pad. Appeal for lbw but that was high.
Back of a length ball outside off, he looks to shape for the cut but misses again.
On a length just on off. Warner gets across a touch and defends staunchly.
The nip-backer again from the good length area that hits Warner's splice of the bat as he pats towards point.
Goes fuller this time around does Little, closer to the stumps. Warner pushes towards mid-off. No runs so far off this over.

Oh, a high, high full toss that catches Warner by surprise. He looks to slog it away through the leg side, gets a thick outside edge as the ball hurries away to the deep third fence. Not called a no-ball and Warner has reviewed. That was just below the waist, so the on-field umpire's decision
Oh, SHOT! Marsh at his best. Good length ball just outside off, he punches through covers and finds the gap to perfection.
postText: Sankalp: "Warner looks woefully out of form. Missing out on some deliveries that he would have put away easily in his prime"

wkt_text: MR Marsh  b Mohammed Shami 4 (10m 4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: Cleans him up, and Shami has his second! Length ball with a bit of shape away from the batter. He looks to push through the off-side, without any foot movement and is caught on the crease. Can only manage a thick inside-edge as the ball rattles his off and middle poles.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Khan, no run
text: Length ball with a lot of shape away from the batter, who lets the ball go
preText: Sarfaraz Khan comes out now

text: Length outside off, he opens the face of the bat just a touch to get it down to deep third for a run.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Warner, no run
text: Full-length ball just outside off, he prods forward and pushes to covers.
Up and over! Length ball but there was room for Warner and he carves the ball over point to collect four more runs. This will give him much more confidence.
preText: Tanay: "The decision to take DRS on No-ball and wide calls is very tricky, there is no Umpire's call. So, that increases the risk of losing the review compared to LBW and other dismissal calls."
postText: Arjun: "Yes, Warner isn't batting like he used to, but the constant fall of wickets from other end is not helping him either."

text: Gentle loosener to start off. Was a length ball on the pads of Sarfaraz as he works it to deep third.
preText: swathi: "Surprised that Hardik didnt open the bowling. Saving himself for WC 23? But they have their formula pat down - Shami getting wickets in powerplay and Rashid squeezing them in middle." Here's Hardik

text: Short, but there isn't pace from the surface for Hardik. Sits up for Warner, who pulls it handsomely through square leg.
Length ball with a hint of shape outside off. He defends towards mid-off.
Short of a good length outside off, he opens the face of the bat to scythe this one to deep point.
Back of a length ball on off stump. Sarfaraz clips it to midwicket.
preText: Afeef: "I see that DC are holding back Rossouw just to maintain the left-right combo with Warner batting... But Rossouw should be batting higher up, he can cause a lot of damage"

text: The extras counter continues to grow! Good length ball that was slanting down leg. Sarfaraz was looking for a glance, instead the ball hits his thigh pad and races away to the deep fine leg fence.
postText: AJ: "@Tanay - Also risk/reward ratio does not justify taking reviews for noballs and especially for wides unless it is a crunch situation."

text: Back of a length ball to start off on off. Warner mistimes his punch to cover.
preText: Here's some more pace. Alzarri Joseph comes on now from over the wicket. No slips.

text: Still can't find the gaps, can Warner. Back of a length ball outside off, he pushes it to mid-off.
Gets the length he was waiting for and cashes in. Fuller outside off, was right in Warner's arc and he just lofts it over mid-off. A couple of bounces and into the fence.
Top shot! Just a bit of width and that's all Waner wants. Short of a length ball outside off, he does not over-hit it, just places the cut to the right of point.
Fuller but the line is again down leg. Warner lets it go. Another wide.
Length on off, he pushes it to extra cover.

Goes fine, and that is some excellent work at the deep fine leg fence from Little. Length on the pads of Warner, who glances it fine, but Little puts in a full-length dive to his left and saves a few crucial runs.
Back of a length just outside off, he pats it towards point and sets off, only to be sent back. He isn't impressed. Warner comes down to have word.
Another short of a length ball on the hips of Sarfaraz, who helps it towards deep backward square leg.
Good length ball that tucks Warner up a touch. He works it away to deep midwicket for a run.
On a length just outside off, he taps it to point.
Length on off, he pushes with softs hands towards deep midwicket, but they can only take a run.
preText: IPL Super selec: "I like the Sarfaraz of the debut season. Nonchalant and innovative. "

text: Banged in short once more from Pandya, that is met by a fierce pull from Warner, but deep midwicket is in place.
postText:
Time-out time

Abhishek: "DC batsmen look extremely dodgy again today. 14 runs are from extra and couple of boundaries from edges. Warner is scoring - yes but that strike rate isn't impressive. DC will have to score at least 190-200 to remain in the game which seems highly unlikely right now. Titans game to lose this!"

text: On a length just outside off that is patted towards point.
preText:
Joseph continues.

Khan: "Bring Rashid and kill this partnership."

Samarth: "This adherence to left and right hand batting combo in the middle has cost many matches to Delhi in the past, I hope they drop this strategy and send the best batsmen first and not keep them for later. "

wkt_text: DA Warner  b Joseph 37 (48m 32b 7x4 0x6) SR: 115.62
text: Warner plays on and it's that angled bat that once again has brought about his downfall! On a length just outside off, was 145.5kph that delivery. He shapes for the cut, but the ball is quite close to him. Evetually, a thick inside-edge is all he gets that clatters into his stumps. Delight for Joseph, dismay for Warner.

wkt_text: RR Rossouw c Tewatia b Joseph 0 (4m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: Oh, what a snorter of a delivery first up, and has Tewatia pulled off a blinder at point? Yes,s he has! Banged in short with the line shoulder-high. Rossouw was not expecting this first ball. Fends at it awkwardly with the ball going to point. Tewatia dives forward and seems to have picked put a beauty. The third umpire has been called for, and he deems that has carried clearly into Tewatia's hands. Joseph bowled that at 146kph and Rossouw had no answers.
preText: Here's Rilee Rossouw

text: SO close to getting that hat-trick. Back of a length ball on the pads of Porel, who clips it uppishly towards mid-on, who just can't come in quick enough.
preText: On a hat-trick. Porel on debut has a task up his sleeve. Short leg in place.

text: Back of  a length ball outside off, he opens the face of the bat through point

Banged in short and the ball thuds into Sarfaraz's helmet lobbing straight up. Saha races across the turf to catch the ball, that dropped just behind where short-leg would have been stationed. He drops it, but there was no bat on it. Concussion test on now. Serious pace from Joseph and Sarfaraz was late on the pull.
Back of a length ball outside off, he cuts it hard to deep point.
Full-length ball just on and around off, as he pushes towards extra cover.
Short, wide and Sarfaraz gets that important four. Does not cut it too hard, simply places it past point for a four.
preText: Nick: "Alzarri Joseph quietly becoming a world class bowler…"

text: On a length on the pads of Sarfaraz who flicks it to deep midwicket.
Goes short again to Porel, who swivel-pulls nicely to the right of deep backward square leg.
Another pull as Hardik goes short to Sarfaraz who pulls to long leg.
postText: NethraReya: "Shami and Joseph competing for the best over of the IPL in the same match."

text: On a length outside off, patted to point.
Length on middle stump that is flayed away to deep backward square leg by Sarfaraz Khan.
Back of a length ball on the hips of Porel who works it to deep fine leg, where Little does so well once again diving full-length to his left.

Oh, that would have been one of the catches of the tournament, but Dayal couldn't keep himself in. Short and wide, he slams the cut towards deep third, where Dayal plucks out a stunner with his right hand. But ends up trotting over the ropes.

shortText: Joseph to Abishek Porel, no run
text: That has hit him flush on the helmet. Porel wouldn't have faced such pace. Banged in short, with the line on point. The left-hander is late on the pull and the ball smacks into his helmet. The pyhsio is out to tend to him and the concussion test is on. Some concerning faces, but think Porel is fine. Yep, he is.
postText: Rishabh Pant is watching the game and there is a loud and there is a loud applause as he is shown on the giant screen.

text: Banged in short, he helps it to long leg.

shortText: Yash Dayal to Abishek Porel, 1 run
text: On a length outside off, he pushes back to the bowler with a full face of the bat. The ball hits the bowler's boot and ricochets to Hardik, who has a shy at the stumps. Porel was struggling but would have made it.
preText: Yash Dayal into the attack

text: Dropped by Little running back form mid-on. In the slot for the batter, who looks to go too hard at it, ends up lofting it straight up. Little covers good ground but fails to hold on. Once he reached the ball, he would have liked to hang on, but Little at no point seemed comfortable under the catch.
Length on middle and leg, he works it to deep square leg.

shortText: Yash Dayal to Abishek Porel, 1 run
text: On a length just outside off, he works it towards deep point with an open face
On a length outside off, he pushes towards covers

shortText: Yash Dayal to Abishek Porel, SIX
text: Nails the pull and slams Dayal over deep midwicket! Banged in short, but Dayal is not as quick. Porel gets into position nice and early and creams it up and over. Excellent hit.
Just a tad short on the pads of the batter who goes down on one knee and works it to deep backward square leg.
preText: Rashid into the attack in the 13th over

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abishek Porel, OUT
wkt_text: Abishek Porel  b Rashid Khan 20 (25m 11b 0x4 2x6) SR: 181.81
text: Takes two balls to create an impact! What a bowler, what a cricketer! Fuller, bowled at 94.3kph. Porel plays all around it, and sees his stumps in a mess. Was nowhere near it. Lost his balance, lost his footwork. Can't keep Rashid out of the game for too long.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Patel, no run
text: Flatter on middle, pushed back to the bowler
preText: Here's Axar Patel. Rashid is over the wicket. One slip, leg slip, short leg. I thought the Test match was two weeks ago

text: Long-hop and duly punished. Just on off, as Axar goes back and pulls him past mid-on.
Full-length ball outside off, he pushes it to mid-off.
Huge top-edge but falls safely. Full-length ball outside off, he sweeps it, gets a top-edge but the falls short of the incoming fielder from deep backward square leg.
postText: Shaheer: "The thing I really love about Rashid Khan is that he doesn't care if it's a right-handed batsman or left-handed. He's equally good against either."

text: Good length ball just outside off, patted to point.
preText: Breaking: Dasun Shanaka replaces Kane Williamson in the Titans squad.

text: Back of a length ball on off, was 145.3 kph, he looks to hoick it away, gets a thick inside-edge onto his pads with the ball going towards the on-side
Back of a length ball on the hips of Axar, bowled at 148.3kph. The batter clips it to short leg.
preText: Stays over the wicket to Axar. Short leg in place.

text: Good length ball on the leg stump. Axar pushes it back to the bowler.
Another short of a length ball into the body of Axar, 140kph that. He plays that with soft hands towards short leg. Played that very well did Axar, getting nucely on top of the bounce.
Short, wide and Axar cuts it fiercely through covers for a scorching boundary. That will give him some confidence. End of an excellent spell from Joseph.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Khan, no run
text: Legspinner outside off, he cuts it straight to backward point
Flatter, shorter length ball on off. He goes low and slaps it towards long leg.
Another flattish length ball on off that is pushed to long off for a run
preText: NethraReya: "Shanaka is a great signing for Titans, great finisher and an useful bowler too."

shortText: Rashid Khan to Khan, no run
text: A touch slower now on off, he clips it to short midwicket

Goes down on one knee and nails the sweep to deep backward square leg, where Little does well again diving to his left. Oops, Sarfaraz and Rashid have a collision with both players ball-watching. All okay, though
Oh, that's a shot-and-a-half! Axar has been in stunning form of late and he is showing his prowess here. In the slot for him on middle, and he crunches it over wide long on for a mammoth six.
Ooh, looks to take him on right away. Was a length ball just outside off, he clears his front leg, looking to smash him straight over. Misses.
preText: Little back

text: Banged in short, Sarfaraz eyes the pull but is a bit hurried by the pace. Clogs his pull over midwicket.
Short and very wide, he throws his hands at it, get it off the cue end of the bat to deep third.
Banged in short on the hips of Axar, who helps it to deep backward square leg. There is a bit of a misfield, but no harm done.
Back of a length ball on off, he drags it to deep midwicket. Loses his shape a touch there.
Short of a good length ball outside off, he dabs it to point with an open face of the blade.
postText:
Time-out

Mohit: "With this form Axar deserve a spot in the Indian world cup XI over Jadeja." That will make for a compelling debate.

Nimesh: "Hope I do not jinx it, but Axar has improved his batting skills a lot in a last year or so. Even in the recent test series, he stayed not out and contributed important runs. "

text: Length ball outside off, he reaches for it with the sweep and slams it in front of square for a four to deep midwicket.
preText: Here's Rajesh: DC have scored 38 out of 126 runs off the last ball the overs. That's 30% of the total from a sixth (or less) of the total balls bowled

wkt_text: SN Khan c Little b Rashid Khan 30 (66m 34b 2x4 0x6) SR: 88.23
text: Goes for a sweep again, gets a top-edge and Little makes no mistake at deep backward square leg. Slightly slower through the air, outside off. He lines up for that sweep, but can only mistime it this time around. The ball goes high up and Little, I think misjudged the catch initially, but held on.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Aman Hakim Khan, no run
text: On a length outside off, gets it off the inside half of the blade towards the midwicket fielder
preText: Aman Hakim Khan in. One slip in.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run
text: On a length on the pads of Aman, who heaves it to Little at long leg

shortText: Rashid Khan to Patel, no run
text: Length on off, he goes back and punches it back to the bowler
Flatter and on the pads of the batter, who glances it to short fine leg.
postText: Sahil: "@Mohit jadeja recently got a POTM in the first ODI against Australia. This might sound outrageous but Axar could maybe solve the number 4 problem"

text: Banged in short on off, he hacks it to long on

shortText: Little to Aman Hakim Khan, no run
text: Banged in short again, outside off. He backs away, looking to ramp it, but misses.

shortText: Little to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run
text: Good length ball outside off, he gives himself room and pushes towards cover. The fielder has a shy at the stumps, misses and a run is conceded via an overthrow,
preText: Rohit: "DC should sub Shaw for Pandey, try getting some lower order runs plus a much better fielder for the second innings!"

text: Going, going, gone! Right in Axar's wheel-house outside off. He extends his arms and lofts Little over mid-off and eventually over the ropes.
Back of a length ball on the hips of Axar as he works it to deep fine leg.

shortText: Little to Aman Hakim Khan, no run
text: In the slot on middle, he gives himself room and gets a good piece on the flourishing cover drive but hits it straight to extra cover.
Legspinner on middle, he looks for a mighty slog, drags it to deep midwicket. Wants two, not on.
preText: Anvit: "I understand that wickets were falling around but Sarfaraz's innings was just too slow. Warner is already scoring too slowly, DC can't really afford another slow player. Maybe Manish Pandey should get a look in next match."

shortText: Rashid Khan to Aman Hakim Khan, no run
text: Another legbreak and this one grips and turns. He can only slice to point

shortText: Rashid Khan to Aman Hakim Khan, SIX
text: Gets holds of the slog sweep and absolutely clobbers Rashid over deep square leg. In the slot on middle and leg, he clears his front leg and gets a six

shortText: Rashid Khan to Aman Hakim Khan, OUT
wkt_text: Aman Hakim Khan c Pandya b Rashid Khan 8 (10m 8b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100.00
text: Nope, not happening twice, says Rashid! Legbreak with a hint of over-spin on the ball. Was just on and around off. He looks for a slog sweep second time around, gets a massive top-edge as the ball goes straight up. Pandya completes a catch at extra cover.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run
text: Runs down the track first ball, gets a thick inside edge past the bowler for a run
preText: Kuldeep

text: Slightly short on middle and spinning onto leg as Axar hacks the pull to the right of Tewatia who runs across from deep backward square leg. They only take a run. Axar wants to keep strike.
Short and wide, and Axar hammers it over wide long-on. That was asking to be it and Axar obliged.
preText: Shami to bowl the last over. Third man and fine leg up.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Patel, no run
text: Back of a length ball on the hips of Axar who pulls it to deep square leg. No run taken.
preText: Goes around

text: Gives himself room as Shami bowls this slower on leg. He muscles it straight down the ground to long on

wkt_text: AR Patel c Miller b Mohammed Shami 36 (33m 22b 2x4 3x6) SR: 163.63
text: On a length outside off and Axar hits it straight to David Miller at deep cover. Was in Axar's slot, but he was a touch legside and slightly off-balanced when looking to cream that away. Does not get enough connection and Miller gobbles it up.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Nortje, no run
text: Short, pacy delivery on off. He backs away, looking for a cut. Misses
preText: Nortje

text: Swatted straight back over mid-off and Delhi have breached 160! Hard-length again from Shami as Nortje runs down the track, gives himself room and slams it.
postText:
Here's Sarfaraz: It has been raining in Delhi over the last few days, so the outfield has changed, and there was grass on the surface and some movement. There is uneven bounce too. Not very easy for the batters. We need early wickets. Good score on this surface. We need to bowl well with the new ball. A little bit of dew. But we need to play good cricket.

9.21pm A middling total at best from Delhi, but they have something and the surface has looked spicy. They finish on 162 for 8, the lowest total so far in the IPL for a team batting first. Delhi's batters did not have the best of days. None of them could get in, bar maybe Axar Patel who scored 36 off 22 balls. David Warner was lucky for his 32-ball 37 while Sarfaraz had a tough day as he scored 30 off 34. The Titans bowlers were on the mark all through the innings. There was a lot of movement available early on, that caused a few extras, but the bowlers came back well. Mohammed Shami and Rashid Khan picked three wickets apiece. Alzarri Joseph was at his fiery best picking 2 for 29, and was on a hat-trick at one point. Can the Delhi pacers rattle the Titans batting unit? Join Sudarshanan in a bit to find out.

text: Angling away on a length outside off, Saha has a slash but misses. Porel doesn't collect that cleanly.
preText:
Shubman Gill and Wriddhiman Saha are out to open for Titans. Khaleel Ahmed comes in as the Impact Player for Sarfaraz Khan. And straightaway, Khaleel has the ball in hand. Is he warmed up enough? Simon Katich on air suggests that he was getting the ball to swing in ahead of the game during practice. Here he goes, over the wicket. A wide slip in

9:33pm Welcome back! What do we have in store for us in Delhi? Before we get into it right away here are a couple of things for you:

Try out ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

If you are seeing this on a mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

text: Full and straight on off and middle, defends it towards point off the front foot.
Oh pure timing! Length ball angling away, it was wide outside off. Saha stands tall and slaps it through cover-point. Not trying to hit it too hard.
preText: PV: "The best news coming (something i had very much hoped for) -- GT sign Dasun Shanaka for Williamson! "

text: And now Saha goes over mid-off! This is full and outside off, easy pickings. He clears his front leg and lofts it well over the fielder in the ring.
Full and outside off, driven straight to mid-off.
preText: Slip goes out to cover.

text: My word, has he struck it well! Length ball around off and middle, Saha picks the length early. Has it gone the distance? They are checking for that, looks to have cleared the ropes. Massive strike that, excellent start to the chase for Titans.
preText: Chandan : "Who is keeping now For DC?" Abishek Porel

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: Gill is in SOME touch! That is on a length outside off, not too short, not too wide. Enough, though, for Gill to slap it through cover-point.
preText: Mukesh Kumar to run in from the other end. Slip is back.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: Lands it on a length around off, no movement off the deck or in the air. Gill defends it back.
preText: Gill standing just outside his crease.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: Fullish around off and middle, keeps it out to the on side.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: Beauty! And Gill is no beast. This is all timing. Length ball outside off, he stands tall and just places it to the left of short cover. Pure timing, all elegance.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: Good comeback. Lands it on a length on the sixth-stump line, has Gill poking at it and getting beaten.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: Angles it in on a length on middle and leg, tucks it to midwicket. Not a bad start from Mukesh.

wkt_text: WP Saha  b Nortje 14 (9m 7b 2x4 1x6) SR: 200.00
text: Roaring start in IPL 2023 for Nortje! A 143 kph missile slanting in to Saha, cramps him for room and does him for pace. It is the nip-backer. Saha hops and looks to defend but gets beaten on the inside. The ball goes off his pads and disturbs the stumps. Titans lose their first.
preText: Anrich Nortje is making his first IPL appearance this season. Now has the ball in hand. Taking his time to get the field right with captain Warner. Saha is on strike. Third and fine leg out in the deep, a slip in.

text: Fullish and angling in, flicks it towards midwicket to get going.
preText: B Sai Sudharsan walks in at No. 3. Three slips are waiting as Nortje comes in from around the stumps.

shortText: Nortje to Shubman Gill, no run
text: Length ball in line of the stumps, defends it towards mid-on. Was a tad aerial.
preText: Darshan: "Question to Sudarshanan: If left to you, would you genuinely pick someone like Khaleel Ahmed or Tushar Deshpande as your impact player for a crunch IPL game?" Not really bad choices given what the respective teams want in terms of skill. With experience, they will get to where we want them to be.

text: Misses out on the full toss! !47.9kph on the stumps, pushes it straight and hares to the other end before mid-on gets around.
preText: Free hit...

shortText: Nortje to Shubman Gill, (no ball) FOUR
text: Wrists, all wrists! Shortish around off, Gill stays on the back foot and just whips it past midwicket. What's worse, Nortje has overstepped.
Full and around off, pushes it towards mid-on for a quick one.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Shubman Gill, 1 run

preText: Usman Hayat: "@sudarshanan7 could you elaborate what has happened to Sarfaraz Khan in T20s, he was a commendable batter at the earlier part of his career. Though, still making huge impact in domestic circuit through top-notch performance." I think tonight he was batting in a situation he is perhaps not used to in recent times. And the surface didn't seem to be the best for strokeplay. Plus he is coming back from an injury.

wkt_text: Shubman Gill  b Nortje 14 (19m 13b 3x4 0x6) SR: 107.69
text: Jaffa! Nortje is well and truly making his presence in the IPL! It is a fireball at 148.8 kph. Gill, even in the excellent form that he is in, has no answer to that. It was speared in on a length around off, jags back in a touch. Gill was on the back foot and looks to defend but is beaten by the movement and is knocked over.
What a shot! Audacity at its very best. Fast and full at 144.2 kph on off. Sudharsan walks across and scoops it high and long over fine leg. Inventive strokeplay at its best.
preText: Free hit for Sudharsan now. The field can change because it is a new batter on strike. Around the wicket he comes.

text: Off the mark with a single. Back of a length outside off, he stands back and glides it towards short third to get going. 148.2 kph, but he has overstepped.

preText: Tsar: "After watching many the Indian batters struggle against sheer pace bowlers, I can say that Gaikwad is one of the few who gets more comfortable the faster the ball gets." Too early for the first half but Gaikwad has looked good, yes.

text: Banges in short and outside off, Sudharsan hops and looks to slash. It swerves in after it passes him and Porel fails to gather that. Given as runs but replays show that there was no edge.
Full and outside off, gets forward and drives it to mid-off.

And he is greeted with a four! Full and on off, Sudharsan gets forward and flicks it through midwicket. No stopping that. 50 up for Titans.

Which means he is the Impact Player for Titans. Mitchell Marsh has the ball in hand. Around the wicket to the left-hander with no slips in.

preText: Shane Watson to the broadcaster: "We have come back very well after a not so great start. In the IPL it is about creating your fortress and the way this ground is, it is small and we need to convert it into a fortress. Sourav is doing a nice job, has a great knowledge of cricket. It is a good score and we got to take wickets. The key is to take wickets to give ourselves the best chance of defending it."

Gets to a half-century in style! How impressive has B Sai Sudharsan been tonight. Back of a length just outside off, he hops and ramps it over the wicketkeeper. Almost went the distance. Jussssst bounces in front of the boundary cushion.

preText: Marsh to bowl what could be the last over of the game. Around the stumps.
postText:
Two wins in two, then, for defending champs Titans! That's all we have for you. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. On behalf of Thilak, Ashish, this is Sudarshanan signing off. Good night, take care!

11:38pm Time for the presentation.

Hardik Pandya, Titans captain: "It was little funny at the start. We didn't know what was happening but something was happening. We gave away 15-20 runs more in the powerplay. [On his captaincy] It is my instinct. I like to back myself. I'd rather back me and fall down than taking others' decision. I'd rather land the first punch than take the first punch. We tell the boys to enjoy. It will help to take us right decisions and someone takes us through periods when needed. Whatever happens it is okay but be out happy out there and take care of each other. [Sudharsan] He has been batting beautifully. You can see the fruit of his hard work. In two years he will do something big in franchise cricket and hopefully for India."

B Sai Sudharsan, Player of the Match: "Thanks for backing me, a little nervous. First time here. I was thinking about what has to be done right, was not under pressure. It was a little bit low and skidding low. My turn was to take the game deep. It was about weathering the storm early on, because it was seaming early on."

Sampath Bandarupalli has looked at David Miller's numbers for Gujarat Titans in run-chases: 351 runs at a strike rate of 155!

David Miller, Titans batter: "Didn't have time to get jeglagged. We were within range. It was a matter of three sixes or four fours. But a lot can happen if we leave it for too late. We started well last year, got good momentum. We got mature cricketers in the middle order. Good start gives us a good platform. Very relaxed environment on and off the field."

David Warner, Capitals captain: "It swung more than I anticipated. Losing wickets in the powerplay can be struggle. They showed how to adapt to the situation and it is a learning for us. We have got six more games here and anticipate the swing upfront. They bowled extremely well. We were in the game but Sai batted extremely well and David Miller took it away. [On not using Axar Patel's bowling] Just purely because of the wicket and the match-ups. We thought Kuldeep would be effective and had Mitch Marsh."

Deep: "Very impressed with Sai's batting. I sometimes feel India can play with 2 teams and still be competitive in world cricket. Guys like Rutu, Sai. Future looks very bright"

Samrat Ahuja: "Tenth win chasing in the IPL out of 11 games! : one match they lost, was to Mumbai..chasing only 8 runs in last over and managed to lose!! Should have been a perfect record!"

Rutvik: "The MoM should be Alzarri Joseph imo. DC never recovered from the shock of losing Warner and Roussouw on consecutive bowls. They couldn't capitalize even though they still had 4 more batters and a lot more overs." Fair shout

Gyan : "IPL has started to look more exciting but boring as well same time. Impact player is interesting but 4 hours every match is boring. "

Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: RR and now GT are the only sides to win matches on away venue this season. The Finalists from the last season are continuing exactly from where they left !!"

11:22pm Titans register their tenth win chasing in the IPL out of 11 games! And this has been a canter. The handshakes and hugs in the dugout are as relaxed as they could be. And it is a win that was designed mainly by their bowlers. Rashid and Shami picked up three wickets apiece with Joseph making his presence felt with a couple. Capitals could only puff to 162 and that was hardly going to challenge this Titans line-up. Despite losing three wickets inside the powerplay, Titans never stopped attacking and put up 54. The young and impressive Sai Sudharsan ensured that Titans get home without major hiccups.

text: full and swinging in toward middle at 134 kph, punched off a thick inside edge caroming off the pad back down the pitch past the non-striker for one to mid-on.
preText:
7.29 pm Kyle Mayers has the new ball in hand. Slightly delayed start because a dog has run out onto the outfield... A mission by one person has now been joined by six ground staff members, the umpires and several players to try to usher it off the field but the dog is being extremely stubborn. However, the fans in the ground don't seem to mind. They're cheering the dog on wholeheartedly. MS Dhoni has a smile on his face watching it all unfold, as does Jadeja and Moeen Ali. The crowd has started chanting, "Doggy! Doggy! Doggy!" Give it a few more minutes and there will soon be a corporate sponsor for the dog. After a five-minute delay, we'll finally have the first ball.

7.01 pm The news is that Lucknow Super Giants have won the toss and will field first.

One change for LSG. Unadkat comes out and Yash Thakur comes in. CSK are unchanged.

Meanwhile Ben Stokes has had this to say down on the field when interviewed on TV: "Everything is coming on nicely. I feel like I've worked really hard to get to the place where I am at the moment with my knee. I think I might be able to turn the arm over tonight."

LSG XI: 1 KL Rahul (capt.), 2 Kyle Mayers, 3 Deepak Hooda, 4 Krunal Pandya, 5 Marcus Stoinis, 6 Nicholas Pooran (wk), 7 K Gowtham, 8 Avesh Khan, 9 Ravi Bishnoi, 10 Yash Thakur, 11 Mark Wood.

CSK XI: 1 Devon Conway, 2 Ruturaj Gaikwad, 3 Moeen Ali, 4 Ben Stokes, 5 Ambati Rayudu, 6 Shivam Dube, 7 Ravindra Jadeja, 8 MS Dhoni (capt/wk), 9 Mitchell Santner, 10 Deepak Chahar, 11 Rajvardhan Hangargekar.

6.30 pm Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live coverage of today's encounter in the 2023 Indian Premier League as the Chennai Super Kings host the Lucknow Super Giants. I'm Peter Della Penna and will be captaining the commentary ship solo throughout today's contest. To help set the scene for today's match, check out the match preview from Vishal Dikshit.

Karthik: "What are we waiting for?!! Let's GO! It's "Dhhoonnnii Dhonnii" time at the Chepauk! It's not about the match today, it's about the crazy emotions that flow like a huge wave! We don't know how much of it is left, but we'll take it all the same! "

Speaking of which, the Muthu brothers (yes, Alagappan and Deivarayan are related by blood) have penned this piece about relishing whatever time is left of the Dhoni era with CSK inside of Chepauk.

text: length ball on seventh stump at 122 kph, goes to cut and skids a touch low under the shot.
postText: Sundar: "Didn't this just happen in the IndvAus ODI!. This is ridiculous. Once is cute. Happening again now is unprofessional by the ground staff." Spoken like man's best... enemy! Cruella de Vil has a new ally!

text: 125 kph good length ball seaming way outside off, wide called as the keeper collects in front of slip.

text: good length ball on fourth stump, punched away through cover for one.

text: full and wide yorker length on the guideline at 127 kph, goes to jam this out through point but an inside edge goes through fine leg for one.

text: full on middle at 132 kph, flicked through midwicket for what should be two but a fumble by the boundary rider turns it into three. No ball called by the on field umpire on an overstep and a free hit is coming up for Conway. Confusion here now. No ball was clearly called on field but apparently has been rescinded by the third umpire. Bizarre.

full and swinging well down leg past a flick at 132 kph. No chance for the keeper and it goes for five wides. KL Rahul has called for a review thinking it has come off the pads and should be a legal delivery. He's going to lose this. Definite gap between bat and pad. The crowd is going bonkers as nothing is showing up on UltraEdge. Who knew that a review for wides could whip the crowd into a frenzy.
postText: RK Dubai : "If the dog bites one of the fielders, can the team ask for a dog-bite substitute player (similar to concussion)?" Questions we never knew we needed answered.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Conway, no run
text: good length ball on off, defended.
length ball angled across sixth stump at 134 kph, slapped behind square through point to the rope.
well that's a doggone spectacular cover drive! Overpitched on fifth stump, strokes this beautifully through the gap at extra cover to the rope.
postText: Sunny: "Taking a review for a wide in the second over is not at all a wise decision for a captain"

shortText: Avesh Khan to Conway, no run
text: back of a length at 136 kph on fifth stump seaming away, goes to cut and misses.
good length ball on fifth stump at 132 kph, pushes this and runs for a tight single to mid-off.
postText: Nandagopal: "I can't remember the last time a no ball was called by the on-field umpire! " I see it all the time at Associate level ODIs/T20Is where there is no third umpire assistance. But yes, for TV matches it has basically become obsolete.

text: length ball at 127 kph on fourth stump, tap and run into the covers for one.
full and wide, just uses the pace to guide this with an open face through point to the rope.

text: back of a length on the hips, flicked through midwicket for one.
postText: Meanwhile, PV Sindhu was humbled in her first BWF series final of 2023 on Sunday. It was a record loss, but there is a bright silver lining to it all - Sindhu is showing just enough signs that she's on her way back to the top. Ahead of the Asian Games and the Paris Olympics, this final appearance could be a very crucial learning.
