text: take a bow wow wowwwwwww! Comes down the track with elegant footwork to drive a full ball on sixth stump high and wide over the extra cover rope. He's struck it so clean he's nailed the back driver side door of the sponsor car on the platform above the boundary. There's a huge dent in it now.

Strategic timeout called. This is CSK's highest ever Powerplay score at Chepauk. The previous best was 75.

AdiCan: "A big round of A-Paws to all the dog puns. As entertaining as CSK innings so far!"

postText: What MS Dhoni is to Chennai is what Ivan Vukomanovic is becoming to Kerala. It's this fervent support that has seen the Kerala Blasters coach give one of the all-time great non-apologetic apologies after one of the most controversial moments Indian sport has seen in recent times.

text: length ball outside leg stump at 143 kph, Jadeja goes to pull and skies this to deep midwicket. Simple catch taken by Bishnoi jogging in from the rope before settling on his knees 10 yards in for a catch on his haunches.
preText: Wood to bowl the last over. But not before Ayush Badoni is signaled by the umpire to be brought on the field as an Impact Player in place of Avesh Khan.
postText: Enormous roars at the fall of the wicket. It's not often that you hear home fans going out of their minds when one of their own players gets out. But it's because MS Dhoni is striding to the crease. The fans are positively rabid right now going berserk for Thala.

text: the fans are barking mad now! Length ball on eighth stump, slashed over wide deep third man and clears the rope. What a noise in Chepauk with Dhoni getting off the mark with a maximum.

back-to-back! And into the upper deck over square leg! Wood challenges Dhoni with a bouncer on sixth stump, Dhoni fetches this, chews it up and spits the bone back out 30 yards over the leg side rope.
postText: Abhilash: "GRAND DADDY of DOG is here! WOOOF!! WOOFF!"

wkt_text: MS Dhoni c Ravi Bishnoi b Wood 12 (6m 3b 0x4 2x6) SR: 400.00
text: Dhoni's innings is short and sweet! Length ball wide outside off on the guideline, tries to repeat his first ball slash over third man for six but comes off the toe and swirls to Bishnoi coming in off the sweeper rope for his second catch of the over, taken on his knees 10 yards in from the rope.
postText: "C-S-K! C-S-K!" Chant breaks out as Santner arrives.

text: length ball on fifth stump slapped to long-off for one.
postText: Ketan: "Remind me.. Why did this guy retire?"

text: length ball on sixth stump, heaves a pull to deep square leg and they jog a single.
postText:
9.23 pm CSK end on 217 for 7, and yet somehow their last 10 overs were slower than their first 10. The home crowd certainly got their money's worth for this innings. Can LSG chase this down? Stay tuned for the start of the chase.

CSK opener Devon Conway: "I think it was a great start for us tonight. The way Rutu played in that first six was pretty special and he took the pressure off me. He's sneaky strong. He times the ball and holds his shape really well, and he uses good bats. I think the slower ball into the wicket might be a good option for us, pace off and being unpredictable. I also felt for the spinners, some skidded on and some held up. It's a very special feeling [at Chepauk]. When I got here earlier, the crowd was special. They were pretty loud and it just creates a great atmosphere. Seeing MS Dhoni walk out there and do what he did and hearing the crowd is pretty special so it's good to be playing here in front of our fans. He said to go out, express yourself, enjoy, have fun and entertain."

For the IPL stats mavens out there, Dhoni completed 5,000 career IPL runs in his brief but belligerent innings.

Abhisek daga: "The way the entire chennai dressing room celebrated after dhoni hit the second six was just goosebumps written all over it... fantastic stuff..."

text: back of a length on sixth stump, punched to cover for none.
preText: Deepak Chahar has the new ball in hand. The second Impact Player sub has been made. Ambati Rayudu comes out and Tushar Deshpande comes in for CSK.

text: back of a length on fourth stump, defended to cover for none.
full and swinging away sharply on eighth stump, Rahul flays this high over extra cover but it dribbles short of the rope and Gaikwad chases it down to keep it to two.
short of a length and seaming in at 126 kph, pulled firmly through square leg to the rope.
preText: Deep third man comes in and a cover sweeper goes out.
postText: kalpesh: "Rayudu will like this season as in his early childhood. batting karo and enjoy.. no need to field"

text: full and swinging away on fifth stump at 130 kph, driven to a cover sweeper for one.
back of a length on middle, goes back to defend and some extra bounce gets Mayers in the gloves.
130 kph delivery lands back of a length on the legs, flicked wide of deep fine leg for two.
preText: Well, Ben Stokes said ahead of the game he felt good enough to bowl. He's true to his word. Taking the new ball for the second over. Wearing some very mean looking black spikes.

text: 131 kph back of a length on off, tapped through cover for one.
postText: Arun: "And just like that, within three days, the impact player rule has become an extremely predictable batsman vs bowler replacement at the end of an innings. Its really just a 12-player match with 10 wickets per innings." In baseball, Ambati Rayudu would be called what's known as a Designated Hitter, or DH for short. Someone who bats in place of a pitcher, who does not bat.

text: length ball on sixth stump at 131 kph, Mayers slices a cut high over point to the rope. As loud as the crowd was 25 minutes ago when Dhoni was in the middle, you can almost hear a pin drop now.
134 kph fullish length ball on fifth stump, laces a drive high over the non-striker down the ground to the mid-off rope.
133 kph delivery lands full on sixth stump, winds up and crunches this high and deep over wide long-off.
full on the legs, flicked into midwicket for one.
postText: Venkat: "Is there any reason why teams bowling first introduce their impact player during the last over of the innings?" If you've got a bowler who has bowled four overs and is a weak fielder, why not get him off the field in place of a better fielder who will also bat?

text: good length slower ball on middle, Mayers through the shot a touch early and chips this up softly but barely clears Chahar before falling short of mid-on for none.
length ball on sixth stump at 132 kph, punches this in the air at a catchable height but floats in the gap between cover and extra cover to the rope.
postText: Ishan Jain: "If this rule had been in place in International games, a few names immediately popup in my head would be substituted - Inzy/Ranatunga (quite obvious), Shoaib Akhtar (to save his energy), Chris Martin (his batting prowess), and most importantly Glenn McGrath for Brad Hodge."

text: fullish length slower ball on fifth stump at 116 kph, Mayers waves in front of this a touch early and it beats him through to Dhoni.
short on off, swivels to pull this crisply through square leg to the rope.
postText: Neeraj: "American Baseball has 2 leagues (National League) NL and AL (American League). Designated Hitter (DH) rule in baseball does not exist in NL only AL. Will there be a DH depends on who the home is NL or DL" Buzzzzzzz!!!! Wrong answer. That used to be the rule but it was changed two years ago to make the NL also have the DH in place. So the DH is universal in Major League Baseball now.

text: short and wide, too wide for Mayers to reach, wide called.
tries to angle in a yorker on fourth stump but it doesn't pitch and Mayers pokes this 129 kph delivery at shin height in the gap between mid-off and extra cover to the rope.
preText: Chahar switches around the stumps.

text: another shin high full toss this time on seventh stump at 114 kph, but this time Chahar gets away with it punching straight to cover on the ring for none.
good length ball on sixth stump, goes to punch it and is late.
preText: Here's the impact player Tushar Deshpande to bowl.

text: 137 kph delivery lands as a length ball on sixth stump, slices this to backward point, knocked down on a bounce to save three runs.
length ball on sixth stump, slapped wide of the cover sweeper for two before Santner slides along the rope to stop it.
knee high full toss on fourth stump at 142 kph, Mayers uses plenty of bottom hand to shovel this over mid-off to the rope.
full toss at knee height is sprayed wide outside the guidelines out of reach of Mayers trying to swat this through cover. Another wide, so the free hit remains.
half-volley on sixth stump, creams a drive to Chahar at extra cover who intercepts it for a dot. The siren goes off again though for another overstep by Deshpande. Another free hit on the way.
Wide yorker is sprayed almost off the pitch, another extra in the form of a wide and the free hit stays in play.
wide yorker, hugs the guideline at 140 kph, and Mayers can't stab it out through point. But the siren goes off as Deshpande has overstepped. Free hit to come.
postText: Rohit: "The way that Mayers is playing, it seems like a crime to drop him, so how will LSG fit De Kock back in the lineup?" Decisions decisions...

text: length ball on the wide guideline at 137 kph, Mayers shuffles across to get in line and slaughters this deep over long-on. 91-meter strike thuds into the facade of the second level pavilion.
another attempted slower wide yorker sprayed way outside off at 114 kph, left alone and wide called. The crowd audibly groans....
142 kph ball lands full on eighth stump, driven to mid-on for one as a diving stop is made to save three.
postText: Robbie: "11 balls. Well I guess that's an impact! "

text: back of a length on fifth stump, punched behind square wide of the cover sweeper for two.
back of a length on seventh stump, slapped wide of the cover sweeper for one.

text: slower ball at 119 kph lands short on fifth stump, Mayers not fooled and shuffles across to get inside the line and pulls this behind square to the rope.

length ball on fifth stump, opens the face to guide this behind point to short third for one where a diving stop is made.
postText: sri: "So far, this has been a match of clean hitting and poor bowling, all-round. Bishnoi and Thakur are the exceptions."

text: 119 kph length ball on fourth stump, pulls this high over midwicket, not timed cleanly but still gets enough bat on it to send it to the rope.

postText: Tomorrow, the league-stage champions of the past two seasons of the Indian Super League will go head-to-head for the ultimate prize: a chance to represent India in the Asian Champions League. But why do they have to do this? Who is playing? Find out right here.

text: length ball wide outside off, slapped past extra cover and Santner at cover sweeper has to work hard to track it down to save two runs.

dropped! Dube over short third man! Chahar goes for wide yorker again. Gowtham tries to heave this over midwicket and splices this off the toe swirling behind point. Dube jogs 15 yards along the ring but his feet are a bit tangled and he almost overruns this. As a result, his hands are in a tangle and not in a good position to reach for this coming back across his body. It clangs out badly. He made a straightforward chance look extremely difficult.
full and heaved to wide long-on, Stokes overruns the ball but a good backup by a teammate coming across from deep midwicket keeps this to two instead of four.

preText:
7.30pm Mohammed Siraj to open the bowling for RCB. Rohit and Ishan are in the middle. One slip

The teams are observing a two-minute silence for Salim Durani, who died this morning.

Parth: "Can't even a regular substitute come apart from the names given in the list?" --- No, and that has always been the case.

Shyam: "Who is Nehal Wadhera and Arshad Khan? 2 new finds of MI scouting network?" --- Nehal Wadhera is a hard-hitting left-hand Punjab batter who can bowl some legspin as well. Arshad Khan is an MP allrounder, bats left-hand and bowls left-arm seam. Both are making their T20 debut as well. Sampath tells me last time a team had two T20 debutants in an IPL game was Delhi Daredevils in 2018 (Sandeep Lammichane and Abhishek Sharma). KKR had two T20 debuts in their first match of the same season (Shubman Gill and Shivam Mavi).

Mohd Irshad: "MI looking better on paper than last year, hope to see that on ground too."

Shyam: "How is David Willey a sub? Havent they already reached 4 player limit?" --- Yes, and that means he cannot be used as an Impact Player but if an overseas players goes off the field for a couple of overs, Willey can come in and field as a regular substitute.

Surath: "I don't get it! MI only playing 3 overseas players? And still no place for baby AB or Stubbs??? Why???" --- The fourth one - Jason Behrendorff - will be their Impact Player.

Mumbai Indians 1 Rohit Sharma (capt), 2 Ishan Kishan (wk), 3 Suryakumar Yadav, 4 Thilak Varma, 5 Tim David, 6 Cameron Green, 7 Nehal Wadhera, 8 Jofra Archer, 9 Hrithik Shokeen, 10 Arshad Khan, 11 Piyush Chawla
Substitutes: Jason Behrendorff, Vishnu Vinod, Shams Mulani, Sandeep Warrier, Ramandeep Singh

Royal Challengers Bangalore 1 Faf du Plessis (capt), 2 Virat Kohli, 3 Michael Bracewell, 4 Glenn Maxwell, 5 Shahbaz Ahmed, 6 Dinesh Karthik, 7 Harshal Patel, 8 Akash Deep, 9 Reece Topley, 10 Mohammed Siraj, 11 Karn Sharma
Substitutes: Anuj Rawat, Suyash Prabhudessai, Mahipal Lomror, Sonu Yadav, David Willey

DJDJ: "Why isn't Dewald Brevis playing in the 11. MI just wasting a top talent" --- With David being the more explosive of the two, it's difficult to see Brevis fitting in.

"With the new Impact Player rule, teams are backing themselves to chase," says Rohit Sharma. "The pitch looks good and we have to come out with the positive intent. Tim David, Cameron Green, Jofra Archer and Jason Behrendorff are our overseas players. We will try to correct the mistakes we made last time. There have been a few new faces as well in the side, so that will help. A great achievement to captain in 200 games."

7.00pm Rohit Sharma calls heads and tails it is. RCB have won the toss and they will be bowling first. "There was a bit of dew when we practised," Faf du Plessis says. "Our first goal is to make those playoffs, and follow the processes. Maxwell, Bracewell and Topley are our overseas players."

Talking about the dimensions, down the ground is 69 metres. And that's the longest boundary! One side is slightly shorter than the other.

6.50pm This is going to be a big season for Harshal too. He was supposed to be a key player for India at the T20 World Cup last year but didn't get to play even one game. An interview with Nagraj Gollapudi, he talked about not just that but also about the challenge of bowling on smaller grounds and to a player like Suryakumar Yadav. You can read the full interview here.

6.45pm Virat Kohli has just walked onto the field and the cheer for him is as loud as it could get. Harshal Patel is doing an interview with the host broadcaster on the sideline and isn't able to hear anything.

"Behrendorff and Mumbai will want to get into that middle order as soon as possible"

You can also try out ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

6.40pm If you are seeing this on a mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

Mumbai have been in a rebuilding phase since the 2022 mega auction. At that auction, they went in with a dream. The dream of having Jofra Archer and Jasprit Bumrah bowl in tandem for them. They knew their dream wouldn't become a reality immediately - Archer was not available for the 2022 season. But now with Bumrah out with a back injury, they will have to wait for yet another season. Having said that, they seemed to have got their batting might back. You can read more about what to expect from today's game in our preview.

RCB have been pretty consistent of late, making the playoffs in each of the last three seasons. This run has also coincided with them not playing at their home ground, M Chinnaswamy Stadium - theirs is one of the poorest home records for an IPL team. This season, they play six of their first eight games in Bengaluru, which could dictate how their campaign goes.

6.30pm Hello and welcome to the second game of Super Sunday. It's Royal Challengers Bangalore taking on Mumbai Indians in Bengaluru. RCB's quest for their maiden IPL title is still on, while Mumbai will be looking to bounce back after a forgettable 2022 season where they finished at the bottom of the points table.
postText: LG: "Technically this "impact player" is the same as "super sub" the ODIs used to have in early 2000s? " --- You can say so but there's one big difference. You had to name your XI and Supersub before the toss. Now the teams can name their XI after the toss and bring in an Impact Player from the list of substitutes anytime during the match.

text: length ball around off. Another solid punches, this time down the ground but Siraj bends low and gets his left hand on it. That's enough to stop the ball

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Sharma, no run
text: down the ground but Siraj bowls this on a hard length and at the batter. Rohit goes for a pull but the ball sneaks underneath his bat. Goes between his body and the stumps

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Sharma, no run
text: A bouncer from Siraj, Rohit goes for a pull but only gets a top edge. The ball balloons straight up, and both Siraj and Karthik go for the catch. Karthik calls for it, it's closer to him and he has got the big gloves. But both players collide and the chance goes down. Siraj is lying on the ground, a couple of players checking in on him. He is speaking, and looks fine. Yes, he is back on his feet and ready for the next ball

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Sharma, no run
text: full on the stumps, driven towards mid-on
preText: Rohit pulls out at the last second. "Sorry, sorry, sorry," he says immediately, gesturing towards the sightscreen. He is apologising to Siraj, who has a smile on his face and both players hug each other

text: an excellent save by Topley, diving to his right at short third. Was a full outside off and Surya threw his bat at it. He will pick up a single, though
preText: Akash Deep

wkt_text: RG Sharma c †Karthik b Akash Deep 1 (30m 10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 10.00
text: The drop doesn't prove costly. Was a length ball outside off and Rohit pushed at it without moving his feet. The ball seamed away to take the outside edge. Karthik accepted it gleefully

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: length ball angling across the left-hander. Pushed towards point
preText: Tilak Varma walks in at No. 5, with Mumbai struggling at 20 for 3. One slip for him

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, SIX
text: first six of the match. A length ball around off and cleared his front leg and smashed it into the stands beyond long-on
preText: Thomas: "Siraj created Rohit's wicket with the pressure and Deep capitalised with great line and length"

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: length ball outside off. Dabbed towards deep third
length outside off. Surya comes forward and pushes it past short third. Topley sprints in from deep point and puts in a slide to keep it to two
full outside off, pushed towards sweeper cover
preText: MI 29 for 3 at the end of the powerplay. And Faf du Plessis brings Harshal Patel into the attack. Around the wicket

text: length outside off. Surya opens the face of the bat to steer it towards deep third
preText: Over the wicket to the right-hander

text: short of length and straying down the leg side. Varma pulls it to the right of short fine leg for four
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
preText: Over the wicket to the left-hander as well now

text: a slower one. Length outside off, in the channel. Surya goes for the cut but fails to connect. Was back of the hand and landing on the seam
a length ball, just outside off. Was bowled from wide of the crease. Surya looks to go aerial but fails to middle it. It bounces to the right of du Plessis at mid-off who makes a diving stop

too full on the stumps. Surya digs it out wide of long-on. Faf and Shahbaz Ahemd from deep midwicket converge and it looked like there could be another collision but both players slowed down with du Plessis kicking the ball back and Shahabz sending in the throw
preText: Karn Sharma, the legspinner

text: full on the stumps, whipped through covers for one

Topley is down, and holding is right shoulder. He looks in absolute pain. It was full on the stumps. Varma came out of his crease and looked to flick it away, only to mistime it towards short fine. Topley ran in from backward square leg and dived to make the stop but in the process ended up hurting himself. He is walking off the field, still holding is shoulder. This is not a good sign for RCB. They don't have Hazlewood available either
tossed up on the stumps. Surya comes forward and hits it towards long-on for one
short of length on the stumps. Pulled toward deep midwicket. Virat runs to his left and keeps it to one
length ball on the pads. Missed the flick and gets hit on the pads. The ball goes towards backward point where the fielder charges in to prevent any leg-byes
preText: Prabhudessai is the substitute fielder

shortText: Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: length outside off. Finds point with the cut
preText: Bracewell now. Around the wicket to the leg-hander

text: length ball around off. Goes back and whip it towards deep midwicket
length outside off and spinning in big, and sharply. Surya was shaping up for a cut but is cramped. Ends up slicing it towards short third
preText: Over the wicket to the right-hander

text: full and wide outside off. Surya goes over covers and beats the man in the deep. It was Siraj who put in a slide to his right, got the hand on it but couldn't flick it back

wkt_text: SA Yadav c Shahbaz Ahmed b Bracewell 15 (35m 16b 1x4 0x6) SR: 93.75
text: short of length outside off. Surya goes for the cut but ends up hitting it straight to Shahbaz at backward point. It was at an awkward height but Shahbaz leapt in the air and took it comfortably
postText: Time for a strategic timeout

text: and he gets off the mark in T20 cricket with a boundary. Was a length ball outside off and Wadhera opened the face of the bat to steer it past the slip fielder. Fifty also comes up for Mumbai
preText: Nehal Wadhera is the new batter. Around the wicket to the left-hander with a slip in

text: full around off. Down the ground and drills it towards long-off
full on the stumps. Opens the face of the bat to slice it towards covers
a googly. A length ball around off, Wadhera was looking to work it on the leg side but the ball hardly goes anywhere

an appeal for lbw but not given. RCB want to review this. Was a length ball around leg stump. Wadhera looked to flick it away but missed and got hit on the front pad, near knee roll. The ball-tracking shows it pitched just outside leg, so RCB lose their review
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket for a quick single. The bowler fields himself
length ball around off. Goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover. Was initially shaping up for a reverse hit
postText: Sandeep: "Why isn't Hasaranga playing?" -- He is in New Zealand, playing the T20I series

text: here's the reverse hit he was looking to play on the last ball of the previous over. Full on the stumps and Varma hits it over point for four. No one in the deep
full on the stumps, pushes at it and gets an inside edge past the stumps. Comes back for the second

shortText: Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: length ball at the stumps. Backs away and looks to run it between the keeper and short third but ends up chopping it into the ground

shortText: Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full around off. Uses of feet but ends up pushing it towards cover-point
length outside off. Goes back and cuts it behind point. A fumble in the deep but it doesn't cost RCB
length ball at the stumps, cramping the batter who was looking to cut it away. Chopped towards covers
starts with a fuller ball on the stumps. Varma dances down the track and lofts it over the bowler's head for a six
preText: With two left-handers in, here's some more offspin. Glenn Maxwell, around the wicket

text: short of length outside off. Varma goes back and pulls it to the right of deep midwicket
length outside off, steered through cover-point

length ball outside off and spinning away. Varma was first looking to cut it away but withdraws the shot in the end. Called a wide, and Maxwell isn't happy with it. A harsh call and I think Maxwell forgot he can review those now
length on the stumps. Goes for the sweep but misses. It was sliding down the leg. They pick up a leg-bye to short fine leg
use of feet from Varma once again but fails to middle it. He was looking to hit it over extra cover but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
postText: Wadhera seems to have hurt his foot while completing the run. The physio is out for quick check. And we are ready to resume

text: length outside off, cut away. Siraj with a tumbling stop in the deep. He fires in the throw to the keeper who breaks the stumps. We are going upstairs... Wadhera was well in

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, FOUR
text: a length ball on the stumps. Varma goes down on one knee and looks to scoop it fine. It doesn't go where he intended. The ball carries on with the angle and goes over the short third for four
preText: Akash Deep is back

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: length ball around off. Hits it straight towards extra cover, and he isn't happy with himself

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: a short ball this time, angling across. Varma goes for the pull but misses

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep square leg
short and pulled down towards deep square leg for one more

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: full around off. Digs it out past the bowler, didn't time it though. Just a single down the ground
full on the stumps. flicked towards deep midwicket. Varma was looking for the second but sent back by his partner
full on the pads. Goes for the slog sweep but misses. Gets pinged on the pads
slightly short of length and Wadhera takes full advantage of this. Rocks back and smashes it over deep midwicket
and he goes again. Over the roof - 101 metres. Was right in the slot this time. Slightly fuller than good length outside off and Wadhera launches it over long-on. He is pumped up

wkt_text: N Wadhera c Kohli b Sharma 21 (25m 13b 1x4 2x6) SR: 161.53
text: third time unlucky. Full on the stumps, Wadhera goes for another big hit but fails to get under it this time. Ends up hitting straight towards Kohli at long-on
a length ball on the stumps, looked like a quicker one. David goes back, clears his front leg and punches it towards long-on
preText: Tim David is the new batter. One slip for him

text: length ball around off. Driven towards long-on
preText: Harshal is back. I guess he will bowl the 15th, 17th and 19th

text: full on the pads, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off. David misjudged the length but checked his shot at the last moment. As a result, it doesn't carry to the bowler
length outside off, punched firmly but the extra cover fielder makes a good stop to his left
a short ball but it comes slower off the surfaces. Mistimes the pull towards deep square leg

shortText: Patel to Tilak Varma, no run
text: a sharp bouncer to end the over with. Varma wasn't expecting it and sways away from it
postText:
Rajesh Sanghvi: "Tilak playing on a different level then other MI players"

Time for the second strategic break

text: length ball around off. Goes back and cuts it towards deep extra cover
full on the stumps. Digs it out towards deep midwicket. The call was for two but Prabhudessai keeps it to one

wkt_text: TH David  b Sharma 4 (11m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 57.14
text: huge, huge wicket. Full on the stumps. David goes for the slog sweep but misses it altogether. The ball clatters into the stumps
postText: Topley, meanwhile, had a dislocated shoulder. It has been put back in place but he won't take any further part in this game

text: length ball outside off and spinning away. Left alone for a wide
length ball on the stumps. Flicked towards square leg, and Shokeen was looking for the second. Sent back by his partner
preText: Hrithik Shokeen

text: length ball on the stumps. Flicked towards square leg for one more
postText: Adhithya: "Most striking thing about Tilak Varma is his temperament for someone so young. Even as a 19 year old last year with all the failure in batting around him, he never appeared frazzled by the situation one bit. He is going to have a pretty successful career just due to his temperament."

text: length but down the leg side. An almost falling pull to send it to the fine-leg boundary

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, SIX
text: challenge accepted, Varma says. A length ball from Akash Deep and he launches it over deep square leg for a 78-metre six. Gets to his fifty as well, off 32 balls
preText: Our Forecaster is giving MI 147 from here...

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: short of length outside off. Looks to ramp it but fails to connect

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full around off. Looks to digs it out and ends up mistiming it towards short midwicket

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full but way outside off. Varma was moving across but lets it go through the keeper. RCB want to review the wide call. Varma was standing deep and just outside off, and the TV umpire reckons the ball was within his reach. So the wide call has been changed

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, FOUR
text: a bouncer. Varma goes for the pull, gets a top edge and it flies over the keeper's head

shortText: Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 2 runs
text: a low full toss at the stumps. Varma was looking to hit it over midwicket but gets a leading edge. Lands safe behind the bowler, and the batters complete two before the fielder in the deep sends in the throw

wkt_text: HR Shokeen c du Plessis b Patel 5 (12m 3b 1x4 0x6) SR: 166.66
text: an excellent catch by du Plessis. It was full around off from Harshal, Shokeen looked to chip it over mid-off but du Plessis ran sideways to his left, keeping his eyes on the ball. He judged it perfectly and timed his jump well to pouch it with both hands over his shoulder. Completed the catch by tumbling over
preText: Mustafa Moudi : "Not an ideal return to Chinnaswamy with a 150ish Score. We are used to at least 180 scores here !!"

text: a dipping full toss around off. A mistimed pull towards deep midwicket to open his account
preText: Arshad Khan, another debutant

text: another full toss. Mistimes the pull to the left of long-on who makes a good stop. Two more to the total
a length ball but way, way outside off. Karthik too fumbles behind the stumps, and the batter run one, in addition to the wide
length ball at the batter, cramping him. Varma goes for the flick but misses. Was there an inside edge? Not sure but they run one

shortText: Patel to Tilak Varma, no run
text: a dipping slower one. Full outside off and Varma fails to pick, and connect, it
slashed to the point boundary. Was a length ball but enough room to free the arms. Varma doesn't miss out
postText: AdwayLele : "At what position Jofra Archer will be batting? Is he playing as a specialist bowler?" A bit surprising from MI, to be honest

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Arshad Khan, no run
text: length ball, just outside off. Arshad goes for the pull but is beaten, by pace I think
preText: Siraj to bowl the 19th

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Arshad Khan, 1 run
text: length outside off. Throws his bat at it and the ball dribbles towards deep-backward point

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 2 runs
text: full around off. Varma goes for the big shot down the ground but ends up mistiming it to the left of long-on. Comes back for the second

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 1 wide
text: and another one - four wides in a row. This one was full but way outside off once more

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 1 wide
text: a hat-trick of wides. Short and way outside off. Varma was lacking to help it on its way but he cannot reach there
preText: Jofra is padded up, fwiw

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 1 wide
text: length but this one is even wider. Varma doesn't even attempt a shot this time

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 1 wide
text: short of length and angling across, but well outside off. Varma fails to connect the cut. Called a wide
preText: RCBfan: "Siraj had a horrid time last season. There were even questions about his ability as a T20 player. He has had a good start this match. Hope he can have a good season for RCB and Ind's sake, especially with Bumrah out"

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, FOUR
text: down the track to this length ball, and just lofts it to the left of mid-off. Eleven off the over with two balls to go
preText: RCBfan: "Oh dear. Massive jinx?! Sorry"

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, FOUR
text: short of length at the stumps, and Varma pulls it behind square leg. Picks up another boundary

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, 1 wide
text: Siraj seems to have lost his radar here. Full but way, way outside off. Fifth wide of the over

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full and wide outside off. Varma throws his bat at it but fails to connect. Was very close to being called yet another wide
postText: It's the first-ever 11-ball over in IPL, says Matt Roller

text: full on the pads. Clipped to the left of deep midwicket for a couple
short of length and it looked as if Arshad was just waiting for it. Pulls it over deep midwicket for a six
On a length with a bit of shape away from Kohli, who opens the face of the bat and pats to point for a run
preText:
9.42pm The two RCB openers, Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli stride out to the middle. The Mumbai players are in a huddle. Kohli will take strike. Behrendorff will start off sraight away, from over the wicket. One slip in place.

Jason Behrendorff will come in as an Impact Player in place of Suryakumar Yadav.

Try out ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

9.35pm Welcome back! That Tilak Varma blinder will surely lift Mumbai's spirits. Now, up to their bowlers to make a dent in RCB's famed batting line-up. Can they?

Sumail Hussain: "Everything has been changed but Issue of death bowling with RCB will remain same."

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: Length just outside off, not a lot of shape as du Plessis taps to point
preText: Similar field for du Plessis. Over the wicket, one slip.

text: Ooh, gets the length ball to shape into du Plessis, who presents the full face of the bat and drives past the bowler for a run
Again, just a hint of movement into Kohli, who walks towards the bowler a touch, defends to the left of the bowler and takes a quick run

Length ball on middle and shaping into leg, he tucks it to the right of deep backward square leg and they take a couple of runs. Kishan flicks the ball back onto the stumps as the throw comes in but the batter had made it comfortably.

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: On a length on middle stump, du Plessis pushes it back to the bowler

shortText: Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run
text: Better line, and has Kohli in just a bit of trouble. On a length with a hint of shape into Kohli, who looks for a drive on the up, gets a thick inside-edge back onto the pads. Could have so easily sneaked back onto his stumps.
Fuller, but he strays down leg a third time. The umpire extends his arms again to call a wide.
Nerves? Seems so. Length ball now, there is some movement, but the line is once again down leg. Called a wide
A bit of movement but the line is down leg, and called a wide
preText: Arshad Khan to share the new ball. Over the wicket. One slip.

text: Too straight and punished! Full-length ball on the pads of Kohli, who effortlessly flicks it past a diving short fine leg for a four

shortText: Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run
text: Shimmies down the track to the length ball outside off and mistimes to covers
Some in-swing into Kohli but once again the line is on the pads. He clips it imperiously to deep backward square leg.

shortText: Arshad Khan to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
text: Ooh, gets good movement causing du Plessis to lose his footing. Full on the pads of the batter, who is swept off his feet

shortText: Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run
text: Dances down the track does Kohli to the length ball on leg stump and absolutely pummels it but straight to mid-on
IMPERIOUS! That's the shot of a man in confidence. In the slot, rather he made it into one by stepping down and backing away. Presents the full face of the bat and drives him through covers

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: Beaten! Length ball just outside off, he pokes at it and misses
BANG! On a length on leg stump, he jumps down the track, gives himself room and effortlessly slams him over deep midwicket. Holds his shape so well, doe du Plessis.
Even better! Slower length ball outside off, he jumps down the track and simply presents the full face of the blade to swing through the line over mid-off and eventually over the ropes.

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: Length ball that raps du Plessis on the thigh pads as he looks to play it to the on-side

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: Goes for the scoop now, seeing the fine leg fielder in, but is unable to connect to the length ball that is on off stump

Puts Kohli down first ball! That would have been some start to his Mumbai career. Length ball outside off, Kohli backs away looking to blast it over mid-off, does not connect as well. Archer gets both hands to it but can't hold on
preText: Here's Jofra Archer

text: Deft touch and Kohli gets four. Back of a length ball outside off, he gently opens the face of his bat to guide it past point
Pacy short of a length ball that beats Kohli all ends up. He is surprised by the length as he looks to loft it, and misses
Good length ball on off, he pats it to to cover
preText: Deep point goes out

text: Chinnaswamy roars as Kohli hammers Archer all the way! Slower ball outside off that is spotted early by Kohli who jumps down the track and whacks him straight over long off for a six
Length outside off, he drives it crisply to covers
postText:
Venky: "It is great seeing Faf smashing it left right and center but still pains deep down inside as a CSKian.."

Sid: "RCB chased powerplay score of Mumbai Indians in just 16 balls!!"

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Flatter length ball on leg stump, he backs away looking for a pull, gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg.
preText: Spin into the attack. Here's Piyush Chawal in the fourth over. Over the wicket, no slip.

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: flatter wrong'un on leg stump, he works to square leg

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Wrong'un outside off, he mistimes his cut to cover
short, wide and du Plessis ain't missing out. Was quicker, 90.7 kph but du Plessis just stays back and hacks him through covers

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Misses the off pole by a whisker! Was there an edge as well? Nope, think it was just close to the stumps. Googly, not picked by du Plessis who looks for a hack through covers, misses
Oh, a seam-up ball from Chawla, 117.8 kph that is slapped to long on by du Plessis
Back of a length ball outside off, he cuts with soft hands to the point fielder. They take a run.
Drives on the up but can't beat mid-off! But that was struck very crisply. Length outside off, he presents the full face of the bat.
Oh, shot Kohli! Front foot pull of the highest order. Banged in short, 143kph, Kohli gets in position early and hammers it over midwicket. 50 up for RCB in the sixth over
Back of a length ball outside off, he pats it to point
Another short ball into the body of du Plessis who looks for a hook, but does not time it as well with the ball going towards deep backward square leg
Length on middle stump, he pushes to mid-on and sets off for a quick run
postText: Comms confirm there was an edge on 4.5, a thick inside-edge that Kishan could not hold on

text: Flatter outside off, he slaps it to extra cover where Rohit puts in a dive to his right and intercepts
Another googly from Chawla picked early by Kohli who dabs it to short third
quicker length ball on the pads of the batter who clips it to deep square leg
Very quick googly on the stumps of Kohli, who punches to long on quite confidently
Another wrong'un from Chawla, who stays back and gets it to long off
Legbreak outside off, he pushes towards cover and they pinch a quick run
postText: Ankit: "Geez 12 years after being in the same WC winning squad, you have Chawla vs. Kohli. "

text: Good length ball outside off to start off, Kohli steps down just a touch and opens the face of the bat to punch it hard past point
preText:
Cameron Green comes in. Two men back on the on-side.

Shravan: "Why Rohit didn't give new ball to Archer immediately? By the time he came to bowl, both batters are settled in already."

text: TOP SHOT! All hands from Faf. Just clears his front leg and times the length ball exquisitely past mid-off. No stopping that

shortText: Green to du Plessis, no run
text: Banged in short, he goes for a pull and misses. He is pleading for a wide, not given.
Short of a length ball on middle that is flayed away in the gap between deep fine leg and deep backward square leg. Two runs taken
Off the backfoot and over covers! He is playing an absolute blinder, the RCB captain. Short of a length outside off, he clears his front leg again, and muscles Green over cover
Out comes the scoop and there goes the ball! Fuller-length ball on the stumps, he gets across and easily gets the ball over the fine leg fence. 17 off that Green over.
postText: Matt: "Now imagine how SA fans feel knowing he could and SHOULD still be playing all 3 formats for us. :("

text: Straight as an arrow! Fuller on middle stump, he steps forward and thumps it past the bowler. No one moves.
Googly outside off, he forces the ball through covers, gets a thick inside-edge towards the bowler
Slightly short and wide, he pummels the cut to point

Ooh, that could have been curtains. Kohli was halfway down, and Faf was ball-watching. Fuller outside off, he mistimes his drive to the right of extra cover, where the fielder does not rein it in. If he had, that could have been very close.

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Loud, loud appeal for lbw, not given. Rohit does not take the review too. Wrong'un on the stumps, he looks for a flick, misses but the ball was probably heading down leg.

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Flatter outside off, he shoulders arms.
postText:
Time-out time

Ninad: "Rohit should bring Tilak to bowl! That guy has different level of passion to make things to happen"

Siddhartha : "Hard to imagine MI bowling line-up without Malinga and Bumrah. Their absence is clearly making difference "

Prashant: "@venky just hope and pray that he ( Faf ) doesn't perform against CSK"

text: Slants the length ball on middle and leg as Kohli brings out the sweep and hoicks it to the right of Varma at deep backward square leg. The fielder does really well to save two.
preText: Hrithik Shokeen comes into bowl his offbreaks

text: Length on off, he pushes to long on
Fifty for Faf du Plessis, 26th in IPL, third against Mumbai.And what a way to get there. Length on off, right in the arc for the batter who hammers him over wide long on
Two in two. This was right in the slot for du Plessis on off, as he clears his front leg, and swings through the line to slam him over long on
Works the length ball towards deep midwicket
preText: Around the wicket

text: Waits for the goof length ball on middle and leg and turns it to deep midwicket
Flatter outside off, he pats it to point
Tossed up full-length ball outside off, Kohli whacks it back at the stumps as the ball ricochets towards wide long on. They take two. Chawla could not get a finger on that
Going, going, gone! That is a shot and a half! Right in his arc on middle, he swings through the line and deposits Chawla over long on. The third 100-run stand between the duo in IPL
Fuller outside off, he pushes it to long off

shortText: Chawla to du Plessis, no run
text: Full-length ball outside off, was quicker as well as he bunts it to point
Gets down to play the slog sweep now, does not time it as well but finds the gap between long on and deep midwicket.
postText:
Shaheer: "@matt I believe South Africa's current white-ball batsmen are definitely better right now."

Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: MI Last won their opening match back in 2012. In the same season Piyush Chawla won his team KKR their first Title with a match winning boundary !!"

text: Back of a length ball outside off, he works the ball with soft hands to long on and they take two. Oh, there is a terrific direct hit from David from the deep. The third umpire has been called for, but Faf had made it easily.
preText: Jofra back. Can he get a few wickets? Four deep fielders leg side

text: Length ball that did not bouncer as much as expected. He can only bunt it towards the bowler.
Slower, back of the hand stuff outside off. He waits for it and opens the face of the bat to the right of deep cover.
Tries the bouncer now, Kohli pulls out off the hook. He was looking for a wide, but the umpire calls it one for the over. I felt that was quite high

Fifty off 38 balls for Kohli and a knock of the highest order from the talisman! Back of a length ball on off, he pats it to the right of the bowler with soft hands. Raises his bat as Chinnaswamy roars in delight. 50th IPL fifty for Kohli.

shortText: Archer to du Plessis, no run
text: Back of a hand slower ball into the surface. Faf can only mistime his hack back to the bowler
Welcomes him to the crease with a four. Goes down the track to the short of a length ball and pulls it past long on.
preText: Behrendorff back

text: Gets a bit of a leading edge does Kohli this time around. Length ball on off, he shimmies down the track, closes the face of the bat a touch early as the ball goes to long off.
WALLOPED! Banged in short on off, but that just sat up for Faf who gets into position nice and early and smacks the bowler over deep backward square leg.
No stopping Faf today! The length ball is sprayed down the leg as he flicks past short fine leg.
preText: Around the wicket

shortText: Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run
text: Low full toss that is hit back to the non-striker's stumps. The ball ricochets towards extra cover
Full-length ball outside off, he was looking to loft that over extra cover, but the ball catches a bit of his of outside edge to deep cover
Back of a length ball outside off, he stays legside of it and cuts it hard to the left of deep point
Slower length ball outside off, he works it towards midwicket
Gets in position and hammers Archer for another maximum! Slower short of a length ball aimed at the body of Kohli who gets inside the line and helps it over deep fine leg
Another back of a length ball on the stump, he pulls it to deep midwicket.

shortText: Archer to du Plessis, no run
text: Low full toss outside off, he misses out as he drives it straight to mid-off

shortText: Archer to du Plessis, no run
text: banged in short again outside off, he bunts it to point almost nonchalantly
postText:
Time-out. RCB are coasting. Just 33 needed off 36.

Adam: "Even though its come off tonight, it does still feel that having two natural accumulators at the top of the order for RCB might hurt them later in the tournament. I'd be tempted to open with someone like Bracewell who can really attack in the first six and then put Kohli at three." Are you not entertained, Adam?

deepak pandey: "Looks like Kohli and Faf are in a race of their own as to who will score more.As for Archer must be ruing the drop catch of Kohli"

text: In the slot for Kohli on off stump as he stays in his crease and lays into him by absolutely smashing him over wide long-on. This has been statement of sorts from Kohli.
preText: Arshad back

text: In the aiiir, and put down by Shokeen at deep midwicket! That went flat and very hard, but should have been held. Length on middle and leg, he whips it straight to the fielder, who was late it picking the ball up as he ran in

shortText: Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run
text: Banged in short now, he fails to connect the pull. Stifle appeal from Kishan to no avail.
Low full toss on off, he pushes it to long on

shortText: Arshad Khan to du Plessis, OUT
wkt_text: F du Plessis c David b Arshad Khan 73 (66m 43b 5x4 6x6) SR: 169.76
text: Slower length ball that is ballooned straight up and David ain't dropping those! Angled across Faf, who is not able to get the pace off the surface. Loses his shape and ends up lofting the ball to long-on.

shortText: Arshad Khan to Karthik, no run
text: Full-length ball outside off, driven hard back at the bowler, who misfields but no harm done
preText:
Dinesh Karthik in at No.3. Arshad is over the wicket.

Sachin : "Mumbai should bring some variety in their pace attack using the vacancy created by Richardson. Archer, Green and Behrendorff are same hit the deck style bowlers. "

text: Shin-high full toss to start with on middle stump, as Kohli gets across and works to deep backward square leg
preText:
Green back

Samraat: "Adam looks like concerned TRCB fan. But I agree with his point. At some point, I would like to have Bracewell at the top. But they gonna miss ABD in the big time while chasing totals."

text: On a length outside off, Karthik looks for a big heave, the ball hits the toe-end of his bat and goes it to mid-off
preText: Ishaan: "The running between the wickets between this duo was fantastic. So many easy doubles on such a small ground no easy feat. "

wkt_text: KD Karthik c Tilak Varma b Green 0 (6m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: Flicked straight to deep square leg and Green has his first IPL wicket! Length on middle, he gets across and gets a good chunk on that. But couldn't find the gap, unfortunately. Tilak makes no mistake.
Slower back of a length ball, he backs away looking for a pull, completely mistimes it to long on.
preText: Maxwell out in the middle. Just 23 needed now. Green stays over the wicket.

text: Oh, that is some shot to get off the mark! Banged in short outside off, he clears his front leg and smacks it over extra cover
Six more! Another short of a length ball, shoulder-high. Maxwell backs away, clears his front leg and despite not getting all of it on the pull gets it over deep fine leg.
On a length on off, he Kohli cracks it past short fine leg and RCB are in a hurry

In the arc, out of the park as Kohli finishes it off in style! Right in the slot for Kohli outside off stump. He keeps his shape and sends it soaring over long on. He pumps the air in delight and hugs Maxwell. RCB have gunned the target down in 16.2 overs.
postText:
What a way for RCB to start their campaign. They did not even need an Impact Player, such was their dominance. Hemant is working hard on his report, which should be up yet. The caravan rolls and we have Chennai Super Kings taking on Lucknow Super Giants tomorrow. Till then, this is Ashish Pant, signing off on behalf of Hemant, Ranjith and Raghav. Good night!

Faf du Plessis is the Player of the Match: It was a nice way to start the way we did in the powerplay. Siraj with his tail up is a beautiful thing. The bowler stuck to their task The last two or three overs, was a bit of learning. The cutters were working really well, it was not easy to hit the ball. There was value for your shots. Credit to the groundsman. Even the spinners found something. [On the crowd] It's awesome to play. It's my first time playing here as a home player, especially batting with Virat Kohli. [Fielding] You have to try and stay with the youngsters. I try and push the old hamstrings so that I can move in the field. To start the campaign with a bang, was huge.

Presentation time

Virat Kohli: Phenomenal win. Homecoming after so many years. Credit to their batters for getting to that score. Tilak batted well. We kept backing ourselves. Faf went first, and I joined later. I am very happy with how things went today. The new ball was a bit tricky, but we shifted the momentum by taking them down with the new ball. We nullified all their intensity. The wicket was quite a nice one. We hit good areas and kept putting pressure on the bowlers. [Crowd] Phenomenal, was a packed crowd. Every seat was full and we knew we would get a lot of support. We just ride off that intensity from the crowd They were right behind us. [On Karn Sharma] He was phenomenal, when he got that left-hander out, that was great bowling. He was bowling so well last year. He was ready to play. Even in the nets, he was not getting hit for sixes. He put us on the front foot right away. The first game of the IPL, and to perform like that was great. Apart from Mumbai winning five times and Chennai four times, we have qualified the most number of times, so we do play consistent cricket. It's just about staying focused, and just try to be the best balanced team. We need to play on this momentum. We just need to execute better.

Rohit Sharma: Didn't have a great start but was a good effort from Tilak at the end. But the bowlers didn't bowl well. We didn't bat good enough, it was a good pitch. [On Tilak] Some of the shorts he played today, he showed a lot of courage. We wanted to be courageous enough, and hats off to Tilak for getting us to the total. Was a good pitch to bat on. We did not bat to our potential. 30-40 runs would have been ideal. We were struggling t play the catch-up game. [No Bumrah] For the past six-eight months I am used to play without Bumrah. We can't control things which we can't control. The other guys are also talented. A lot of the guys haven't played IPL before. First game of the season, lot to look forward to.

Afeef: "A perfect return to the Chinnaswamy "

Shrikant : "I liked the move to send DK though it has not worked out. RCB is keeping an eye on NRR early on "

Neeraj : "Kohi wanted his own 'finishes off in style' moment..."

11.08pm Everything that could have gone right for RCB, did. Everything that could have wrong for Mumbai, did. Think that's the best way to put. Mumbai, bar Tilak Varma were all over the place, and still got to 171. But RCB openers, Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis just showed how good a surface that was. The duo added 148 runs off 89 balls to set-up the chase. Kohli remained unbeaten on 82 off 49, while du Plessis scored 73 off 43. RCB mopped up the win in just 16.2 overs and that will give their net run-rate a boost.

text: Banged in short outside off but that was way too high. Called a wide.
is there a nick? And has it carried? Full delivery on leg stump that shapes into the batter. Jaiswal seems to miss it as the ball flicks the pad and floats through to Phillips
preText:
3:28pm The umpires are making their way out to the middle, followed by the SRH players, and they are greeted by massive cheers and fervent flag-waving. Buttler and Jaiswal to open the batting for the visitors. Bhuvneshwar, as expected, with the new ball.

Nick: "Could RR have picked Joe Root instead of Trent Boult as they're batting first ? And then Boult comes back to bowl ?" -- A foreign player can be brought in as an Impact Player only if three overseas players are part of the XI. If the idea was to use Boult as an Impact Player, only Buttler, Hetmyer and Holder (or any combination of three overseas players) could have started.

Shrikant : "SRH has many exciting players, I am particularly looking forward to Rahul Tripathi and Brook. "

SingamSuriya: "Surprised to see RR not name an extra batter since they're batting first. Could have picked Akash Vasisht perhaps and then subbed Yuzi/Asif in for the 2nd innings?" -- Probably but don't forget Boult, who might bat at 9, struck at close to 138 last season.......

Jos Buttler, Rajasthan Royals batter: We had a really good last year but it is very much about starting fresh. It is about playing what is in front of us and focussing on the here and now. He (Holder) brings some good balance with the bat and the ball - it is fantastic to have in T20 cricket. The Impact Player rule adds another dynamic. Disappointing for him (Prasidh Krishna) to be injured but it gives someone else an opportunity to step up. (On importance of playing spin) Very important. It has been a prevalent part in T20 cricket wherever you play so it is exciting to play in different venues and in different venues - that is part of what makes the IPL special.

Sunrisers Hyderabad XI: Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Rahul Tripathi, Harry Brook, Glenn Phillips (wk), Washington Sundar, Bhuvneshwar Kumar (c), Adil Rashid, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Umran Malik, T Natarajan

Rajasthan Royals XI: Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (c & wk), Riyan Parag, Shimron Hetmyer, Jason Holder, R Ashwin, Yuzvendra Chahal, Trent Boult, KM Asif

3pm Time for the toss. Samson calls heads it but comes down as tails. SRH will bowl first. Bhuvneshwar reckons that the ball might stop in the day, explaining his decision to bowl first. He confirms that Brook, Farooqi, Phillips and Rashid are the overseas players. Samson says the wicket looks good for both bowling and batting, and that they need to be confident of whatever they are doing. Buttler, Hetmyer, Holder and Boult are the four overseas players for RR.

2:58pm Not long left now before the toss. The team chasing has only won once so far this season (out of three). What will the captain winning the toss want to do today in this afternoon game? Stay tuned to find out!

Looks like Adil Rashid, Glenn Phillips, Harry Brook and Mayank Agarwal have been handed their SRH caps. Jason Holder and KM Asif, meanwhile, will make their RR debuts today.

You can follow ball-by-ball commentary of the game in Hindi and in Tamil.

Afeef: "There's a new challenger in town for the fastest delivery of the season. Last season it was between Umran Malik, Lockie Ferguson and Anrich Nortje. Now, Mark Wood has entered the arena. This is going to be good."

Neal: "Keen to see Harry Brook's IPL debut. There's an aura about him, or perhaps it's just the fearlessness of youth. Then again, Buttler might teach the young gun a thing or two!"

Let's see what the conditions have in store for us. The pitch looks pristine and according to Sanjay Manjrekar, it looks very much like an English pitch - white in colour with an even covering of dry grass. It is a black soil surface, meaning that there might not be a lot of turn for the spinners. A few cracks here and there but he does not expect it to play much of a part. Manjrekar reckons captains winning the toss might want to chase, considering this is a high-scoring venue.

If you are seeing this on a mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

RR enter this season, hoping to go one better than 2022. SRH, meanwhile, stitched together a superb mid-season run last campaign, only to lose steam when it really mattered. Both teams have had a chance to plug the holes that surfaced in 2022, and on paper, seem better placed to go the distance than they did twelve months ago.

SRH, though, will have to contend with the unavailability of a few key players today. Aiden Markram (their captain), Heinrich Klaasen and Marco Jansen are currently on national duty. But in Harry Brook, Glenn Phillips, Mayank Agarwal and Rahul Tripathi, they have more than enough firepower to offset it. Keep an eye out for Abhishek Sharma too, who seems to have grown in stature over the past couple of years.

RR, meanwhile, would be hoping that their explosive batting unit comes to the party again. Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson and Yashasvi Jaiswal can tee off from the outset, and with Shimron Hetmyer adding impetus in the middle order, they seem to have most of their batting bases covered.

This, however, is also a contest between two strong bowling units. SRH have packed their bowling attack with top-quality Indian pacers - each of whom have a point to prove. RR are missing Prasidh Krishna but have arguably the best spin-bowling contingent at the IPL.

2:25pm Three games into the season and we have already had several talking points. It began with Ahmedabad being painted yellow, and Hardik Pandya getting the better of MS Dhoni.

Yesterday, we had rain-induced drama in the afternoon fixture, before Mark Wood produced a storm of his own to blow the Delhi Capitals away. Today, the caravan moves to Hyderabad, where the Sunrisers Hyderabad would hope to become the fourth team to register a home win at the first time of asking. But they will have to do so against Rajasthan Royals, who were last season's finalists.

Hello and welcome to our coverage, this is Shashwat Kumar and I will be your eyes and ears for everything that happens. Sit back, grab your favourite food and drink, and buckle up because this is going to be very exciting!

text: beats mid off! Length delivery just outside off stump. Jaiswal gets onto the front foot and pushes it down the ground. Brook dives to his left at mid off but can't get to it as the ball trickles into the fence
preText: Two slips in place

text: another length delivery that curves down the leg side. Jaiswal does not get bat on it again but this time, manages to get his pads out of the way too. Called a wide!
length delivery on middle and leg stump. Jaiswal comes half forward and turns it into the leg side for one
length delivery outside off stump that shapes away late. Buttler takes a step down the track and prods it towards mid off
preText: Two slips for Buttler too

text: back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Buttler gets up on his toes and drops it into the off side
full delivery angled into middle and off stump. Buttler presses half forward and pokes it towards mid on
preText: Rajat Maheshwar: "Looking forward to seeing a revived SRH. Adil Rasheed may end up being SRH's best buy in the auction in my opinion. A quality leg spinner, worth his weight in gold."

text: full and slanted into middle and leg stump. Jaiswal seems to fall over a touch but somehow manages to flick it powerfully past mid wicket for four!
preText:
Farooqi to share the new ball

Ravi Balakrishn: "Shashwat, could you briefly explain the Impact player rules?" -- Here is all you need to know about the Impact Player rule.

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run
text: back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Jaiswal waits in his crease and taps it down the ground towards mid off
full delivery outside off stump. Jaiswal comes onto the front foot and chips it over extra cover before scampering across for three
gets off the mark! Back of a length delivery on leg stump. Buttler lets the ball come to him before tucking it neatly past square leg. Gets back for three!
preText: Buttler v Farooqi is an interesting contest

text: banged into the track outside off stump. Jaiswal has a swipe at it and while he miscues it, he gets enough wood to clear mid on and collect a boundary!

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run
text: back of a length delivery outside off stump that hurries onto the batter. Jaiswal has another hack at it but this time, jams it off the inside edge into his pads
preText: Jaiswal is batting out of his crease

text: shot! Full and slanted into middle and leg stump. Buttler plants his front foot and nonchalantly clips it well over the deep mid wicket fence!
preText: Bhuvneshwar has dismissed Buttler five times in T20Is, but never in the IPL.

text: slower delivery on a length outside off stump. Buttler comes half forward and pushes it towards mid off, where the fielder misfields and allows the second
length delivery on off stump. Buttler times it superbly towards mid off, where Sundar misfields again and concedes a single
four more! Slower delivery on a full length on middle and leg stump. Jaiswal plants his front foot, gets his wrists into play and flicks it beautifully past mid wicket!
oh dear! Slower bumper on leg stump. Jaiswal creates room for himself and upper cuts it towards short third man. Umran escorts it to the fence and then fails in his attempt to pull it back!
back of a length delivery pushed across the batter outside off stump. Jaiswal has a waft at it and sees the ball sneak past the outside edge
preText: The outfield looks rapid, and the pitch looks very flat so far

text: and he gets greeted with six! Dragged down outside off stump. Buttler has all the time in the world to rock back and deposit it into the stands over mid wicket
preText: First look at spin today. Sundar into the attack

text: another short delivery on off stump, and it goes the distance! Buttler hangs back in his crease and mauls it over cow corner!

shortText: Washington Sundar to Buttler, no run
text: back of a length delivery on off stump. Buttler gets onto the back foot and cuts it straight to short extra cover
tossed up on a full length outside off stump. Buttler plants his front foot and heaves it on the bounce to deep mid wicket. Could the fielder have gone for the catch?
Jaiswal continues on his merry way! Full delivery on middle and off stump. Jaiswal walks across his stumps and sweeps it over backward square leg for four!
back of a length delivery on off stump. Jaiswal goes back and punches it past extra cover for a couple of runs. Excellent effort by Brook running around from long off
change of bowler but no change in result! Length delivery on middle and off stump. Buttler stands tall on the front foot and punches it past mid off for four!
preText: Natarajan to try his luck now, and we have a false start because.....someone is walking behind the sightscreen (surprise, surprise)

text: length delivery angled across outside off stump. Buttler has a huge swish at it and for a change, makes no contact
preText: Sifat Khawry : "Butler is playing as if he hasn't gone back from India after the 2022 IPL.. Amazing hitting!!"

text: four more! Full and wide outside off stump. Buttler throws his hands at it and slices it over cover point for another boundary!
this is carnage! Short, and offering that amount of width is always dangerous. Buttler sits back in his crease and threads it past backward point!
four fours in the over! Slower delivery on a length outside off stump. Buttler gets on top of the bounce again and crashes it past extra cover
length delivery on middle and leg stump. Buttler has a swing at it and chunks it via a combination of inside edge and thigh pad for a single
four more! Slower delivery dug into the track on leg stump. Buttler has all the time in the world to roll his wrists and pull it past deep square leg!
preText: 73 runs have come off the first five overs. RR's highest-ever score in the powerplay in the IPL is 81. The way Buttler is going, you would back him to raze down this record. Farooqi back into the attack

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, no run
text: slower yorker just outside off stump. Buttler can't quite pick it and swings too early, swinging all over it eventually. Rare dot ball!
normal service resumes! Back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Buttler slashes at it and gets it past the keeper. Brings up his fifty too, off just 20 balls!
low full toss just outside off stump. Buttler leans forward, opens his bat face just enough and times it exquisitely past mid off for four!

wkt_text: JC Buttler  b Fazalhaq Farooqi 54 (32m 22b 7x4 3x6) SR: 245.45
text: cleans him up! Farooqi breaks through! Back of a length delivery at the stumps that skids through and might have just nipped back a shade. Buttler tries to punch on the up but the movement means that he gets a feather of an inside edge that cannons into the top of middle and off stump! Much-needed respite for the Sunrisers Hyderabad!

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Samson, no run
text: back of a length delivery on middle and leg stump. Samson gets up on his toes and meets it right under his eyes
preText: Skipper Samson strides out at 3
postText: Phew, that was a frenetic passage of play. SRH need this time-out more than RR to just reassess and figure out what lines and lengths they want to bowl. This pitch looks like a belter but they need to produce something special in these middle overs to come back into the game

text: length delivery on middle and off stump. Jaiswal goes back and punches it towards long on for a couple of runs
preText:
Adil Rashid is finally brought into the attack

Sachin: "This brings back memories of the book cricket !!"

text: googly on a back of a length outside off stump. Jaiswal waits in his crease and cuts it towards backward point. The fielder misfields but no damage done
back of a length delivery outside off stump. Jaiswal can't beat the fielder at short extra cover this time
shortish on middle and leg stump again. Jaiswal hangs back and knocks it down the ground for a single
preText: Two dots in a row. What game is this?!

text: googly on a length on middle and off stump. Samson reads it off the surface and turns it into the leg side to get off the mark
short, wide and punished! Too short and it gives Jaiswal enough time to rock back, get his hands through the ball and knife it past backward point!
preText: A hint of turn on that last ball, and if the ball starts spinning, Rashid could be very dangerous

text: back of a length delivery on leg stump. Samson gets inside the line of the ball and glances it down to fine leg for a single
preText:
Right. Umran is here

Aadil: "Where is Bhuvi? Why is he not bowling?" -- He bowled a couple of overs in the powerplay and went for 23 runs....

text: back of a length delivery on leg stump. Jaiswal uses the pace and helps it down to fine leg for one more run
preText: Jaiswal stops Umran in his run-up because.....yes, you guessed it - someone was moving behind the bowler's arm. That might fire up Umran just a little more...

text: shot! Banged into the track on middle and leg stump. Samson arches his back, gets under it and upper cuts it over the keeper's head for four!
four more! Back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Samson watches the ball like a hawk, opens his bat face and glides it past third man
back of a length delivery outside off stump. Samson gets up on his toes and runs it down to third man for a single
back of a length delivery outside off stump. Jaiswal goes back and eases it towards deep point for a single
preText: Around the wicket to Jaiswal

text: short delivery on middle and off stump. Jaiswal cuts again but this time, can't split the gap between backward point and short third man
slowed up on a length on leg stump. Jaiswal works it into the leg side. He wants the second too but is sent back by Samson
length delivery given plenty of air just outside off stump. Samson has a nibble at it and sees the ball rip past the outside edge
preText: Samson has had his issues against leg-spin. Can Rashid knock him over?

text: slowed up even more on a length outside off stump. Samson hangs back and cuts it towards deep point for a couple of runs
flatter and fuller on leg stump. Samson opts to stay back before patting it into the leg side for a single
tossed up on a length outside off stump. Jaiswal has a waft at it and gets an under edge that ends up nutmegging Phillips. Very difficult to term that a chance!
shot! Back of a length delivery outside off stump. Jaiswal stands up tall and cracks it past extra cover for another boundary!

shortText: Umran Malik to Jaiswal, no run
text: length delivery just outside off stump. Jaiswal has a go at it but can only scuff it down the ground towards mid off
back of a length delivery at the stumps. Jaiswal is cramped for room but manages to nudge it into the leg side for a single
preText: RR got to 100 in 7.4 overs today, which is the quickest-ever for them in the IPL. Their previous best was off 8.1 overs against CSK in 2021

text: top edge, and it flies for six! Sharp bumper and Samson is tucked up. He can't free his arms and swipes at it, getting a top edge that clears the fence over the keeper's head comfortably
back of a length delivery on middle and off stump. Samson dabs it towards deep backward point for a single

shortText: Umran Malik to Jaiswal, no run
text: back of a length delivery outside off stump that whistles through. Jaiswal has a waft at it but is late on the stroke, and misses
into the stands! Dragged down on leg stump and that is easy pickings for Samson! He rocks back and hammers it over deep mid wicket!
full delivery just outside off stump. Samson comes forward and pushes it down the ground for a single
full delivery on middle and leg stump. Jaiswal gets to the pitch of the ball and works it towards deep mid wicket for one
length delivery just outside off stump. Samson waits for the ball to arrive before dabbing it down to short third man for a single
slider on a length outside off stump. Jaiswal goes feeling for it and sees the ball sneak past the outside edge
full delivery on middle and off stump. Jaiswal lunges forward and turns it towards deep mid wicket for one
back of a length delivery on middle and leg stump. Jaiswal stabs it into the leg side and gets across to the other end
preText: Sundar comes back

text: back of a length delivery outside off stump. Samson goes back and pulls it down the ground towards long on for a single

shortText: Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, no run
text: back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Jaiswal jabs it towards extra cover

shortText: Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, no run
text: back of a length delivery outside off stump that grips and spins away. Jaiswal has a swish across the line and is beaten all ends up
back of a length delivery on middle and leg stump. Jaiswal works it towards deep mid wicket and gets to his fifty, off 34 balls!

shortText: Washington Sundar to Samson, no run
text: back of a length delivery just outside off stump. Samson camps in his crease and cuts it towards backward point
shot! Full and slanted into leg stump. Jaiswal backs away very early and drills it between extra cover and mid off for four!

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run
text: did that carry? Length delivery outside off stump that might have nipped back just a shade. Jaiswal has a waft at it and gets an inside edge that floats through to Phillips. He dives forward and picks it up but is unsure if he has done so on the full. Looks like it has clearly bounced, and Jaiswal survives!
preText: PV: "Such has the whirlwind been at the top that the last 5 overs at 9 rpo feels sluggish! "

wkt_text: YBK Jaiswal c Agarwal b Fazalhaq Farooqi 54 (63m 37b 9x4 0x6) SR: 145.94
text: holes out to deep square leg! Farooqi has another! Banged into the track on middle and off stump. Jaiswal looks to heave it away but does not quite get hold of it. In fact, he toe-ends it and Mayank does the rest on the fence! Vital wicket for SRH!

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Padikkal, 1 leg bye
text: back of a length delivery on leg stump. Padikkal is late on the stroke as the ball pings off the thigh pad into the on side for a leg bye
preText:
Padikkal in at 4

SD: "If we don't get Jaiswal or Samson out this over then we're pretty much finished. Mayank isn't even in form " -- Looks like your prayers have been answered

text: low full toss outside off stump. Samson opens the bat face and guides it past backward point for a single

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Padikkal, no run
text: excellent yorker on middle and leg stump. Padikkal jams his bat down in time and digs it out towards the bowler
dragged down outside off stump, and that is poor from Sundar. Samson rocks back and flat-bats it over long off for a maximum!
length delivery on off stump. Samson tries to repeat the stroke but is cramped for room, instead punching it towards long on for one
full delivery on middle and off stump. Padikkal lunges forward and pushes it towards long off for a single

shortText: Washington Sundar to Samson, no run

text: cleans him up with a corker! Heat-seeking 149.2 kph missile that hones in on off stump. Padikkal is already hanging back because of the extra pace and is awfully late on the stroke. He jumps up into the air but cannot do anything as the ball whistles past the bat and sends off stump flying!

full delivery on middle and off stump. Parag comes half forward and knocks it down the ground for a single

preText:
Rashid to bowl out here

Ram p: "Can Abdul Samad be impact player coming in place of Umran Malik ? " - Yes, he can but I expect that change to be made (if at all) sometime during the second innings. Umran still has an over left

text: slower and wider outside off stump. Samson reaches out for it and drives it towards deep cover point

quicker and flatter outside off stump. Samson goes deep into his crease and dabs it down to short third man for one
