postText: RR have set themselves up nicely for a score in the 210-220 range. But if this pair and Hetmyer go berserk, they could get even more. SRH have done well to claw back in the middle overs, and if they can keep RR down to anything under 210, they will go into the break thinking they can hunt down this total. Crucial passage of play coming up!

wkt_text: R Parag c Fazalhaq Farooqi b Natarajan 7 (12m 6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 116.66
text: taken at short third man! Natarajan gets Parag! Back of a length delivery outside off stump. Parag has a hack across the line but the angle means that he always has to fetch it. The ball also gets a little big on him and he ends up top-edging it towards short third man, where Farooqi settles under the high ball and completes the catch!
preText:
Natarajan comes back to bowl the 17th

Mayank Shekhar : "Glenn Philips has been vocal so far behind the stumps." -- He seems to be playing a role in setting the fields as well

text: yorker on leg stump. Hetmyer comes forward and tucks it off his toes towards deep square leg to get off the mark
preText: Hetmyer joins his skipper out in the middle

text: length delivery outside off stump. Samson comes forward and punches it towards extra cover for a single. Brings up a 28-ball fifty too!
slower delivery on a length just outside off stump. Hetmyer comes forward and pokes it back to the bowler
another good yorker on middle and leg stump. Hetmyer works it towards deep mid wicket and collects a single
low full toss outside off stump. Samson throws his hands at it but can only slice it towards backward point
preText: Sachin Vinod: "Why aren't they letting Natarajan bowl his full quota, he's a gun bowler." -- He is bowling his second currently, and all signs point towards him bowling either the penultimate or the final over. Maybe they were slightly hesitant after how his first over went, and considering he is returning from injury

text: back of a length delivery outside off stump. Hetmyer frees his arms and cuts it towards deep point for a single
very full delivery on leg stump. Samson gives himself a bit of room but can only dig it out towards extra cover for one more run
big shot! Banged into the track on middle and leg stump. Hetmyer picks up the length early and dumps it a mile over the deep mid wicket fence!
preText: Anna John: "Yet another brilliant start to an IPL series for Sanju. Hope he carries the momentum forward."

text: wide yorker nailed to perception. Hetmyer leaves it alone but acknowledges that the ball snuck just inside the tramlines
full delivery outside off stump. Hetmyer reaches out for it and drives it down the ground for just another single
full and down the leg side. Samson knows that fine leg is up in the circle and just glances it neatly past that fielder to pick up a much-needed boundary!
oh dear! Yorker just outside off stump. Hetmyer squeezes it out towards extra cover and sets off for the single, only to see his partner stationary. Sundar has a shy at the stumps but misses
preText: Natarajan to bowl the penultimate over

text: low full toss just outside off stump. Hetmyer winds up and powers it down the ground towards long off for just another single
preText: Right. Natarajan has been nailing the yorker so far. What does Hetmyer have up his sleeve?

wkt_text: SV Samson c Abhishek Sharma b Natarajan 55 (66m 32b 3x4 4x6) SR: 171.87
text: taken brilliantly at deep mid wicket! Slower delivery on a back of a length outside off stump, and this one just sticks in the surface a little. Samson has a swipe at it but is early into the stroke. He shanks it towards deep mid wicket, where Abhishek settles himself, catches it and then tiptoes his way out of trouble beautifully!

oh dear, that has gone through! Off-pace delivery on a length outside off stump. Ashwin is completely deceived and can't lay bat on it. But the keeper can't gather either, with the ball bouncing in front of him and bobbling away to the fence
preText: Ashwin walks out at 7, instead of Holder

text: low full toss on middle and off stump. Ashwin backs away and slices it towards backward point for a single. A wild throw by Sundar that nearly reaches long on on the full but no damage done
angled into the pads. Hetmyer turns it behind square on the leg side and is content with a single
full delivery outside off stump. Hetmyer sits deep in his crease and drags it towards deep mid wicket for a couple of runs

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, no run
text: is that out? Another sizzling wide yorker outside off stump. Hetmyer dangles his bat, looking to guide it past short third man but might have gotten too thin a tickle. Phillips gobbles up the chance but the only question is whether it is a bump ball. The third umpire has been called into question, and replays say that the ball bounced after hitting the bat!

shortText: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, no run
text: another top yorker outside off stump. Hetmyer can't get under this one too and scuffs it back to the bowler
preText: Change of bat for Hetmyer

text: very full delivery outside off stump. Hetmyer opens his bat face and glides it towards deep point. Hetmyer and Ashwin hare back for the second and eventually make it
postText: They are now checking for the short run to add to the drama but looks like Hetmyer is fine

text: in the slot and he gets dispatched! Just outside off stump, and Hetmyer winds up before banging it over the bowler's head for four!
full delivery way outside off stump. Hetmyer hangs back in his crease and flicks it towards deep mid wicket for a couple of runs
postText:
5:20pm Well, that innings ebbed and flowed throughout. RR raced out of the traps, with Buttler and Jaiswal dominating the powerplay. Samson then took over and ensured that the runs kept coming. Support, though, was not very forthcoming from the other end, with Parag and Padikkal struggling. SRH did well to curb the run-flow towards the end too, conceding only 43 runs off the final five overs.

Speaking of SRH, plenty of bright spots for them. Natarajan was sensational at the death, as was Farooqi. Umran cleaned up Padikkal with an absolute peach, and Rashid held his own brilliantly, throwing the first spanner in RR's works. RR still managed to get over 200 but considering where SRH were at the half-way stage, they will be happy chasing this total. Do join us in a bit for the run-chase!

Adil Rashid: (On the pitch and his bowling) Some gripped, some went through. Generally, it was a good batting pitch. We had to find a way to do a job and after the first six, we did a tremendous job. (On Farooqi and Natarajan) To restrict them to this score, they bowled exceptionally well and it has brought us back into the game. It is nice to play in front of a full house and against the world's best players. (On the score) Maybe 5-10 runs a bit more than we would have liked. But we have world-class players all the way down and hopefully we can hunt this down.

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length delivery just outside off stump that shapes away. Abhishek gets behind the line of the ball and presents the full face of the bat
preText: 5:32pm Right. We are back. Abhishek and Mayank to open the batting for SRH. Boult with the new ball for RR. 204 to get, 20 overs and 10 wickets in hand. Who are you backing?

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run

text: cleans him up with an absolute peach! Sizzling yorker that seems to start on middle and leg stump before swerving away at the last moment. Abhishek is completely flummoxed by it and can't lay bat on it as the ball flattens off stump! What a special delivery!
back of a length delivery on middle and off stump. Tripathi gets up on his toes and drops it into the off side
preText: Tripathi in at 3. He usually does not hold back

wkt_text: RA Tripathi c Holder b Boult 0 (6m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: taken excellent at slip! Full delivery just outside off stump. Tripathi takes a step down the track, and opens his bat face, almost guiding it towards Holder, who is stationed at a wide slip. Holder flings himself to his left and holds onto a spectacular catch! But hang on....Tripathi has reviewed this one, saying that he has not nicked it at all. Replays, though, only confirm what we saw first time out. Tripathi has absolutely smashed it, and he now has to walk back!
full delivery that starts on leg stump and swings further down. Brook does not get bat on it as Samson dives to his left to rein it in. Not called a wide either

preText: Rajasthan Royals scored 39.9% of their total in the last-ten overs. This is the lowest percentage of runs scored in the last-ten overs out of the 97 times teams have managed a total of 200-plus batting first in the IPL (full 20-over games).

tossed up on a length outside off stump. Kumar has a fish at it and misses. Samson whips off the bails and the square leg umpire, possibly out of habit, refers it upstairs. As is protocol, we go through the entire process. Nothing on Ultra Edge, and Kumar's back foot has not moved an inch out of the crease. But the third umpire, for some reason, wants to have multiple looks at it from different angles before coming to the conclusion that almost everyone else arrived at - that Kumar is safe.
preText: SRH need 117 off 28 now, and this review for a stumping is taking an eternity

shot! Back of a length delivery outside off stump. Umran clears his front leg and absolutely crunches it over mid off for four!
massive! Back of a length delivery on middle and leg stump. Umran opens up his stance again and smears it over deep mid wicket for six!
full toss just outside off stump. Umran continues swinging and this time, flays it past extra cover for a couple of runs
six more! In the slot, and Samad finally clears the fence! He has a swing at it and heaves it over deep square leg for six!
length delivery on middle and leg stump. Samad has a hack at it and toe-ends it down the ground for a single
banged into the track. Umran clears his front leg and flat-bats it towards long on. The fielder misfields but Samad declines the opportunity of a second run
preText: SRH need about 20 more of these No balls, though, unfortunately

shortText: Saini to Umran Malik, (no ball) SIX
text: what a shot! Umran is on fire! Banged into the track outside off stump. Umran rises with the bounce and clatters it over wide long on! And it is a No ball, oh dear!
four more! In the slot outside off stump. Samad throws the kitchen sink at it and scythes it over backward point for another boundary!
slower delivery on a length on leg stump. Samad lets the ball come to him before swinging it away past short fine leg for four!
On a length outside off, a hint of swing inwards. He looks to defend and runs it down to deep third. First runs on the board for Rahul and LSG.
preText:
7:28pm KL Rahul and Kyle Mayers are out to open with the bat for Super Giants. Khaleel Ahmed will run in with the new ball from over the wicket. One slip in.

7.02 pm The news is that Delhi Capitals have won the toss and chosen to bowl first.

Super Giants XI: 1 KL Rahul (capt.), 2 Kyle Mayers, 3 Deepak Hooda, 4 Nicholas Pooran (wk), 5 Marcus Stoinis, 6 Ayush Badoni, 7 Krunal Pandya, 8 Avesh Khan, 9 Ravi Bishnoi, 10 Jaydev Unadkat, 11 Mark Wood.

Capitals XI: 1 David Warner (capt.), 2 Prithvi Shaw, 3 Rilee Rossouw, 4 Mitchell Marsh, 5 Sarfaraz Khan (wk), 6 Rovman Powell, 7 Axar Patel, 8 Khaleel Ahmed, 9 Kuldeep Yadav, 10 Chetan Sakariya, 11 Mukesh Kumar.

6.45 pm Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live coverage of the second half of today's 2023 IPL doubleheader as Lucknow Super Giants host Delhi Capitals. Meanwhile, the first match today is still very much in progress as KKR are midway through their chase of Punjab Kings' total of 191 for 5.

But for the Capitals and Super Giants ultras around the world waiting for the start of each team's 2023 campaigns to get underway, here's today's match preview penned by Hemant Brar.

text: Outside off on a length, swinging away just a touch. Mayers hangs back and shoulders arms to let it pass.
preText: Slip stays for Mayers.

text: Full and angling in on the pads, he keeps it out off the front foot to the on side.
Lands it on a length around off, he hangs back and defends it towards cover.
Fuller on off and middle, he pushes it back towards mid-off. Khaleel himself rushes to the ball and stops it.
Moving away after landing it on a length he hangs back and punches it to backward point. Good start from Khaleel.
preText: Sushobhit: "Who is keeping the wickets for DC?" Sarfaraz Khan

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, no run
text: fullish length swinging away from sixth stump, Rahul drives but is beaten.
preText: Mukesh Kumar to bowl the second new ball over.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, no run
text: back of a length on fourth stump, defended off the back foot to cover.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, no run
text: full and angled into the legs at 134 kph, goes to flick and misses as the ball caroms to point.
length ball on the legs at 130 kph, flicked through midwicket for one.
back of a length on off at 133 kph, gentle punch behind point beats the fielder on the ring with a clumsy diving effort going under his hands and they jog two.

another matador red cape effort, this time at mid-on by Kuldeep Yadav. Length ball on fourth stump swatted by Mayers into the ground straight to Yadav, but he pulls the cape back to let the torro charge through his legs for two.
postText: Manoj: "Too many blue coloured jerseys in the IPL. Why don't they choose a different unique colour instead of mixing with blue? DC, LSG, GT, MI all got blue shade!" I don't understand why they don't have home and away different color jerseys to avoid a color clash. Every other major pro franchise sport does so.

text: short and wide on seventh stump at 140 kph, Rahul fans on a cut shot but Sarfaraz fumbles a regulation take reaching in front of slip snatching with crocodile jaws and it goes for a bye.
length ball on sixth stump at 137 kph, punched firmly but straight to extra cover.
length ball into the hips at 138 kph, Mayers swivels with a Greenidge-esque one-leg-in-the-air pull but misses off the body.
length ball on fourth stump at 139 kph, Mayers winds up and powers a pull through square leg that beats the boundary rider to the rope.
full on fourth stump at 138 kph, Mayers winds up for another big heave but miscues this off an inside edge past leg stump for one to fine leg.
half-volley on fifth stump, smoked straight to mid-off fielded on one bounce.
postText: Anvit: "I have a theory for why teams chose blue. Blue is the colour of the Indian team as well, so they feel that the fans will like a blue jersey more. Similarly, since Pakistan fields the green colour, teams don't prefer green colour. Though, RCB and CSK are clear examples disproving this perception." Hmmmm....

text: length ball on fifth stump, slices a cut behind point for one.
preText: Sakariya on now in place of Mukesh Kumar.

text: length ball wide outside off, goes to cut and misses.
postText: Malokee: "There will still be clash if one team's home jersey is similar to other's away jersey". Well Malokee, most leagues find a solution to this. It's called the home team has their preference and the away team has to defer to an alternate color scheme that doesn't clash with the home team. So there is the possibility that the away team might wear their "home" jersey on the road in some instances.

text: back of a length on the hips, goes to pull and misses off the body hustled for pace.
ka-boom! Half-volley on fifth stump, Rahul reaches into his golf bag and finds a three-wood to wind up and drive this sweetly over wide long-on.
good length ball tighter on off stump, forces Rahul into a front foot defensive poke to midwicket.

wkt_text: KL Rahul c Patel b Sakariya 8 (21m 12b 0x4 1x6) SR: 66.66
text: slower ball trap works! 118 kph delivery back of a length on the legs, flicks this loosely to deep backward square leg where Axar gleefully takes the catch five yards inside the rope at chest height.
length ball on fifth stump at 129 kph, heaves a pull into the ground to wide mid-on for one.
postText: Mihir: "different home and away jerseys are necessary in football because the players might confuse their opposition for their own teammates. In cricket though, both teams will always be in their own positions and there wont be any confusion." There won't be any confusion? Say that to a fan watching the sport for the first time. It's the number one query I get from people being introduced to the sport for the first time. "Who is batting and who is fielding? Both teams are wearing the same color." You could say the same thing in baseball, "everyone is in their own positions and there won't be any confusion" and yet all teams wear home jerseys and away jerseys.

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Hooda, no run
text: back of a length on fifth stump at 136 kph, Hooda shuffles outside off and pokes at this but it swings away past the edge.
back of a length darting into the hips at 134 kph, goes to defend and inside edges this off the pads into cover for a tight single.
fullish length ball angled across fourth stump at 134 kph, miscues a drive off the outer half of the bat aiming to clear mid-off but it floats just wide of extra cover for one.
short ball on fifth stump at 132 kph, pulled high over midwicket for one.
fullish length on fifth stump at 130 kph, goes to drive and a thick edge flies to deep third for one.
postText: Ninad: "Too many thoughts people! LSG's previous jersey color limited the visibility of sponsor's logo! So they had to go for a darker shade.. blue is pleasing on eyes under white floodlight making visibility of logos better.. especially you have N number of logos. It was never the case for CSK and RCB! "

text: length ball on seventh stump, shuffles well outside off to drive but picks out cover on the ring.
postText: Sanketh: "The Whole Jersey thing is Overrated. Test matches are played in all whites. That is the best form of cricket anyways!" As CLR James said, "What do they know of cricket who only cricket know?" Sigh....

text: back of a length on fourth stump at 132 kph, plays with an open face and soft hands guiding behind point for one.
postText: Bhupi: "There should be a provision of displaying cricinfo comments on the scoreboard so that the management can see all these creative ideas being delivered here. I am talking on the perspective of home-away jersey btw." It'll happen when Mickey Mouse bids for the next available IPL franchise.

text: dropped! Yuk... Slower bouncer on off stump, Mayers has to wait awhile to play the shot trying to force a cut over short third. He splices it ever so gently to Khaleel Ahmed on the ring. It floats in slow motion.... and he shells it reaching in front of his body at waist height. 1/10 on scale of difficulty. Boycott's nan is fuming.
length ball on fourth stump at 130 kph, slams a drive back to the bowler.
slower ball at 118 kph lands short on the legs, flicked behind square leg for one.
slower short ball again on fifth stump at 107 kph, this time Mayers keeps the hands back to pull over wide mid-on for two.
postText: Sumith: "Wow! Just when you thought Delhi can't do worse in the field, absolute dolly that!" Ricky Ponting was not smiling in the dugout to say the least.

text: length ball on the legs, miscues a pull behind square for one.
sayonara! Length ball on fifth stump at 136 kph, Mayers sends the home fans into a frenzy swiping a pull over wide long-on landing 10 yards behind the rope.
slower ball lands full outside leg stump at 113 kph, flicked high over midwicket for one.
back of a length angled into the body at 134 kph, takes a step down the pitch to punch to long-on for one.

holy moly! Into the second tier over midwicket! Back of a length on fourth stump, Mayers continues to rub salt into the wound from the drop by Khaleel a little while ago and slaughters this 30 rows back.
short and wide, slaps this through cover to the sweeper for one.
postText: Leo: "Why no team is choosing black colour jersey? Initially KKR had but after that no one preffered black." There's a reason why the Raiders jersey is always a top-seller in the NFL no matter their record and no matter if they're based in Oakland, Los Angeles, or Las Vegas. Silver and black is sleek and chic.

text: back of a length slanting this across fifth stump at 99 kph, Mayers spanks this off the back foot through extra cover to beat the sweeper.
preText: Axar Patel into the attack for his left-arm spin. Starts around the wicket to Mayers.

text: terrible misjudgment at deep backward square leg! Full outside leg, Mayers smokes a slog sweep that goes very flat toward Marsh who came in off the rope five yards. The ball barely lands over the rope. Had Marsh stayed on the rope, it was a thigh high catch. Instead it's another miscue for Delhi.
quicker on a good length on middle, defended.
short and wide, slices this behind point to the sweeper for one.

what on earth is going on in the field?! Another terrible misfield, this time by Powell. Hooda charges a fullish length ball on fifth stump and miscues a drive over point. Should be an easy single but Powell overruns the ball charging in and turns one into three.
quicker ball darted in outside leg stump beats Mayers attempting to flick and hits him on the knees, big lbw shout denied but the ball pitched way outside leg.
postText:
Strategic timeout called.

Mayers was on 14 when dropped. Has now sped away to reach 42.

PV: "Khaleel is going to have 'nightMayers' today.."

text: length ball on fifth stump, driven to long-off for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched wide of the cover sweeper for two.

full outside leg stump, slog sweeps this a mile high swirling over deep backward square leg and it barely clears the rope beyond Rossouw's leaping effort. Half-century on IPL debut for Mayers off 28 balls after being dropped on 14.
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on for one.
full on fourth stump, sweeps this along the turf between deep square leg and deep midwicket for two.
back of a length on middle, pokes this off the back foot through backward point for a tight single.
postText: Gokul: "Having single jersey is better, it gives the identity to fan base. CSK's Yellow or RCB's Red are part of their identity. Moreover we tend to keep things simple, just remember we have one time zone, even though the whole nation spans over two geographical time zones." Having a single jersey is better? Spoken like a man who has never worked in marketing and never had the joy of selling five different styles of jersey for the same team, let alone spoken like a fan who has never had the joy of buying five different jerseys to wear of his favorite team... Sigh...

text: length ball poked away for one through the ring.
full on fourth stump, gets on a knee and slogs this high and deep over wide midwicket. Clears the LCD ad boards but lands short of the stands.

the crowd continues to roaaaaaarrrrrrrr! Axar slants this wider on seventh stump, Mayers doesn't care and winds up to launch this nearer the toe of the bat but still clears long-off with Warner's diving effort in vain.
length ball wide outside off, sliced behind point to the sweeper for one.
quicker and short on the hips at 102 kph, flicks this high over backward square leg for two.
full outside leg, sweeps this off a bottom edge to short fine leg for none.
postText: Pranali: "When winter turns to spring and summer you wear warm bright pastels... Cricket or baseball jerseys should never be black". I'm partial to the Kansas City Royals light blue, very pastel.

text: massive over extra cover! Full and wide on the guideline, carves this drive flat and barely clears the rope.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mayers, no run
text: good length outside leg, goes back to flick through midwicket and misses. Mayers slaps the ground with his bat in frustration.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
short ball on off, slaps this back off Kuldeep's hands off a bounce before a carom goes to long-on for one.
short on fourth stump, punches to extra cover who misfields to allow a single.

wkt_text: DJ Hooda c Warner b Kuldeep Yadav 17 (31m 18b 0x4 0x6) SR: 94.44
text: flighted a lot more on a full length on fourth stump at 81 kph, Hooda is through the shot too early and skies the drive to Warner at long-off. He waits under it for a simple catch taken on his haunches seven yards in from the rope.
postText: You can follow the ball-by-ball commentary of the match in Hindi and in Tamil too.>

text: back of a length on the stumps, flicked through midwicket for one.
postText: Hari: "I am here to say my opinion about Jersey.Looks like JERSEY gonna win against PNG". I like it Hari! Josh Lawrenson and Asa Tribe become Jersey's first two ODI centurions today v PNG in Windhoek.

text: full on the legs, driven to long-on for one.

wkt_text: KR Mayers  b Patel 73 (53m 38b 2x4 7x6) SR: 192.10
text: goodness what turn! Axar digs this into the pitch on a good length on fifth stump, Mayers goes to cut and the ball jacknifes back into off stump. If that happened on a highway there'd be a 20-car pileup and three lanes of traffic closed while the police investigate the cause of the crash. Extraordinary delivery.
postText: Out for 73 after being dropped on 14 by Khaleel Ahmed. Gulp...

text: good length ball turns sharply from fourth stump, beats a prod. Fumble by Sarfaraz on a simple take.
postText: Chaitanya: "Ok, now I have a difficult question to ask. Whom will QDK replace once he's back?" Decisions decisions...

text: back of a length on fourth stump, this time punched through cover for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended.
postText: Sam: "The New Jersey Jackals aren't an MLB team, but have a sleek black and red outfit, as do the Brooklyn Nets and NY Giants 3rd kit both are black and quite popular among the local fans." Ahhh... the Jackals. In my neck of the woods! They play their games at Yogi Berra Stadium on the campus of Montclair State University. It hugs Route 46 before the merge onto Route 3 toward MetLife Stadium. Memories....

text: full on the stumps, sweeps this through the leg side for one.
full outside leg, comes down the wicket and flicks through wide long-on for one.

someone send a nurse to check on the ball, or the sightscreen, or both! Floated full on fifth stump, Stoinis winds up and clobbers this straight down the ground and it leaves a dent in the black hitters' background.
fuller and slower outside off, punches this along the ground to long-off for one.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Pandya, 1 leg bye
text: full on the legs, takes a step forward to nudge into midwicket for one.
postText: Roshan : "And talking about PNG, what a wonderful Jersey they have! (That too black)." The Barramundis do wear exceptional kit.

text: full on the legs, sweeps this firmly behind square leg for one.
postText: Jagan: "Mayers should continue to play even if QDK comes back. Mayers medium pace would be worth gold in this pitch."

text: back of a length on the legs, backs away to punch through cover for one.
postText: SidB : "I know QdK is a big player and in good form, but given the kind of innings Myers has played on this pitch, I'd be very tempted to open with him until he fails maybe a couple of times. Last year, PBKS dropped Bhanuka for Bairstow when he was in red hot form, and then later neither Bairstow nor Bhanuka when he came back had the same impact"

text: full on the legs, chipped to long-on for one.
postText: Sanket : "It's so good to see LSG using stoinis up the order. In the last season he was batting too low and thus not able to make lot of impact on the game. There were couple of games he couldn't finish them just because there werent much of balls left."

text: good length ball angled into the legs, miscues a drive back to the bowler.
postText: Asish: "Pooran who is exceptional against spin especially left arm spin is kept for death overs and Krunal is sent ahead of him, can't understand the think tank from LSG. Atleast they sent Stoinis at no 5. "

text: back of a length on middle, punches this wide of extra cover for one.
postText: Ricky Ponting being interviewed on the sideline this over by the host broadcaster, says the fielding, "will be addressed" later on. With a cheeky grin.

text: comes down the track to a ball darted wider on seventh stump on a good length, checks to a defensive prod back to the bowler.
good length ball on middle, flicked through wide midwicket for two.
postText: If you are seeing this on a mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

wkt_text: MP Stoinis c †Khan b Ahmed 12 (13m 10b 0x4 1x6) SR: 120.00
text: length ball angled across sixth stump at 134 kph, Stoinis chases at this flat-footed and slices a thick edge through to the keeper at waist height. Khaleel charges off and celebrates wildly like a man who definitely and most certainly did not drop a different batter on 14 who went on to make 73...
length ball on off at 139 kph, defended back down the pitch.
postText: Bim: "hey Peter...I'm posting this from just outside of Yogi Berra in Little Falls.... Driving towards MetLife on Rt 3 amid light rain...! :)" Hmmm.... I'd be tempted to pull off at Clifton Commons on the way there for one of the many food options available.

text: good length ball on fourth stump at 138 kph, defended to extra cover.
length ball on the hips at 135 kph, flicked with a swivel pull past deep backward square leg to the rope, one bounce over.
postText: Rutvik: "You always play the in-form players and iirc, Mayers and QDK and even Wood in bowling have been much better than Stoinis the batter and Pooran over the last year. "

text: fullish length ball in the slot on fourth stump at 138 kph, Pooran goes rich over wide long-on depositing a drive 10 yards behind the LCD ad boards.
slower bouncer beats Pooran's attempted pull at 129 kph and thuds into the helmet before dribbling gently back down the pitch for none.
postText: Play ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Pandya, 1 leg bye
text: full outside leg, misses a flick coming down the track and deflects off the pads wide of the keeper behind square leg for an extra.
postText: Prashanth: "Some other cool jerseys: (1) Oregon Ducks Green " They always produce some extraordinary swag with Phil Knight's megabucks on campus behind them. They also have a funky basketball court design.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run
text: missed stumping! Flighted full on off stump and spins past the edge on a clumsy poke. Pooran overbalances and his foot leaves the crease but Sarfaraz continues to struggle behind the stumps fumbling the take.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run
text: good length ball outside leg, goes back to defend as it spins back toward middle.
good length ball on the legs again, this time flicked through midwicket for a sharp two.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run
text: floated full on fourth stump, smothered on the front foot.
postText: Aditya: "No point in wild celebrations after dropping a dolly and also getting clubbed for 6 and a 4. When will these bowlers learn.." Khaleel has had an interesting night to say the least....

text: full on off, drives this firmly back to Yadav who fumbles this and allows it to slip past toward mid-off for one.
postText:
Strategic timeout called.

Continuing the topic of black jerseys and how sleek they look, San Diego State Aztecs are in the NCAA Men's Final Four tonight taking on Florida Atlantic in front of 80,000 fans in Houston at NRG Stadium. Both teams making the Final Four for the first time. They'll take on the winner of UConn and Miami. Miami don't wear black, but the orange/green color scheme worn by athletes at The U has always been a hugely popular one. The Aztecs, Owls, Hurricanes and Huskies. Very unique nicknames all.

text: starts with a slower ball at 101 kph on a good length on fifth stump, Pooran goes to cut and bottom edges this into the ground bouncing to the keeper.
preText: Sakariya back after the break.

text: in the slot at full pace on fourth stump at 125 kph, Pooran is locked in and unloads this 10 rows back over long-on.
short ball on middle, Pooran swats this with disdain over square leg, one bounce over the rope.
postText: Sam: "In terms of cricketing franchises, the BBL teams have quite a nice range of designs to be honest. Really like what they come up with". The jerseys worn for the Indigenous Round of matches are exceptional.

text: another slower ball lands on a fullish length on the wide guideline at 96 kph, this time Pooran chases it and slices a drive tamely well short of the cover sweeper for one.
slower ball lands wide outside the guidelines, left alone and wide called.
length ball on fifth stump at full pace 129 kph, cross bat swat barely clears Warner leaping up at long-on.
postText: Manthan Jain: "In a discussion of black jerseys no one pointing towards the Black caps is disappointing...." Oh we did, and the All Blacks too. That was ages ago.

text: length ball with pace off at 100 kph wide outside off, chops a bottom edge into the off side for a single.
postText: Ninad: "Sarfaraz's wicket-keeping reminds me of early days of Dravid's comback as a wicket-keeper. Such a batting talent in a team for a role in which clearly he is not comfortable with! "

text: fullish length ball wide outside off, scuffs a drive down the ground for one.
postText: Zain: "Even tho i'm liking the shade of LSG jersey from the last year, I still feel they should've gone with Green. Too many blue jerseys in IPL, it gets boring seeing repetitive shades, Its all about colours guys this tournament and I feel many shades are missed here. Moreover, please ditch this gold and silver colour obsession, looks ultra cheap here." Spoken like a person who has never experienced the joy of wearing cheap fake gold/silver. Sigh....

text: full on fifth stump, driven down the ground to long-on for one.
postText: Gaurav : "I just joined the conversation, why are we discussing on the Jerseys??" Because the non-strikers are staying in their crease instead of leaving a yard early. But that could change in these last 16 deliveries....

text: full and wide at 136 kph, driven down the ground to long-off for one.
postText: Devang: "Die mannschaft's back and red striped jersey in which they thrashed Brazil 7-1". Ah, those were the days in 2014...

shortText: Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, no run
text: full on sixth stump, Pooran pulverizes a drive straight into Krunal's knee at the non-striker's end. He was still facing Pooran so was hit on the front of the pads. No harm done, except if you're Pooran and just were robbed of runs.
length ball on the wide guideline, slaps this tennis racquet style wide of long-off, diving stop by Prithvi to save two runs.
postText: Moti Prakash: "@Zain You have hurt the Mumbai Indian Fans. Mumbai Gold and Blue jersey is the most beautiful one among all the blue jerseys in IPL."

text: full and wide, speared outside the guideline, wide called.
waist height full toss at 138 kph on off stump, prodded gently to long-off for one.
postText: Varun: "How is sarfaraz doing behind the stumps??" Ehhhh.... Ummm... Look away now Sarfaraz.... Well, I guess by comparison to Khaleel's fielding, Sarfaraz looks great. It's all relative.

text: shot of the day! Well, tied with the similar one Mayers laced over extra cover for six. Length ball on seventh stump, Pooran powers this flat over the extra cover rope. Sharp catch by a ground staff member.
postText: Jimmy: "I personally like the RR jersey in pink, which stands out and look good." Just wait until the San Francisco Unicorns take the field in 2023 Major League Cricket in Texas. #SparkleArmy

text: length ball wide outside off at 123 kph, opens the face to guide this behind point for two.

wkt_text: N Pooran c Shaw b Ahmed 36 (24m 21b 2x4 3x6) SR: 171.42
text: fullish length ball outside off, smokes a drive flat to Prithvi in the ring at extra cover. He catches it in self-preservation at waist height. Absolute howitzer off the bat of Pooran but he couldn't have picked out Shaw any better.
length ball on fifth stump, slams a pull over wide midwicket to the rope.
postText: Kshitij : "Talking about Jerseys, one should really think about the Boston Bruins from NHL. They really worship their team and having a great looking Jersey does help..Much love from Boston guys!" Boston has four very different unique color schemes for their four pro sports teams. Green for the Celtics, Blue/Silver for the Patriots. Red for the Red Sox. And Black/Gold for the Bruins.

text: length ball wide outside off, opens the face to guide this behind point but picks out the fielder on the ring.
postText: Rohan: "As a LSG fan, I must deliver my vote of thanks for Khaleel!!"

text: full on fifth stump, slashes at this to the cover sweeper for one.
postText: Duncan: "It looks tacky as hell but I do love the 'gold' foil detailing on certain teams' kits. Someone needs to bite the bullet and have an all-gold one made." I'm sure there's a boxer who had to have done it. Speaking of which in reference to the black jerseys that have gotten shouts in the replies, I can't think of a more intimidating sight in the 1980s and early 1990s than Mike Tyson walking to the ring in black trunks.

text: slower bouncer on fifth stump, left alone and called a wide from square leg. Sarfaraz signals to Warner that he wants to review the wide. Warner laughs and says no. Hmmm.... It was a tight call. Worth it under the new rules.
full on the stumps, driven down the ground for one.
preText: Khaleel Ahmed has been replaced. The umpire signals for the impact player to enter the match and Aman Khan takes the field. Wearing some bright yellow/orange neon sneakers too.

text: full on fifth stump, heaves a drive down the ground for one.
postText: Zain: "Talking about Black Jerseys. Pune Warriors India did had Black/Grey jersey in IPL. But their performance made other teams ditch Black Forever!!"

text: slides this slower ball wide outside off, left alone, wide called.
preText: Sakariya comes left-arm around the stumps to the lefty Krunal for the awkward angle.
postText: Shreyam Dhakal: "The only black sheep in this batting lineup might be Kl Rahul today, otherwise the runrate is quite good."

text: full in the slot, winds up and clobbers this high and deep over wide long-on.
slower bouncer at 113 kph, too high and wide called on height.
postText: Camera has just panned to the Delhi Capitals dugout showing analyst Sriram Somayajula. He used to be USA's team analyst in the early 2010s and was recently in Texas for the Major League Cricket Draft aiding the Seattle Orcas (whose ownership is a joint partnership between Microsoft's Satya Nadella and the Delhi Capitals ownership group).

text: slower ball lands full on middle at 101 kph, Badoni channels the death overs heroics of the guy whose name he rhymes with and crunches a drive high and deep over long-on 10 rows back.

wkt_text: A Badoni c †Khan b Sakariya 18 (10m 7b 1x4 2x6) SR: 257.14
text: slower length ball on fourth stump, Badoni shuffles across trying to scoop this over fine leg but is thrown off by the lack of pace and it pings the gloves before ballooning to the left of Sarfaraz, who shuffles five yards and reaches forward for a simple take.
postText: Sachin : "Ponting is not risking even 6 balls with Khalil's fielding. That's how bad he was today in field."

text: well how about that for an impact player switch! Slower ball lands full on fourth stump, Gowtham not fooled one bit and channels his inner dark knight by destroying this over wide midwicket landing just past the LCD ad boards.
preText: Another impact player is being signaled by the umpire. Badoni is the player being subbed out after he's just been dismissed. This time it is K Gowtham charging out to the middle for Lucknow Super Giants to face exactly one ball. He will have a role to play with the ball/in the field too obviously.
postText:
9.24 pm So LSG puts up a very robust total aided by some woeful fielding by Delhi Capitals. The biggest gaffe of them all was Khaleel Ahmed's inexplicable drop of Kyle Mayers on 14 at short third man who went on to blast 73 off 38. Can Delhi chase it down? Stay tuned to find out. Reminder that the impact player subs have been used by both sides. K Gowtham comes in for Badoni on the LSG side while Aman Khan has been swapped in for Khaleel Ahmed for Delhi's chase. Stay tuned for the start of the reply shortly.

Kyle Mayers on the sideline after his 73 off 38: "It was a tricky surface at the start. It kept a bit low and the bounce was variable. But it's still a good wicket. Our bowlers need to use the wicket, it's gripping a bit and I think we'll be in good stead. [On the ball that got him out.] I think that's the drier end of the pitch. There's an area on that pitch that's very dry and the other end is full of grass so I think the spinners need to execute from that end in particular. It's a new surface. I tried to get information from the guys. It's tricky trying to get accustomed as fast as possible. [On being dropped on 14] It's always good to get some luck. Sometimes you play a good shot and a guy takes a blinder. So I'm happy to get an opportunity. I just wanted to do well on my first game and help my team and I did that."

text: length ball at 123 kph seaming in toward middle, Shaw shuffles across to flick through square leg for one.
preText: Mayers has the new ball in hand bowling to Shaw. Warner off strike.

text: length ball angled wide outside off, goes to cut and misses.
length ball angled past the guideline outside off, left alone and wide called.
postText: Vivek : "This impact rule is strange. The incoming player can bat even though the person they are replacing is already out? Also, why did LSG not pick a (proper) bowler who could impact a full innings instead of focusing on a single ball to bat?" Every ball matters. Hard to have a bigger impact than a 600 strike rate!

text: fullish length on sixth stump, slaps this 123 kph delivery in the gap between mid-off and extra cover to the rope.
postText: Jared: "Calling it now - that last ball 6 by Gowtham is gonna be the difference for LSG winning today"

text: short on seventh stump, cuts this crisply but straight to cover.
back of a length pitching on leg stump, angled away toward off, defended behind point.
postText: Avesh Khan leaves the field having just split the webbing on his right/bowling hand making the stop on that last ball.

text: length ball outside off, slapped to cover, diving stop by Rahul turns four into one.
fullish length ball on sixth stump, goes to drive over mid-off and splices this off the outer half of the bat floating just wide of mid-off tracking right landing a yard out of reach for a single.
length ball angled down the leg side at 136 kph, wide called.
preText: Jaydev Unadkat, who has made a fortune of rupees and crores in his IPL career, now with the new ball for the second over.

text: 133 kph delivery lands back of a length on off, superb back foot punch timed behind point to the rope.
back of a length into the hips, goes back to flick this 133 kph delivery into midwicket for one.
postText: Ishan Jain: "Kyle Mayers is the super rich kid of gully cricket who bring his own bat, ball and probably the entire kit. Otherwise there is no universe where you open with bat and ball."

text: short on fourth stump at 129 kph, pulled firmly through midwicket to the rope. Ganguly and Ponting nod approvingly in the dugout.
length ball on fifth stump, short arm jab pull dragged through wide midwicket for two.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg and beats the diving fielder to the rope.
Half-tracker on the hips, Shaw swivels and clobbers this over backward square leg, one bounce over the rope.
preText: Gowtham comes on around the wicket to the right-hander Shaw.

text: another short ball on middle this time, pulled to deep midwicket for one.

Warner goes to reverse sweep this fullish length ball on middle and gets hit in the family jewels... Big lbw shout denied. Warner is not the only one speechless, but for different reasons to everyone else watching.
short on middle, backs away and goes to cut, picks out backward point.
short on middle, pulls this fiercely over square leg and wide midwicket on the rope has no chance.
length ball on fifth stump, goes to cut and bottom edges this to cover.
length ball at 133 kph on fourth stump, Shaw shuffles back and across to flick into the leg side.
preText: Avesh Khan is back on the field after getting his hand repaired. Will bowl the fourth over.

postText:
Joy: "@Ishan Kallis certainly falls in that category too."

Salman Khan : "@Ishan Jain. Shane watson was one such example of opening batter and opening bowler for RR, CSK as well as Aussies."

It's okay. For some fans, the world of cricket only began in 2023.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Warner, no run

short ball on middle, goes back to defend.
preText: Mark Wood into the attack.

text: back of a length on fourth stump, defended on the back foot to cover.

short ball tailing down the leg side at 140 kph, wide called on the line as Shaw is late on a pull. Wood seems keen to want to review a wide. Has the captain agreed with him? They let it pass without going for a review. On a separate note, Wood is also not happy with the footmarks on his landing and so a delay results with the umpires asking the ground staff to come make some repairs.
postText: Anand: "Manoj Prabhakar. Neil Johnson. A few more opening examples for both bowling and batting!"

wkt_text: PP Shaw  b Wood 12 (24m 9b 2x4 0x6) SR: 133.33
text: bullseye! Wood rattles the off stump wood at 147 kph! Bowled on a good length angled in from wide of the crease, Shaw's feet never move and he flails at this tamely. He's beaten badly and the bails go flying.

wkt_text: MR Marsh  b Wood 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: double bullseye! Another 147 kph bullet leaves a big dent in off stump about three-quarters of the way up! Marsh shuffled across to cover his stumps and goes for an expansive drive to a ball pitching on fifth stump but is beaten by the sharp inward movement.
postText: Sarfaraz to face the hat-trick ball.

text: length ball on fifth stump, goes to drive this and a thick edge goes behind to the keeper. Free hit though so no harm done.
postText: Neeraj: "This is what raw pace can do...Clear hint to Indian selectors here before the WC"

text: interesting choice of hat-trick ball when you've just bowled two guys with good to fullish length deliveries... Wood goes for a bouncer that sails over Sarfaraz ducking on middle stump. No wide called. Warner asks for a review wanting a wide/no ball called for a second bouncer in the over. Third umpire agrees that it is a second bouncer of the over on height and a no ball is called with a free hit to come. Judgement call by the umpire since Sarfaraz was ducking and he was projecting the height.
length ball on fourth stump, defended into the off side for none.

text: Sarfaraz can't escape the short ball from Wood! He gets plenty of bat on it, enough for it to sail to deep fine leg who is fielding very straight and takes a chest high catch three yards in from the rope.

wkt_text: RR Rossouw c Mayers b Ravi Bishnoi 30 (24m 20b 3x4 1x6) SR: 150.00
text: full on leg stump, shuffles well across the stumps and goes to sweep and misses off the pads/shoes, huge lbw shout denied and the ball pops up off a deflection of some kind behind the wicket for a catch claimed by the short fine leg fielder. Looked pretty stone dead live. LSG have gone for a review. Rossouw has started marching off without even waiting for the replays. Nothing on bat or glove on the initial shot but the ball has popped up off the bat of the bat on the follow through in bizarre fashion and a catch was taken by the fielder coming over from short fine leg. We're not even going to get to the ball-tracking for lbw because he's been given out caught.
full on the stumps at 145 kph, driven to long-on for two.
145 kph lands full and well outside leg stump, flicked to deep backward square leg for two.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked into midwicket for one.

146 kph good length ball on fifth stump beats Powell prodding forward.
postText: Aadil: "Shouldn't Rossouw have been out LBW instead of caught. I thought the since the ball hit the pad first it lbw should have been checked first." Out caught supersedes lbw. Same would have happened if he had tried to smother a ball with a spinner bowling and the ball comes up off the pad first, then bat/inside edge/glove to a silly point or forward short leg fielder.

text: 99 kph googly skids on from a good length on fourth stump and zings Powell in front of middle stump on the back foot playing back to punch through midwicket. He read the googly but it just came onto him far quicker than he expected and he's too late getting the bat down. Big lbw shout upheld. Powell marches off without a moment's thought for a review. It was stone dead.

Strategic timeout called.

So Aman Khan, who replaced Khaleel as the impact player, makes 4.

If you are seeing this on a mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

wkt_text: AR Patel c sub (PN Mankad) b Wood 16 (21m 11b 1x4 1x6) SR: 145.45
text: It's Wood's night for sure! Leg stump half-volley flicked effortlessly but picks out deep square leg. Sub fielder Mankad takes a simple catch at chest height four yards inside the rope. Not as spectacular a delivery as his previous three wicket-taking balls but still effective nonetheless.
preText: Mark Wood is taking his sweet time marking out his run before starting the final over....
postText: Can Wood make it five? If not six wiping out the complete tail?

text: full in the slot on fifth stump, drives this inside out over mid-off to the rope. First boundary conceded by Wood in this match.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes to pull and misses.
postText: Srinath: "Are there no penalties for slow over rate? Every game has been 4 hrs and the time taken between balls and overs has been inexplicable." Major League Baseball has instituted a pitch clock for this season. 15 seconds between pitches with nobody on base, 20 seconds between pitches with a man on base. They shaved 30 minutes off the average game during spring training when it was first employed before the season officially started on Thursday. Maybe something for cricket admins to think about.

text: bouncer on leg stump, ducked under to leave alone.

wkt_text: C Sakariya c Pandya b Wood 4 (5m 4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: Wood has a five-for after making the switch to LSG! Length ball outside leg stump, Sakariya tries to heave this over the leg side but is rushed and it flutters up off the splice of the bat to Krunal at short midwicket inside the ring. Simple catch.
postText: That may have been the final touch to nudge Kyle Mayers off the Player of the Match podium.

shortText: Yadav to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
text: full ball outside off. Bit of swing away and he mistimes a drive to mid off. A gentle roar for that first ball at Mohali since 2019 at the IPL
preText:
3.29pm Dhawan to open with Prabhsimran Singh. Umesh Yadav has the new ball. Interestingly Dhawan has never scored a fifty as captain.

Play ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

AS: "Whats the point of having overseas players on the impact player list? " -- Just had a re-read of the playing conditions and you are allowed to have overseas players on the bench because the substitute fielders can also come only from the five-man bench. The impact player will also come from that bench, which will definitely be an Indian player.

3.15pm Hello all, welcome to the first double-header of the IPL. Mohali has stayed dry so far, something that was in doubt yesterday. Interesting that V Iyer does not make KKR's XI at the start, not only will that be a blow to his confidence but also the side does not trust him to bowl either. We may see him or Jagadeesan as the impact sub later when KKR bat.

Prabhsimran was the likely opener after a terrific SMAT for the Kings. There's a bunch of different ways they could play the impact sub later in the day, maybe even bringing in a Rishi Dhawan midway through their batting innings for his power hitting.

All right. What do you make of the teams? Let Sreshth know, and also ask him whom he is supporting.

Sifat Khawry: "It's so delightful, and a proud moment for Afghanistan to have its genuine batter Gurbaz making debut in the IPL"

PBKS: 1 Shikhar Dhawan (capt), 2 Prabhsimran Singh, 3 Bhanuka Rajapaksa, 4 Sikandar Raza, 5 Jitesh Sharma (wk), 6 Shahrukh Khan, 7 Sam Curran, 8 Nathan Ellis, 9 Harpreet Brar, 10 Rahul Chahar, 11 Arshdeep Singh. The subs are Rishi Dhawan, Taide, Short, Bhatia and Rathee.

KKR: 1 Rahmanullah Gurbaz, 2 Mandeep Singh, 3 Nitish Rana, 4 Rinku Singh, 5 Andre Russell, 6 Shardul Thakur, 7 Sunil Narine, 8 Tim Southee, 9 Anukul Roy, 10 Umesh Yadav, 11 Varun Chakravarthy. The subs are Suyash, Arora, Jagadeesan, V Iyer and Wiese

3.01pm Time for the coin to be flipped... KKR win the toss and bowl. Rana says rain has been around, and expects moisture. "Very few get this opportunity, so I'm excited to be captain," he says. Southee, Russell, Narine and Gurbaz are his foreign players. Dhawan wanted to bowl first as well. He wants to maintain his consistency in the tournament, and announces Rajapaksa, Curran, Ellis... and *forgets the fourth name*.

"How is the weather in Mohali? Will we have the first rain-affected match this IPL?" --- Looks bright and clear for now, Vinod Rajpal

Micky_Cremona: "Hello from UK! Not a good pre-season for Punjab. Jonny injured, Liam coming back from injury, Dhawan hardly had competitive cricket... but we've got Sikandar Raza in the form of his life! Hopefully he will deliver!"

The pitch looks "light brown in colour" to Daren Ganga, and there isn't much grass. It feels hard too, and there shouldn't be too much of changes while batting first or chasing. There are relatively uneven boundary dimensions at the ground.

2.50pm Dhawan, Raza, Curran and Arshdeep on one side; Russell, Narine, Thakur and Ferguson on the other. Who do you think are the favourites today? Tom Moody has already made up his mind. And ICYMI, Australian Matt Short has replaced Bairstow for PBKS, and might even open with Dhawan.

Neal: "Keen to see how Sammy Curran will be used as a batsman, and expecting big things from Shikhar Dhawan to get his name in front of selectors in an ODI World Cup year" --- I'm afraid Dhawan might never play for India again due to a combination of his own dip in form, Gill's remarkable success, and the plethora of opening options that India have

You can follow ball-by-ball commentary of the game in Hindi, and in Tamil.

2.40pm Both of today's teams have been impacted by injuries or unavailability: no Iyer, Shakib, Litton, Rabada, Livingstone and Bairstow to begin with. So how do KKR cover for Iyer? Sanjay Manjrekar and Tom Moody discuss. But never mind, Iyer's replacement Nitish Rana says captaincy is "not new" to him.

One side has a new captain by accident, another by choice. But they both opted for fresh coaches too, which Sreshth's preview highlights. Both PBKS and KKR will be keen to improve on their performance from last year, when they had ended sixth and seventh, respectively.

Bhargav: "It's the battle between two blow-hot-blow-cold teams."

2.30pm Time to travel north-east from Ahmedabad to Mohali; time to settle the dust of the IPL's mega opening less than 24 hours earlier. Because now the juggernaut moves on to Punjab Kings vs Kolkata Knight Riders in Mohali on what is a double-header Saturday. This is Himanshu saying hello from the live coverage this afternoon, as Sreshth gets set to wear the purple-and-golden jersey before joining the action.

text: streaky runs as this short-ish slower ball on off surprises the batter. Tries to tap it square but the ball takes a bottom edge and goes to Gurbaz awkwardly on the bounce. Misfield, slip gives it a chase

shortText: Yadav to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
text: that's more firm. Sweet sound off the bat. Good length ball outside off and guided after riding the bounce. To point
#HereWeGo from Prabhsimran. Umesh errs by bowling full on his toes and the batter smartly whips it off his pads and gets a six beyond deep backward square leg. The crowd's delighted!

shortText: Yadav to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
text: good length ball, fourth-stump line and Singh doesn't have the room to get on top of this kind of delivery. Pushed towards cover point off the back foot
postText: CHANDAN: "Why does Punjab not have an extra batter as they are batting first?" -- They might get one in, once a top-order batter is out. Maybe Prabhsimran goes out for a Taide or a Bhatia. Or Rishi Dhawan for an all-round option.

text: almost played on! Prabhsimran would've had his heart in his mouth there. Tried to drive at a ball without any movement of the feet, away from his body. Inside edge took it past leg stump to short fine
full ball around middle and leg. He's searching for the swing but this slides into leg instead. Singh flicks it well, flicks it fine, and beats Umesh at deep fine leg!
dancing shoes on! Good length ball outside off but Singh wants to give Southee a charge. Gets forward, then offers a flat-batted thwack, and gets it past mid off this time!

shortText: Southee to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
text: short of length, fourth-stump line. Cut to point, from close to his body.

shortText: Southee to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
text: fullish ball on off. Rolls his fingers over this ball. Gently pushed back to the bowler

sounded like nostalgia! Short ball on middle and Prabhsimran comes down slightly, and as the ball gets to him, he pulls in front of square magnificently. Like watching your favourite batter play your favourite shot as a kid. Clean sound off the willow.
preText: Dhawan must be itching to get on strike. Just to feel bat on ball once.

wkt_text: Prabhsimran Singh c †Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Southee 23 (10m 12b 2x4 2x6) SR: 191.66
text: Southee has the last laugh as this good length ball angles down leg and Singh can't help himself but try to flick it fine. This time it gets an edge and Gurbaz moves to his left to gobble it up. Singh's cameo is over, but it has given the Kings a positive start

shortText: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
text: full ball on middle and off. Dhawan caresses a drive after prodding forward, and Rana has to run to his left from mid off to intercept. Very nearly beat him
preText: Bhanuka Rajapaksa. Blows hot sometimes, blows cold on a few occasions. What version will be see this afternoon? Dhawan to face though.

shortText: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
text: short of length on middle, and he tucks it from near his body to the off side

shortText: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
text: short length ball around middle, and he cuts it to point on this occasion. Timing is good, but placement is to the fielder
first runs for the captain. Full ball around off and Dhawan tried the drive but it takes an edge to deep third. Goes along the ground.
full ball around middle and off. Gently tapped to the off side with soft hands
preText: Dhawan was given a packed off-side field by Umesh. Same with Rajapaksa.

text: fullish ball outside off. Slaps a cut, but the slower ball makes him fail in his shot-placement. To point
oh that's been punished. Length ball, width offered too while angling across. Dhawan pounces onto it in a flash, and slaps a cut in front of square. Over the infield too.
preText: Stat alert: Bhanuka Rajapaksa is fifth on the list of highest strike-rates in the first 10 balls in IPL 2022. Here's the full list: Tim David (197), Jitesh Sharrma (177), Livingstone (176), Maxwell (169) and Rajapaksa (168)

text: good length ball outside off and Dhawan gets forward and meets a slap from near his waist height. Gets it between the short gap between point and cover point. Replays show the gap was only 9m wide
another cut off this good length ball, but point manages to move across to his left and cuts it off
good length ball on his pads and comfortably flicked off his pads to deep midwicket for a couple
preText: around the stumps to Bhanuka

text: good length ball outside off, and Rajapaksa gently taps a cut towards cover point for a single

shortText: Southee to S Dhawan, no run
text: rolls his fingers over this delivery. Good length ball outside off and Dhawan attempts a cut, reaching out a tad bit too. Misses, thinks about whether it should've been a wide or not. Feels that's fine, as it indeed was. End of over
around the stumps from Narine to start off. Full outside off and pushed towards cover
preText: Time for KKR's most legendary cricketer to have a bowl

text: full ball on middle. Ball just hangs a bit in the air before getting to the batter. Gently fended back
that was all intent from the batter. He chose to get on top of Narine and did that by coming down the track and slicing a lofted shot over mid off.
breaks the wrists to hit it over extra cover. Fullish ball around off. Rajapaksa moves leg side, opening up access towards cover, and then sends it over the infield for four more
good length ball on middle, and angling into leg. Rajapaksa shoulders his arms, ball hits his thigh, they take a single. But umpire says no single because he offered no shot there

icing on the cake! And the most destructive shot of the over. Narine goes fullish around middle and leg. Rajapaksa dances down the track while staying outside the ball's line. Hammers it over the non-striker, and this has enough muscle to go for six more
postText: Team fifty done in five overs. Across the last three IPL seasons, Narine has been more effective against right-handers (average 29.85, ER 6.14) than against left-handers (average 37.80, ER 7.15)

shortText: Varun to S Dhawan, no run
text: coming around the stumps. Good length, fourth-stump line outside off. Guided off the back foot to the leg side
preText: Time for Varun Chakravarthy. Originally a mystery spinner, now the question is whether he still has that mystery. His stocks fluctuate every season.

shortText: Varun to S Dhawan, no run
text: falls just short of Anukul at midwicket Half-tracker around off and Dhawan got too excited after seeing the length. Went deep and pulled, but mistimed it. Was in the air for a bit
over the stumps now. Good length originating around leg and sliding towards off. Punched towards cover

around the stumps again. Chakravarthy goes short after spotting the batter changing his position. He moved to the off side to try and pull behind square, but ends up losing his balance and mess up the attempt
good length ball just outside off, and guided it late to short third for a single

carves a four through the off side by moving to the leg side early and then cutting dangerously past cover point. Dhawan went back and created the width. Was a good length ball around leg that drifted to off.
short ball around middle. Pulls from low to high, getting some elevation but the ball lands well short of Rinku at deep square leg
preText: Time for Kolkata's fresh transfer recruit: Shardul Thakur.

text: thumped down the ground, and it goes for four despite Umesh's acrobatic effort at long off. Good length ball on leg but he comes down the track to convert it into a fuller ball. Then lets the bat do the talking, first beating Rana at mid off and then forcing a big run from Umesh from long on to long off
short ball around middle. Goes for a cut over the keeper, but gets no bat. Shardul appeals for caught behind. He seems interested. Given not out. They're not reviewing
lazy elegance as the commentators of yore used to call it. Short of length on leg. Rajapaksa raises the front leg and nonchalantly clips this from near his hips to send it over fine leg.
short ball ball on middle. He tries to play a late guide past the keeper's left, but ends up hitting it to short third
yorker length attempted. Very nearly it. Bhanuka digs it away towards the off side and they scamper across for one. Time out
around the stumps, landing full around leg. He gets low to sweep. Ball hits his bat's handle.
preText: Narine again. They need to break this blossoming partnership.

text: fullish ball on middle, and clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Played gently enough for them to comfortable pinch a second run

poor from Varun at short fine leg. Good length ball around leg and he mistimes a sweep, playing more of a paddle. Varun at short fine runs to his right and then dives awkwardly, and the ball goes under his body for four.
Rajapaksa lucky as he comes down the track trying to loft this length ball over his head. Delivery takes an inside edge, goes past the stumps to short fine on this occasion
full ball on middle and leg. Goes back in his crease and taps it to midwicket for a walking single

chipped in the air but falls short of Rinku at long on. Rajapaksa came down the ground and checked his flick after getting to the pitch. That's probably what saved him too, because Rinku is a fast runner and a safe pair of hands
good length ball around off and angling accross. Punched to Dre Russ at deep point
preText: Dhawan has faced only 2.1 overs so far.

text: around the stumps. Full ball, width offered, Rajapaksa pokes at it with the hands going away from his body. Manages to get the nudge between keeper and short third!
inside edge onto his pads as he tries to mow a leg-side swipe across the line. Full ball around off that he tried to smack through midwicket

shortText: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
text: yorker length, well almost. Lands around leg. Guided towards cover point. No run

shortText: Thakur to S Dhawan, (no ball) FOUR
text: that's a wild one and Dhawan has hammered it over point! Ball slips out of his hand, neck high delivery but not dangerous since it is very wide. Dhawan slashes at it, and slices it well enough for a one-bounce four to point. Free hit
overpitched ball just outside off. Checks a drive to cover for a single
preText: Chandrakant Pandit, KKR head coach: "It's difficult. Players coming in with a lot of experience makes a difference. I am pleased to have good response from the players, not just the Indians but even the overseas players, they respond. Unfortunately, [Lockie] Ferguson is not fit for this game. We are missing Shreyas Iyer but still we are managing with what we have in the team. 180-200 should be chaseable."
postText: Umpire calls over and the fielding side is moving around. But then umpire Oxenford hears on the earpiece that he has one delivery still left. So we will have to reset again. Shardul was at the boundary but has to get back.

text: around the stumps. Good length ball, fourth-stump line. Guided towards point and that's finally over.

Varun around the stumps. Bowls a length ball outside off. Dhawan gets low, bending his knees, stays in the crease too, and the extra second allows him to bring the bat square beautifully to pull along the carpet for four
full ball around leg stump. Clipped off his pads to deep backward square leg
preText: over the wicket now.

text: Rajapaksa lucky. Fullish ball just outside leg stump. Rajapaksa goes for a sweep, but the ball hits his arm and rolls past the keeper
preText: Reetam: "@Sresth: Looks like a belter of a pitch or is it just bad bowling?" -- Mohali has historically been a belter. No difference here.

text: half-tracker just outside off and pulled from behind the stumps to deep midwicket. Varun tried some sort of variation there with the legbreak grip but there was no turn anyway
good length ball outside off. Bit of turn away. Batter tries to swipe across the line but the shot is toe-ended to the off side instead
fullish ball around leg and sliding towards middle. Mistimed cut to short third and they scurry across for a single. Team hundred at the halfway mark
yorker length just outside off. Shikhar comes down and then gets the bat out low too. Just gives direction to the delivery and sends the guide to backward point for four
yorker length, wider outside off. Checks a drive through to Russell at deep extra

lands safe at wide long off after he checks the lofted shot off this overpitched ball. The timing was good but because he didn't have a followthrough, that did not race away for the boundary. Southee with the successful chase

a 30-ball fifty by playing a similar shot. Full ball outside off and he checks the drive to ensure he doesn't over-hit. Just lofts it over cover and calls for two with the infielder chasing. The red-coloured PBKS flags are out and fluttering all over
full ball outside off stump. Angling across with the batter attempting the drive. Misses

wkt_text: PBB Rajapaksa c Singh b Yadav 50 (47m 32b 5x4 2x6) SR: 156.25
text: going, going, not gone! Rajapaksa fifty and out. Fullish ball ball around leg and Rajapaksa took one step down the track before trying to tonk it over long on. The connection is decent but not good enough to clear long on. Rinku gets under it and takes a regulation catch a few metres inside the crease. But he's done his job
full ball from around the stumps. On off. Guided to the leg side for a single
preText: Jitesh Sharma at the crease. Has the third highest T20 strike-rate among Indians, behind only Shaw and Suryakumar. Spoke to him last season, where he said 'The responsibility of finishing is huge and not everyone has the capability'. Today he has a golden opportunity to show just that

text: full ball outside off. Drives with all the force he has but manages to find deep cover on the off side
preText: slip and short cover for Jitesh.

text: good length ball on his pads, and clipped to the leg side for a single
good length ball on middle and sliding down the leg side
full ball outside off, from over the stumps. Drives gently down to long off for a walking single. Scratch that - two.
full ball just outside off. He presses forward and fends with soft hands

glorious hit And the bhangra is out in the stands. Tosses it up, just outside off. Jitesh dances down, meets it beautifully, and offers the full flourish after connecting with the shot. Long on a mere spectator. 97m six
full ball on middle, and clipped to midwicket for a quick single
slower ball. Good length outside off. Muscled to cover but he parries it towards Umesh successfully. Saves a single
full ball outside off. Jitesh moves to the off side and then thumps a grounded shot to long off
short ball getting big on Dhawan with the ball aimed towards his helmet. Checks a pull, and manages to play it in front of square
preText: long on and deep midwicket in place. Fine leg is on the boundary line too.

text: Vidarbha batter smacks Vidarbha bowler with Jitesh beautifully picking up the slower ball. Umesh went short around off and Jitesh moved to the off side, adjusted after spotting the lack of pace, and sent a pull towards backward square leg. Played the shot with a low to high direction, helping him get the direction
back of a length outside off stump. Punched awkwardly, sending the ball to deep point
play and miss. Southee starts off with a slower ball. Rolls his fingers over it. Jitesh with a wild attempt over cover. Misses.
hashtag thumped. Good length ball outside off. Jitesh stands tall and confidently muscles a shot over long off. Swings through the line and that's all Jitesh had to do.

wkt_text: JM Sharma c Yadav b Southee 21 (13m 11b 1x4 2x6) SR: 190.90
text: too much experience in Southee and he produces another good ball after being hit for a six. Slower ball just outside off stump. Jitesh loses his shape while trying to slog it over the leg side, but this sliced shot produces a simple catch for Umesh at short third
picks off from where he left off in international cricket! Length ball angling into his body. Raza keeps a steady head and lets his hands do the rest. Flicks it off his waist and gets it to fine leg
good length ball on off. Pulled to deep square leg for a single
around the stumps. Full outside off stump. Cut to deep point, where Shardul runs around to intercept

shortText: Varun to Sikandar Raza, no run
text: good length ball outside off. Slaps a cut to point. Can't get a single
fullish ball outside off. Turning in more. Cut again, close to his body. To point

wkt_text: S Dhawan  b Varun 40 (75m 29b 6x4 0x6) SR: 137.93
text: through him - and Dhawan's captaincy curse continues where he is yet to get a fifty after being (C).- Good length ball on leg and skidding straight through. Hits Dhawan's pad en route to the stumps. Dhawan goes for 40 with a strike rate of 137
full ball around off stump. And fended gently to the off side
preText: Sam Curran - the most expensive player in IPL history. Back for his OG side, in fact

text: full ball outside off and a bit of turn away. Pushed to the off side. Carefully played with a slip fielder lurking
good length ball on off. Rocks back and punches towards cover point
good length ball just outside off. Nudged to the off side for one but the fielder attempts a direct hit. Misses!
preText: Tom Moody on Sam Curran from our pre-game show. Where he says he brings a different energy to this Punjab side

text: around the stumps. Fullish ball wider outside off stump. Tapped towards cover
good length ball angling into off and he clips it to midwicket for a single only this time

muscled over extra! Sikandar Raza has been in pristine form and he is showing why he became a rare Zimbabwean to get an IPL team this time. Full ball in the slot outside off. Smacked through the off side

shortText: Thakur to Sikandar Raza, no run
text: full and wider outside off stump. Inside the tram-lines though.

shortText: Thakur to Sikandar Raza, no run
text: full ball outside off stump. The attempted drive takes an inside edge and rolls away to the leg side
postText: Afeef: "Sikandar Raza and Rilee Rossouw were the two players I was most looking forward to getting picked in the IPL auction for this season. Good to see Raza getting a game, hope Rossouw also plays later today."

text: good length ball around leg. Turning towards middle. Pulled of the back foot to midwicket
full ball outside leg and sliding down with Curran missing the flick. He falls over so there's a stumping chance, but Gurbaz doesn't collect cleanly
preText: ESPNcricinfo's forecaster says 197 for Punjab. They'd want to definitely breach 200.

text: full ball outside off stump. Sliding into off and swept to deep backward square leg
fullish ball on middle and leg. Punched down to long on
good length ball sliding into middle and leg. Clipped to deep backward square leg
around the stumps. Full ball around leg with Curran backing away. Hits his pad, impact outside leg

release shot successful from Curran. The pressure was building. Full ball wider outside off and Curran smokes it over long on. Still a fairly successful afternoon for Varun. 1-26 in four overs, the last six sending his economy above six
good length ball outside off. Cut to deep point
full ball from around the stumps. Sliding into leg. Clipped to midwicket, acres of space there, allowing them two
full ball around leg and clipped to deep midwicket. Anukul runs in to stop

shortText: Narine to Sikandar Raza, no run
text: full ball outside off. Moves to the off side and attempts the sweep. But the ball slides past his bat to Gurbaz

wkt_text: Sikandar Raza c Rana b Narine 16 (22m 13b 1x4 1x6) SR: 123.07
text: simple for Rana running square from point. Narine with a bit more air on off. Raza backs away and tries to go inside out. Ends up slicing it high for an easy dismissal. KKR quietly pulling things back at the death

shortText: Narine to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full ball on middle. Turning to off. Tapped with hard hands to the off side
preText: Shahrukh Khan walks in. But I spotted Rishi Dhawan putting his pads on too. He may be the Impact Player at the next dismissal.

text: around the stumps. Full ball outside off and Curran smokes a shot over Shardul's head. But long off manages to run around and stop the four
overpitched outside off and he guides a drive to deep point
low full toss on off and drilled to wide long off for a single

shortText: Thakur to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: overpitched ball outside off stump. On the bounce to the keeper with him failing to get bat on ball
like a tracer bullet as Shahrukh smokes a four. In the slot, around the tram-lines, and he hammers a drive rather beautifully
full ball, very wide, beyond the tram-lines. Slices a drive to deep point
postText: Shardul finishes with 0-43.

text: fullish ball outside off. He waits for it an extra second, and then manages to absolutely cream a slap in front of square. Four written all over it after beating cover
preText: Final over. Southee to bowl out.

text: slower ball. Good length delivery and fairly wide. Mistimes a flat-batted shot to long on
muscled, that's all power from Curran. Slot ball around middle and off. Curran clears the front leg and finds the bat's sweet spot while swinging across the line. Over wide long on!
pace off. Good length ball just outside leg. Curran adjusts and tucks it to square leg. Gurbaz gives the ball a chase
full ball on middle and off stump. Swings across the line and hits it to deep midwicket. He calls early for the second and successfully done. Kings touch 190.
ends with a dot. Good length slower ball around leg. Curran misses the swing across the line. To Gurbaz and Kings finish on 191 for 5
postText:
Everybody got some sort of score for the Kings today but they needed one of them to get an 80+ total or thereabouts. That didn't happen. Chandrakant Pandit said they'd be happy chasing 180-200, so is that advantage Knight Riders at the break? ESPNcricinfo's forecaster does not agree, with KKR having under 25% chance of victory. Let's see how it turns out when Himanshu joins you on the other side.

5.12pm So Kings make only 91 in the second half after making 100 in the first. Knight Riders will be mighty pleased to restrict Kings to a sub-200 total. Their bowlers struggled up top - barring Umesh, who was rather economical - but Narine, Varun and the rest slid in a few quiet overs at the slog-end of the innings.

Here's Bhanuka Rajapaksa: "See Harsha I don't think it is a typical Mohali wicket. It had something for spinners and fast bowlers in the back end. (His six off Narine) Instinct took over. Told Shikhar I'd take him on. It worked. (191 score) It is a good total because we were aiming for 180-185. We've found the score. (Second season with PBKS, Bayliss' messaging) So clear. He wants me to bat top of the order and bat with a clear mind."

shortText: Curran to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: floats one quite full, angling it in towards off. Pushed to mid-off
preText:
Curran to Mandeep

5.51pm Okay, it's starting. The PBKS players trickle back out on the field. The lights are all functioning, and it's time for the cricket to take over.

Garv Asnani: "I think they could have played a few overs before going off as it's not too dark yet, but now it's going get much darker as time goes on." --- If only it were gully cricket, then we would be playing even if only a single thread of the ball was visible
