Souriddha: "Delay due to floodlight malfunction - what a shame in an age when teams are severely taxed for slow over rates!!" --- I'm not sure if venues or host associations will be penalised for this failure, but I get your point

5.37pm And, and... they are going off. Floodlight failure stops play. Now, after a few minutes, the floodlights at one end seem to be working, although there is no sign yet of those lighting up at the opposite end.

MikeB: "Might be my failing eyes, but it looks like it's broad daylight?!?" --- None at all. The sun has long bid goodbye, and darkness is nearing by the minute

Nisha Uniyal: "Uncapped Indian players have never received so much attention before the impact player rule"

After waiting for a good five minutes and more, the floodlights still don't seem to be glowing. The umpires have a word, Mandeep does some stretching, and the PBKS players too indulge in a discussion. Some real relaxation there.

Curran has the new ball. Mandeep on strike. A slip in place. Deep square and deep point on the rope. But there is a delay in play since the floodlights are yet to come on. We keep waiting, waiting...

Looks like Rishi Dhawan has been brought on as Impact Player for PBKS. Yup, Rishi Dhawan replaces Rajapaksa. And here come Gurbaz and Mandeep to open the innings for KKR.

5.22pm Evening, everyone. You would wonder if PBKS are 10 or 15 short on a pitch where the ball is coming on nicely, and the bounce is even. I wouldn't think dew would come into effect so early - it's not even dark in Mohali yet - and KKR stand a fair chance of starting the season with a win.

text: full length, and on off after hinting to angle in. Flicked towards midwicket
a bit of mix-up, but they are safe in the end. On a good length on off, and tucked to short third off the outside edge. Gurbaz stood still after starting to run, and they eventually made it back
makes some room and skips out, as this short ball on off is swatted to mid-on's right
launched high and wide over long-on! Gurbaz gets into the action. Charges down at this length delivery on the stumps, and sends that 101 metres into the stands

flicked to deep midwicket! This is a bit fuller, but enough for Gurbaz to slam that away off his pads, as there is no movement off the pitch or from it either. Square leg was placed closer in, and that was hit well

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Mandeep Singh, OUT
wkt_text: Mandeep Singh c Curran b Arshdeep Singh 2 (7m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: Arshdeep strikes first ball! He is celebrating with his arms wide, and with half a sprint down long leg. Good pace and bounce from him though. H pitched it about middle and off, as the ball angled across, and rose rather sharply on off stump. Mandeep pulled, but the extra bounce got him. Straight into deep square leg's hands
preText: Arsh from the other end

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Roy, no run
text: good length on fifth stump, and clipped to midwicket. Gurbaz is sent back by Anukul
preText: Anukul at No. 3

text: lofted over mid-on! That bounced just before hitting the rope. Yup, it's a four. He is standing deep in his crease, and ready to launch this length ball angling into him towards middle stump
preText: Jayant Isswani: "We might get at a situation today where both matches are going on simultaneously!"

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Roy, no run
text: quite full and wide of off, and he drills that but straight to the extra-cover fielder

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Roy, no run
text: good bouncer. Pitches it short on middle, as Anukul first shapes to swing it away, but then ducks last moment, since the line seemed to be almost cramping him

wkt_text: AS Roy c Sikandar Raza b Arshdeep Singh 4 (5m 5b 1x4 0x6) SR: 80.00
text: spooned to midwicket! Arsh gets two in this over. I think the extra bounce came into play again, and so did his pace. Another short delivery from Arsh, and this one's line was a bit wide of off, much further away from the middle-stump line he cramped Anukul with previous ball. Anukul pulled, but found the fielder, who didn't have to move at all
woah, that looked to effortless! Just high elbows, and the full face of the bat, as it was a length ball in the slot on off. Four over mid-off
preText: Venky Iyer is the Impact Player for KKR, as he comes out at No. 4. Iyer replaces Varun Chakravarthy.

shortText: Curran to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: opens the bat face to dab this good length ball angling across towards off to point
short in length on middle, and pulled to fine leg
fullish ball on middle and off. Flicked to deep square elg
preText: Iyer on strike. A wide slip waiting

shortText: Curran to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: charges down the track, but Curran bowls short and beats Gurbaz completely. Perhaps Gurbaz skipped out too early after making room, and Curran bowled short on leg. Gurbaz pulled and missed
quite full this time on off, and dragged to mid-on's right. Rishi Dhawan there fumbles, as it could have been tight

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: shorter side of a length on off, and dabbed to short third. Gurbaz wanted a single, but was sent back

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: good ball. Sees the batter make room, and fires a yorker on fifth stump, which Gurbaz slashes at but misses
postText: Ahsan Bhutta: "The curse of the highest price tag continues" --- Might be too early...

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: fuller side of a length on leg, and takes his pad as he tries to flick. Again he tries for a single, before going back

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: four dots in a row. This is called first bouncer, as Arsh bangs it in short on middle and leg. Gurbaz ducks, as the good bounce takes it high above him

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, FOUR
text: flashed just wide of short third! Gurbaz runs out of patience, and jumps out of his crease. The ball ended up being a low, dipping full toss outside off, and the ball takes his outside edge with Gurbaz trying to heave

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, 1 run
text: good length ball angling into off. Punched to cover-point
preText: Around the wicket

shortText: Ellis to Rahmanullah Gurbaz, no run
text: starts with a slower ball. Full length on off, and he loses his bottom hand while trying to hoick. The ball ends up at cover off his outside edge, and Iyer is just back with the throw arriving there
preText: Ellis into the attack

wkt_text: Rahmanullah Gurbaz  b Ellis 22 (26m 16b 3x4 1x6) SR: 137.50
text: Ellis pings off stump! This time Ellis had good pace on ball, changing up after that slower delivery last ball. Gurbaz, again trying to be adventurous, makes some room, and also skips out of the crease. He hacks at this good length ball on off - rather it was on the shorter side of a length - and missed, as the stumps lit up
full delivery on off, and defended back
preText: Rana in

text: swiped to long leg! Harpreet from deep square leg runs and dives to his left, but in vain. Good length ball on his legs, and pulled away by Rana
a touch fuller than the last ball, and on a good length again on middle and leg. Clipped towards deep midwicket
now much fuller on off, and pushed back

shortText: Sikandar Raza to Iyer, no run
text: good length darted into middle, and angled in. Iyer misses his pull, and is hit on his pad
preText: Raza now has the ball. Around the wicket.

text: shortish just outside off, and pushed to long-on
very full on off, and flicked to midwicket
preText: Rajat Maheshwari: "Loving the Impact Sub. Finally something that is of relevance and akin to football. Could be a total game-changer in cricket"

shortText: Sikandar Raza to Iyer, no run
text: short outside off, and swatted to mid-off
goes wide of the crease, and bowls roundarm. Ends up bowling on a length, as it slides down leg. Wide called
flicked for four between short fine and square leg! Too quick, and too full, angling into his pads, as Iyer just clipped it using the pace

punched between cover-point and extra cover! The last two balls ruin Raza's over. This was short just outside off, as Iyer pushed late it, with the cover-point fielder diving to his right and missing the ball
good length ball on leg, taking his pads towards fine leg as he looked to clip
preText: Another delay: Iyer needs some help from the physio. But we start again rather quickly.

text: good length on middle and leg. Clipped to deep backward square
slower ball on a good length on off. Pushed to extra cover
goes driving, but is beaten! Length delivery angling across, and finishing on sixth stump, as the ball passes his outside edge
preText: Ajay Dhanak: "Impact player could save ODIs too. It could rekindle interest of more people, especially in the middle overs." --- Yup, possible. But what I miss most from ODIs is the rule of the batting powerplay, which was to be taken within the 40th over

text: makes room, and skips down. Ellis spots that, and bowls on a good length outside leg. Swiped to fine leg
short delivery on middle and off, and pulled to deep backward square
chips this full and flat ball on the stumps just wide of long-on, and they pinch two. Good running
good length, angling into leg. Whipped off his pads to fine leg
short and wide-ish of off. Slashed to deep point
preText: Tom: "The only thing ODIs need saving from is yet another T20 league and the ICC scheduling team. Not an impact sub" --- And the return of the Super League after the 2023 World Cup

text: goes low, roundarm, and wide of the crease. Shortish on off, and punched to long-on
switch hit lofted over short third! The fielder ran back all the way, but in vain. Good length on off, and swung away
fullish length angling down leg, as he tried to sweep but missed. They sneak a bye, as the ball went past the keeper too
flung away to deep third! Off the top edge, but that will do. Charges down after making room, as Dhawan bowls on a good length outside off. Rana swung, band eventually got four
preText: Impact Player Rishi Dhawan has the ball

text: a commanding pull! That travelled very quickly over deep midwicket. On the shorter side of a length around middle, and Dhawan's pace isn't that troubling. Rana swung for six
slower ball. Good length, and angling away to end wide of off. Slashed to point

shortText: R Dhawan to Iyer, no run
text: a tennis-batted hack to point, as this ball is a slower ball again, and is short on off. Played that very late there
pulled wide of long-on! Change of pace again from Dhawan, and in vain. He pitched it on the shorter side, angling it across as it ended outside off. Iyer fetched that from there, and crashed that

shortText: R Dhawan to Iyer, no run
text: short of a length on middle and off, and punched to point
postText:
MartinMJ: "Rishi Dhawan's over was actually a good "Impact" for KKR"

And here comes the time-out

shortText: Sikandar Raza to Rana, no run
text: stops in his action last moment, and bowls on a length while angling into leg. Swept to short fine
preText: Another 117 required from 66 balls. Raza will continue.

wkt_text: N Rana c Chahar b Sikandar Raza 24 (23m 17b 3x4 1x6) SR: 141.17
text: slashed straight to point! Raza is relieved after going for some runs in his first two overs. That was there to be hit, but Rana ended up gifting the fielder an easy catch. Short and slightly wide of off, as Rana went hard at that only to end up walking back. So the time-out breaks his momentum
length ball outside off, hinting to turn away. Pushed to deep point
preText: Rinku at No. 6

text: very full on middle, and whipped to deep midwicket
shortish on off, and clipped to deep backward square. Misfield by Arsh allows a second
good length wide-ish of off, and pushed to deep point

wkt_text: RK Singh c Sikandar Raza b Chahar 4 (5m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: strikes first ball, just like Arshdeep! Rinku goes after the legspinner right away, but finds deep midwicket. Chahar bowls on a length on off, but it is the wrong 'un. It turns away from Rinku's arc, as he looks to slog sweep. Instead, the ball ends up landing right into the fielder's lap
preText: Chahar into the attack

text: dabs this short ball straightening just outside off, and the ball goes past slip
preText: Russell in. Slip in place.

text: full and flatter on off. Flay-batted to cover
turns away off a short length, and ends wide-ish of off. Hacked to deep point
the googly ends up on leg, after being pitched short on middle and off. Pulled to fine leg
slashes and misses. Short ball, turning away - as it was the wrong 'un again - and ending outside off. Half an appeal for caught behind
full ball on his pads, and flicked to long leg
preText: Brar into the attack. Around the wicket.

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Russell, no run
text: short, and angling into the stumps. Punched back
preText: RCBfan: "This is one of the weakest top six I've seen for not just KKR but any IPL team. Narine should open if they don't have better options."

text: hammered just over the bowler's raised hands! That was bashed back dangerously. Shortish ball around off, and swatted back
on the bounce to deep midwicket. Short ball angling into leg, and pulled away again

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Iyer, no run
text: now Iyer drills on the bounce to extra cover. Full and wide of off, and he attacks at it
preText: Stays around to Iyer

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Iyer, 1 leg bye
text: goes for the switch hit, but misses the full ball on leg as they pinch a bye off the keeper's pad
misfield by point, as Iyer reverse sweeps this good length ball on off. Shahrukh the fielder there
preText: Vignesh R: "Only a Russell madness can change the match result now"

text: fired wayyyy over long-off! Gets his front leg out of the way, and launches this length ball on off to get six
short on middle and leg, and quicker with good bounce. Poked to short third, as Iyer is sent back
good length on the stumps, and tapped to point for a hurried run
full delivery on middle, and swept to deep square
full and wide of off, and turning away while bouncing nicely. Russell misses his attempted cut
good length ball, angling in late into middle and off after pitching on off. Stabbed to point
preText: Ellis back. KKR need 92 from 42.

text: clubbed over mid-off! Stands deep in the crease at this length delivery, which is ending outside off. Russell opened the bat face, and sliced that back forcefully
dropped by short fine running back! Prabhsimran the fielder. Ellis isn't happy, but it didn't look very easy too. It was a slower ball and short on off, and Russell pulled and got a top edge
now bowls a good yorker just outside off. Jammed down to long-off
preText: Another free hit

text: drilled over the bowler's head! Why bowl that full, close-to-the-arc length at this stage, and if it's a free hit? That was full and on the stumps, and Iyer rammed that back with the full face of the bat. This is a no-ball too, and it's a late call
preText: Free hit

text: good length ball outside off, and hacked to deep point. Russell slips after completing the single. And it is a no-ball
another yorker, and bowled on fifth stump. Russell slashes and misses
preText: Shreyam Dhakal: "This is turning out to be a close game" --- Two no-balls turning it around...

text: slower ball, and a full length on fifth stump. Swatted without timing to long-on
preText: Droplets of rain visible
postText:
The ground staff are all set with the covers outside the boundary. KKR are 10 runs behind on DLS par

Time-out

text: swats this short and wide ball outside off to deep point
preText:
Curran replaces Chahar

Rain falling. KKR behind on DLS. Time-out. Where will the momentum swing? KKR need 74 from 36.

text: full ball on off, and flicked to deep midwicket
preText: Rain remains steady in Mohali. And Curran will reload after not bowling this one despite running in.

text: low full toss, and heaved away over wide long-on! Perhaps Curran tried the yorker; anyway, it didn't work. Russell got his front leg out of the way while standing deep in the crease, and flung at that
preText: Just two off the first two balls

text: ramps between point and short third! Not very Russell-like, though. Short delivery, almost cramping him for room while rising on middle. He sways away a bit, and lofts it late

wkt_text: AD Russell c Sikandar Raza b Curran 35 (24m 19b 3x4 2x6) SR: 184.21
text: finds deep midwicket! Could be exactly the wrong time for KKR, given there is rain around. Curran went short again, except that this one was an offcutter, which rose sharply after pitching middle and leg, while also angling across. Russell swat-pulled but only off the higher side of the bat

ridiculous! Effortless. Too good. Looked like he never really wanted to hit it that far, yet that shortish ball angling away towards off travelled over deep square leg as Thakur pulled almost with disdain
preText: Thakur in

text: sliced on the bounce to deep point. Full and wide-ish of off, as Iyer opens the bat face to loft
preText: 56 off 30. Arsh back.

text: full ball angling into middle. Whipped to deep backward square
preText: Around the wicket to Thakur

wkt_text: VR Iyer c Chahar b Arshdeep Singh 34 (66m 28b 3x4 1x6) SR: 121.42
text: ramped to point! Another bouncer from Arsh earns him a wicket. The bounce was a bit too much for Iyer to handle. Arsh banged it in short around off, with Iyer almost leaping a little to get on top of it. But he ended up half-ramping it - and without any control - to point
preText: Divyank Singh: "Perfect time for Southee cameo"

text: full ball on off, and driven to extra cover's right
preText: Narine

text: fires a yorker length ball on off, which is driven to long-on
preText: Lokesh Kumar: "Lord is here"

text: just over long-on! This game is not over yet. Narine showing what he has got. On a good length on the stumps, and just lofted with the least of efforts
postText:
That's it from us from the first of the two matches today. There was considerable time lost due to a floodlight failure at the start of KKR's innings, but I'm not sure if all four remaining overs would have been possible before rain interrupted play. Meanwhile, LSG, against DC, are off to a stable start in Lucknow as the action continues this evening. But for here, it's goodnight and goodbye from Raghav, Thilak, Sreshth and me, Himanshu!

Arshdeep Singh is the Player of the Match

7.51pm Okay, we are done: PBKS beat KKR by seven runs on DLS method. The rain is yet to stop after that interruption, and the umpires decided that was it. KKR fall short despite some late blows by Russell; and they will ruin those two wickets they lost in the last two overs. It was always going to be difficult once they were 29 for 3 in the fifth over, and KKR will want to relook at their top six in the absence of Shreyas Iyer and Shakib Al Hasan. On the contrary, PBKS' win was set up by contributions from their entire top seven. Hang around for the presentations.

Vikram: "I am 20 kms away from stadium. Its raining heavily. Chances of play resuming are very bleak." --- Exactly the post we were missing all this while

7.45pm The umpires are walking on the boundary rope, with umbrellas firmly placed overhead. They enter the KKR dressing room, and have a chat with their captain Rana. They even shook hands with one of the KKR staff members. Is that sign that we are done?

So what if rain has stopped the action here? You can always hop over from Mohali to Lucknow - don't ask me in how much time - as LSG host DC in both teams' season opener. DC have chosen to field after winning the toss.

7.40pm It is still raining steadily in Mohali, with covers in place pretty much all around. The ground looks entirely empty - there is not a soul there - with resumption getting further delayed.

Aditya: "Absolute chaos, this is what I've missed for the past couple of months!" --- And I'm sure this season hasn't disappointed you in just two days of action

TSB: "What blasphemy is this?! Shardul Thakur averages 10 with the bat after 140 T20 games?" --- To be honest, I had never realised this until now. Pretty shocking, yeah

7.18pm It has got much heavier, and rain stops play. As per DLS, KKR are seven runs behind. Two wickets in the last two overs for PBKS, and that must have made all the difference. The pitch and the outfield are quickly covered at the ground. The rain is hammering down, and I don't expect play to resume very soon.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Conway, no run
text: nice and full, angling and perhaps swinging in at a bit at middle, quietly knocked to square leg from the crease
preText:
7.30pm Gaikwad and Conway will open the batting for CSK. Conway has been released by NZC for the entire IPL season. Shami has the new ball for GT. He will operate from round the wicket. Let's go

7.28pm Josh Little is the first Ireland player to feature in the IPL. He was a net bowler for CSK during their prep camp in Surat in IPL 2022.

7.10pm GT win the toss and opt to bowl first. Maharashtra seam-bowling allrounder Hangargekar starts for CSK and makes his IPL debut.

CSK XI: 1 Devon Conway, 2 Ruturaj Gaikwad, 3 Moeen Ali, 4 Ben Stokes, 5 Ravindra Jadeja, 6 Shivam Dube, 7 Ambati Rayudu, 8 MS Dhoni (capt&wk), 9 Mitch Santner, 10 Deepak Chahar, 11 Rajvardhan Hangargekar

Subs: Tushar Deshpande, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Ajinkya Rahane, Nishant Sindhu

Titans XI: 1 Shubhman Gill, 2 Wriddhiman Saha (wk), 3 Kane Williamson, 4 Vijay Shankar, 5 Hardik Pandya (capt), 6 Rahul Tewatia, 7 Rashid Khan, 8 Mohammed Shami, 9 Josh Little, 10 Alzarri Joseph, 11 Yash Dayal

Subs: B Sai Sudharsan, Jayant Yadav, Mohit Sharma, Abhinav Manohar, KS Bharat

In this XI, CSK have batting all the way down to No.11. They could potentially bring in Simarjeet Singh or Tushar Deshpande, for instance, in place of a batter during their defence later in the evening.

Hardik: Absolutely! Good to play here and the kind of crowd we get here is exciting. I think almost everyone from the country has got motivation from him and nothing better than starting the season with Dhoni. Impact Player is different, so I've left it to him. Ashu pa was up all night. I don't know and I've passed on the team.

Dhoni: We were also looking to bowl first and I don't think it [the pitch] will change. Last night it rained and I don't know if there will be dew. The preparation has been good and we assembled early [in Chennai]. Overall, it seems as if we've done okay. It [Impact Player rule] is a luxury to have and it becomes slightly easy to use here because in domestic it was at the 14th over. Four foreigners - Moeen, Stokes, Santner and Conway - and the others will fight for that one spot.

7pm There's some grass covering on the pitch and could offer some good bounce, reckons Simon Doull. There were reports on Thursday that Dhoni could miss the IPL opener with an injury, but he is now out for the toss, which has been delayed.

Deepak Samson : "The stadium in a sea of yellow!! Guess everyone realises that there might only be very few more chances to watch MSD on cricket field. Some things transcend team loyalties..."

6.57pm Toss coming up under fire-work filled skies. Do stay tuned. Dhoni embraces Hardik and then shakes hands with former Super King R Sai Kishore near the edge of the boundary. "Dhoni is warming up now," says Shashank. "He's feeling his knee every now and then". He was wearing a kneecap when he was batting at the Chepauk nets earlier this week.

Deepak Samson : "Calendar cleared. CSK Jersey on. Cannot wait."

If you are seeing this on mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

6.45pm Who are you supporting in today's match? Have your say in our Live report

6.33pm Shashank from Ahmedabad: "Thala sitting all by himself in the CSK dugout, right at the centre, listening to Arjit Singh. The moment he's shown on the big screen the fans erupt in joy."

Sanket: "This impact rule will be headache for the fantasy player like me"

Siva: "Remember a game against Australia where India used Jadeja for batting and Chahal for bowling due to Jadeja getting concussed.. that is the kind of situation you want Impact player for. CSK can use Dube for batting and Simarjeet/Deshpande/Hangargekar instead for bowling"

Afeef: "@sanket I hope Williamson's presence will allow Hardik to bat more freely and revert to his old finisher role from his days at Mumbai Indians "

Ravi: "To be honest, I don't like this impact player rule, perhaps its to early to decide. I would like to see a 11 vs 11 game with allrounders contributing. From CSK's point of view, they have a good playing 11. The bench is not so good and will struggle find an impact player until the remaining overseas players are back. Also they will play 4 overseas players in their first 11, so don't know how MSD will use impact players."

sanket patil: "Kane Williamson could be really good signing for GT. With Gill,Hardik, Miller, Tewatia batting around Kane gives that freedom for him to take his time and pace an innings. And this is big ground where he can easily gets ones , twos and keep the scoreboard ticking."

6.30pm Where should Stokes bat for CSK? Go and vote here

ICYMI: CSK's left-arm seamer Mukesh Choudhary has been sidelined from the entire season with a stress fracture of the back, joining Kyle Jamieson on the sidelines. Former Rajasthan Royal Akash Singh has been roped in as a like-for-like replacement

6.20pm Time for some song and dance at the Motera. The opening ceremony has got underway in Ahmedabad. Shashank sets up the scene from the venue: "It's 80% full already. More CSK supporters than Titans' blue, and they're all wearing Dhoni's No.7 jersey."

Try out ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

Laurie: "This new impact player rule will further test the depth of each team's squad as a player for each game situation will be vital."

Navin: "Hello IPL!!! It is with same excitement with what I was whistling for CSK back in my college days, will be whistling again with my sons today!! Juust for THALA."

6.15pm Over the years, Dhoni has passed on his wisdom to Hardik. Can he use the same to trump the old master in the IPL opener, wonders Shashank Kishore.

Hefaz: "Hello IPL!I was waiting the whole year to see back the blue men once again in action! Rashid Khan will rock this season once again!"

Afeef: "Can't forget the GT vs CSK clash from last season where Miller smacked 94* to seal a tight chase. That became an instant classic. Would be amazing if this season starts off with a similar match."

6.05pm Thanks Monga. Hello, everyone. Are You Ready?

Girish: "Question to Muthu: How was the trip to the other planet?" --- I didn't take that trip. It was my big brother Al Muthu who travelled 3.147 billion lightyears away from earth for a bit of peace and quiet.

Afeef: "I'm wondering where will Stokes and Moeen bat? In my opinion, Moeen should bat at 3 and Stokes at 5, Rayudu slotting in between them." --- Rayudu will be key for CSK against Rashid. has had the wood over Rashid, scoring 79 runs off 65 balls off him without being dismissed in the IPL.

You can also follow live commentary of this match in Hindi here

Shameer: "For MSD, that 12th magic person is Chepauk pitch, where he stands right at the center, and marshaling the troops."

Virpalsinh : "MS will not use Impact Player and will win. At this point no one is expert in this impact player things. With out much data and under intense match-situation this thing for first few matches or season will bring more chaos"

6pm "Am excited to see how each team responds to the new innovations. I can see someone like Ashwin trying to take full advantage of this new strategic opportunity, whilst other players will concentrate on the basics, ignoring the new distractions. We'll see soon!"

Daryll, I am sure there are lots of ins and outs to these, which Deivarayan Muthu will tell you more about while I get myself a cuppa.

5.45pm Are we entering a 12-vs-12 era in T20 cricket through the Impact Player? Nagraj Gollapudi spoke to people who matter, and has this feature for you. This substitution is something every one is looking at this year. My prediction: don't be surprised if MS Dhoni keeps things simple, uses no Impact Player, and still manages to win.

Sign up for ESPNcricinfo's first AR-based game - just aim and hit the stumps.

5.30pm The crowds are back, the home-and-away system is back, it is almost like old times. And yet it is new times with a host of innovations: teams can be changed based on the result of the toss, there is an impact player, no-balls and wide balls can be challenged through DRS. The 16th edition of the IPL proves to be an exciting blend of the old and the new. We are in nice and early to bring it in with the first match, between the defending champions Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings in Ahmedabad.

If you are seeing this on mobile device and didn't know it already, ESPNcricinfo is better experienced on our apps. And we have recently rolled out an update for Android, which you can download or update here.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Conway, 1 leg bye
text: Conway shuffles across off, and shimmies out at Shami, who strikes him on the pad. The ball dribbles past leg stump. Conway and Gaikwad cross over for a leg bye

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Gaikwad, no run
text: good length, angling in at off and then straightening as Gaikwad sits back and pushes it to mid-off
shorter and slanting into middle and leg, Gaikwad whisks it to the left of mid-on and gets off the mark
preText: Rummy: "Fast bowling options for CSK definitely looks bleak. I hope they score more than 200 for their bowlers to defend. "

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Conway, no run
text: Shami hits a heavy length and brings this back into the top of off with the angle. Fended back to him on the back foot
preText: LG: "Watching out for Hangargekar. He was impressive all rounder in U19 world cup. "

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Conway, no run
text: on a good length, threatens to angle in, so Conway plays for the inward angle but it veers away late past the outside edge. Fine start from Shami
back of a length and angling into middle, Gaikwad stands up tall and punches it away between midwicket and mid-on with the wrists for four
preText:
Pandya takes the new ball. Over the wicket. He usually bowls with the new ball for India too in T20Is

Abinash Das: " Excited to see the team's tactical thinking being put to the test and possibly out of their comfort zone with the Impact player rule."
postText: Ankush: "I think Tushar Deshpande will be impact sub in second innings for CSK to increase fast bowling option and KS bharat for GT"

text: on a good length and sliding in at off stump, played back to the bowler
jabbing punch in the gap at covers. Terrific stroke from Gaikwad. Back of a length and outside off, he opens the face to pick the gap
preText: Rajkumar Lingav: "India have been searching for a replacement for Hardik Pandya. If Hangargekar has a good season, he should be a straight swap for Pandya. Hope he clicks!"

text: good length and angling into a front-foot push to mid-on. Gaikwad races across to the other end
chopped on the bounce to slips. 142ks, fuller and skidding through outside off, Conway opens his account
on the fuller side of a good length and largely holds its line outside off. Gaikwad stabs at it and ekes out an inside edge into the leg side
carved away to deep third. One a length and outside off, Gaikwad throws his bat at ball and slices it away past slip
preText: Mohit: "@Ankush, for GT Abhinav Manohar is better suited as sub than the Bharat. They've Shankar, KW and Gill hence another accumulator is not required."
postText: Deepak: "It's clear that CSK sub-in Tushar Deshpande, who do they sub out? Stokes, given he is not bowling and can perhaps use some rest? Everyone else gives them bowling options or is a good fielder/wk."

wkt_text: DP Conway  b Mohammed Shami 1 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 16.66
text: Shami breaches the defences of Conway. That's his 100th IPL wicket. Nice and full, angling in from round the stumps, seaming in at Conway who aims for a booming drive and misses. Bowled through the gate. The ball clatters into middle stump
postText: Sumeet: "Ambati Rayudu would be subbed out. Slow fielder "

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Ali, no run
text: shorter and skidding into the top of off stump, blocked into the leg side
preText: Moeen at No.3, ahead of Stokes

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Ali, no run
text: back of a length and Shami gets it to hold its line outside off, as opposed to slanting in, Moeen swishes and misses in the channel

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Ali, no run
text: on a good length and angling into middle, 141.3ks, defensively jabbed to cover by Moeen

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Ali, no run
text: short and into the pitch, the line is just outside off, as Shami cramps Moeen. Chopped past the stumps via an inside edge
chest-high short ball on leg stump, Gaikwad sits back, sizes it up and launches him over short fine leg for six. Helped away over the boundary
preText: The Goan: "Josh Little is a very exciting talent. Can't wait for him to perform well this IPL and represent the smaller nations at the IPL!" --- And here he is. Left-arm over

text: pitched-up delivery, too full and wide of off. Gaikwad latches onto the width and slaps it away square through point. Raced away to the fence
on a length and just a shade outside off, crunnnnnnched to mid-off, where Pandya fumbles, allowing a single
postText: Vaibhav: "Ohh dear Devon. Bit too early for that shot in the tournament."

text: 140.4ks back-of-a-length delivery outside off, Moeen fends it back to Little
preText: Afeef: "Little's first ball in IPL travelling for a six reminded me of SKY hitting his first ball in international cricket for a six at the same ground. Both sixes went in the same area."
postText: Phani: "First impression, CSK will struggle outside of Chennai with their lean pace resources.Their batting is not top notch as such with no run away batters.CSK being CSK can hit naysayers back though, let's see."

text: on a length and outside off, Moeen now latches onto the width on offer and slashes it in the air but between point and cover. Rashid chases hard but can't cut it off
just short of a good length and outside off, 142ks, Moeen opens the bat-face and glides it to point

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Gaikwad, no run
text: on a length and holds its line outside off, punchily played into the covers
preText: Shami to bowl his third over in the powerplay
postText: Great Boo : "I've had a long hot tiring day, but now I have a whole roast chicken, a bottle of wine and the IPL. Marvelous."

text: shorter and slanting into the top of off, Gaikwad uses the inward angle and secures a quick single to the left of mid-on
pumped away to the right of mid-off. Stokes surely enjoyed that. He's up on his feet clapping. On a length and outside off, Moeen belts it away between extra-cover and mid-off
preText: Karthik: "Josh Little from Dublin( pop 544000) in front of the Ahmedabad crowd( pop 100000). Welcome to India and the IPL. "

text: just short of a yorker length on off stump, Moeen gets underneath the length and somehow slices it over the long-off boundary for a flat six

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Ali, 1 no ball
text: The pressure gets to Shami. Beamer from Shami, Moeen evades it and gets a free-hit
hip-high short delivery outside off, Moeen is on the back foot, waiting for this length. Pulled away through midwicket for four more
Moeen backs away even before Shami delivers. The bowler chases him and keeps him to a single to deep square leg

shortText: Rashid Khan to Ali, no run
text: draws an lbw appeal first ball with a fizzing legbreak. Did it start outside leg? Replays indicate that Moeen had gloved it
preText: Pandya turns to Rashid
postText: Vaibhav: "Moeen Ali has to be one of the most deceiving hitters of the cricket ball. Looks so neat and gentle while he does it. "

shortText: Rashid Khan to Ali, no run
text: Moeen backs away once again and drills this legbreak to Little at mid-off

shortText: Rashid Khan to Ali, no run
text: another lbw appeal from Rashid, this time umpire Khalid's finger goes up. Moeen chats with Gaikwad and challenges the on-field out decision. Another quick legbreak from Rashid, but does not turn much, beats the sweep, and thumps the front pad below the knee-roll. But this could be pitching outside leg. Yes, indeed
Say hello to CSK's spin-basher. Moeen ventures out of the crease, gets close to the pitch of this, does not allow it to turn and lofts it over Rashid's head

wkt_text: MM Ali c †Saha b Rashid Khan 23 (17b 4x4 1x6) SR: 135.29
text: Rashid strikes back, Moeen has nicked off. Easier decision for umpire Khalid. Rashid takes this wrong'un away from the left-handed Moeen who throws his bat at ball once again. He edges it behind to Saha who clings onto the catch
postText: "Rashid's first powerplay wicket in IPL since 2021," notes Matt Roller. "Bowled six wicketless overs in the PP last season"

text: driven away straight of mid-off as Stokes gets off the mark
preText: Stokes replaces Moeen
postText: Aj : "GT shouldn't typecast Joseph as an enforcer, he's very good with the new ball too. "

text: fullish and on middle and leg, clipped away more or less straight to midwicket
preText:
Pandya is back after the powerplay. Right-arm over

Stokes vs Rashid Khan in all T20s before tonight: 21 balls, 15 runs, 3 dismissals

text: back of a length and ducks back in at middle to cramp Stokes for room. Chopped square on the off side for a single
preText: Sanjana: "Saha is such a gem behind the stumps"

text: 141ks pitched-up delivery outside off, with mid-off in the circle. Gaikwad extends his hands and launches it over the infield for a flat six. Terrific timing from Gaikwad once again - he has taken his game against pace to a whole new level
postText: They're now checking if that stroke from Gaikwad hit the spidercam cable. It will become a dead-ball if it had touched the spidercam cable. And it will be a six

text: mid-off is still in, and Gaikwad goes over him once again. Pandya changes his length. He drags his length back and the line is slightly wider, but Gaikwad plants his front leg and launches a bigger six
good length and skidding into off stump, pushed to mid-off on the front foot

Gill misses a run-out opportunity. He can't throw the stumps down. Saha isn't close enough to the stumps either. Gill has his hands on his head. Gaikwad tips it to cover and takes off. Gill swoops down on the ball. Gaikwad has to undo his steps. Gaikwad would've been out had Gill nailed a direct hit
on a length and breaks back in at off at quick pace, punched down to long-on
preText: Sowmya : "Ruturaj looks like a right handed version of Saeed Anwar. So strong outside off, classy, amazing off the pads, silently dangerous!!! "

text: quickish wrong'un from Rashid, Gaikwad stays in the crease and forces a single down to long-on
preText: Prasanth: "CSK will want to make the most of this start and their long batting lineup"
postText: Ashish: "Gill could have done a Jonty there. But wait, there's only one Jonty

text: a bit too full and outside off. Though the line is wider of off, Stokes reaches out for the ball and drills it straight of mid-off

wkt_text: BA Stokes c †Saha b Rashid Khan 7 (6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 116.66
text: Rashid takes out both Moeen and Stokes. Pushed through flatter and quicker, skids away outside off from over the stumps. Stokes chops at it and edges it behind to Saha who makes this low catch look ridiculously easy
postText: Here is Rayudu who has a particularly strong head-to-head record against Rashid

text: Rayudu goes back and across to tap a single through mid-on
another wrong'un from Rashid. Gaikwad picks it and bunts it away to wide long-on
loose ball. Full on the pads and there's just one result possible: Gaikwad picks it up and whips it over square leg for six
preText:
Here is Joseph. He played in the yellow for JSK not too long ago. He's playing against the yellow team tonight

Arun Prakash: "Saha - Such an underrated Keeper! Unpopular opinion - He's best behind the stumps than Dhoni."
postText: Neel: "Don't hit Rashid for 4, its a bait."

text: short and outside off, 145.1ks, Gaikwad uses the pace but dabs it only as far as point
Joseph cranks it up to 147ks, short and into the body, no room at all. Fended back to the bowler
preText: AJey: "Another person terribly underrated - Gaikwad. No idea why he does not get a look in for India. "

text: Gaikwad has rattled up a 23-ball half-century, with another six. Welcome back. Joseph strays on the pads or rather hips once again. Gaikwad picks it up and pumps it over square leg
Gaikwad rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and dinks it away to the right of short third
Gaikwad clears the midwicket boundary. Dug in short and at the body, Joseph can rush most batters but Gaikwad seems to have that extra second to size it up and pull it over the leg side for six more

shortText: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
text: on a length and zips back in, Rayudu hangs back and punches this googly to the left of short midwicket
quicker legbreak outside off, the length is shorter, allowing Rayudu to chop it away off the back foot to the left of sweeper cover
Gaikwad makes room, Rashid follows him with a turning legbreak, tapped only as far as point
Rashid hikes his pace up to 100.2ks, rushes Gaikwad into his stroke and draws a leading edge to the left of him

shortText: Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run
text: down the track, it's not easy to step out to Rashid, but Gaikwad is in the mood. Jabbed into the covers

shortText: Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run
text: good length and breaks back in at quick pace, cramps Gaikwad who can only push this wrong'un to cover
postText: Vijay: "Gaikwad's batswing and effortless pulls remind me of Rohit's..."

text: on a fuller length and angling across off at 141ks, knocked into the covers
preText: Little has been brought back. He went for 15 runs in his first over. Left-arm over

text: Little extracts some extra bounce from a length outside off. Rayudu wafts and misses. He isn't quite comfortable against high pace and bounce
138ks banged in short at leg stump, Rayudu gets inside the line but does not meet with the pull
Rayudu jumps out of the crease and aims to manufacture a shot. Little bangs it into the middle of the deck and keeps him to a single to deep midwicket
slower cutter, 110.5ks, Gaikwad steps out but Little doesn't give him enough pace to work with. Played back to him
hip-high short ball on middle stump, possibly another cutter. But it does not bother Gaikwad who lines it up and swats it over square leg for another six
Gaikwad gives him the charge immediately, meets a low full-toss and slices it just away from the reach of Pandya who was diving across to his left from mid-off
preText: Dayal finally comes on. Left-arm over
postText: Jayant Isswani : "Shivam Dube might enjoy batting on this track. He should be sent next."

shortText: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run
text: back of a length and angling across off, this sort of stopped on Gaikwad who checks his drive and chips it in front of Pandya at mid-off
mid-off had been sent back, but Gaikwad still clears him comfortably. Slower legcutter, finishes on off, Gaikwad delays his loft and then sends it over the outfielder

shortText: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run
text: back of a length and angling across off, 133ks, this one-pace delivery is carved away to backward point
postText: Jon: "Already major problems being exposed for CSK. They lacked good power hitters in the middle last season and it seems this time again they're being carried by Gaikwad"

text: another slower ball, this finishes on the pads, neatly tucked away through midwicket for one
preText: Kiran Kadam: "Man this Gaikwad fella hammers short ball like he has some revenge to take"

text: slower ball into the pitch, Rayudu picks up this thigh-high delivery and muscles a six over midwicket. Rayudu gets going with this six
preText: Damo: "11.3 was a pure magic from Ruturaj. What a magnificent shot. "

text: back of a length and skidding away just a shade outside off, Gaikwad opens the bat-face and guides a single to backward point
preText: Will: "@Jon, give them some time mate... Just the first game...the power hitters are not here yet "

text: 143ks, length ball on the stumps, Rayudu swings for the hills and gets an inside edge onto the back thigh

There's no stopping Gaikwad tonight. Williamson tried to stop him but he lands awkwardly on his right knee. Hip-high short ball on leg stump, Gaikwad hauls it over square leg. Williamson stretches across to his right and looks to parry the ball back into play but he loses his balance and when he lands the entire body weight is on his right knee. Ouch! Williamson has to leave the field. This looks nasty. He already has a niggly elbow to deal with. The ball bounced inside the field of play - so just a four for Gaikwad
postText: Vaibhav: "That effort from Kane was reminiscent of a great catch ABD had pulled off few years back for RCB. "

text: driven down to long-off for a single

wkt_text: AT Rayudu  b Little 12 (12b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100.00
text: Maiden IPL wicket for Josh Little. Rayudu dashes out of the crease, swings for the hills once again, but does not lay bat on ball. Little cranks it up to almost 140ks and nails the stumps
145ks, full ball on off, stabbed back to the bowler
preText: Looks like a serious issue for Williamson. Tommy Simsek, the CSK physio who has also worked with NZ, also tends to him. Meanwhile, Dube, who is working his way back from an injury of his own, is the new batter for CSK. Is Rayudu done for the day? Will CSK bring an Impact Player in place of Rayudu?
postText: Prathab : "I am happy to see this intent in middle overs by CSK. Whenever they lacked it, they ended at the bottom of the table. They need to keep this intent throughout the tournament with their long batting."

text: full and angling into the stumps, whipped away with the wrists between deep midwicket and wide long-on
postText: Dan: "As a fan in NZ I suddenly care far less about this game and far more about our man Kane. I know it's early but this doesn't look good and the world cup is later this year...."

text: banged in short at the body, 143ks, fended to point for a single
postText: "You don't like to see injuries like that, hopefully he's okay, but it didn't look like that," says Titans' Kirsten

text: pitched-up delivery outside off, driven down to long-off
postText: Rohit: "Really hope Williamson's injury isn't bad.Was really excited to watch him this IPL and with the World Cup coming up as well…."

text: banged in short and zipping across off, 141.4ks, Dube swishes and misses
bumper angling across off, Dube rocks his head out of the way
Dube hangs back for this short ball, but this isn't quite short, and more on a back of a length. Chiselled into the leg side for a single
Titans keep digging it short to Dube. Another chest-high short ball, which is flapped away through midwicket
hip-high short ball on off, rushes Gaikwad into a pull, hauled away to deep midwicket
short and tucks Dube up once again, pings the thigh pad and rolls away fine past the keeper. Gets it away to the right of Saha
rib-high short ball on leg stump, fended away through midwicket. CSK have batting depth all the way down to No.11. Dube needs to find a way to keep hitting
fullish and wobbles away outside off, Gaikwad checks his drive and dabs it to cover
postText: Shankar : "CSK losing momentum here. They should get atleast 200 to defend with their bowling attack "

text: on a length and outside off, driven down the ground to long-off on the front foot
slower yorker, dips at off stump, jammed down to long-on
preText: B Sai Sudharsan is on the field, subbing for the injured Williamson

text: bouncer, fizzing away outside off, Dube aims for the hook but loses his shape. The ball hits his shoulder and balloons to Saha
back of a length on middle at 147ks, clears his front leg and plinks it down to long-on
fullish and outside off, Gaikwad goes for a loft and toe-ends it in front of long-off
Dube backs away, pounded into the middle of the deck and into the body once again. The result is a weak pull to deep square leg
Dube makes room and slashes this short ball on the stumps through the gap at extra-cover. Dube's go-slow is hurting CSK
Smashed over long-on for another imposing six. Dug in shorter and quicker, attempted googly on off, put away
preText: Rashid is back for his final over
postText:
Ruturaj Gaikwad - 58 off 31 balls (7 sixes, 1 four)

Rest of CSK batters - 27 off 29 balls (1 six, 1 four)

text: shorter and sliding into the top of off stump, hauled away into the leg side for two more
postText: Krishna: "Shivam Dube is a mess. He swings to the leg side, the ball goes to the covers. That is a huge momentum loss for CSK. He is trying to hit every ball hard. His wicket is going to be blessing in disguise for CSK in this over."

text: attempted googly? Short and sliding down the leg side, helped away fine of Joseph at short fine leg
preText: Bala: "Strange to see that neither of Rahul Tewatia or Vijay Shankar have not bowled yet. Are they playing as pure batters? Would have preferred to include Sai Kishore in the team for either of the two since he had a decent run with the ball in the last IPL and an useful hitter too."
postText: Shankar: "Boundary off rashid again. Another wicket coming?"

text: back of a length and into the pitch, Dube swings and misses, as the ball passes leg stump. They sneak in a bye

shortText: Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run
text: back of a length and breaks away outside off, jabbed into the covers
jabbed into the covers once again, this time Gaikwad chances a single and keeps strike

wkt_text: RD Gaikwad c Shubman Gill b Joseph 92 (50b 4x4 9x6) SR: 184.00
text: Joseph misses the yorker, but is still a hard-to-hit middle-stump full-toss, which is spliced into the hands of long-on. Is that a high full-toss? Gaikwad thinks so. <s>Gaikwad has asked for a review</s>. The umpires converge and ask for a review. The ball dips below the waist and therefore Gaikwad has to go. End of a terrific innings from Gaikwad. He falls eight short of a century
preText: Change of bat for Gaikwad. Joseph is often un-hittable at the death. This should be fun

text: short and into the pitch, 145ks, hauled away to deep midwicket
preText: Jadeja joins the struggling Dube

text: banged in short and angling across off stump, miscues a pull over midwicket. Dube crawls to 10 off 14 balls

wkt_text: RA Jadeja c Shankar b Joseph 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: Joseph goes for the yorker, marginally misses it, but has Jadeja holing out to deep midwicket. Mighty full on the pads, Jadeja picks it up and picks out the fielder on the boundary
banged in short and angling in at 145ks, Joseph is too good, flapped away through square leg
preText: Dhoni walks out to bat

text: leg-stump yorker, jammed back to the right of Joseph. Superb shift from Joseph. What a gun bowler
preText: This is the first time MS Dhoni batting at No.8 and lower in T20s, notes Sampath Bandarupalli

text: banged in short and at the body (what else?) to Dube. He top-edges a hook. Dayal runs in from long leg. Saha runs back and across to his right. He puts in the dive but the ball bursts out of his gloves
preText: After bowling three in the powerplay, Shami comes back for his last over

text: short and on the stumps, Dube has finally connected with one. He camps back and muscles it over midwicket for a towering six. Shades of Yuvraj there

wkt_text: S Dube c Rashid Khan b Mohammed Shami 19 (18b 0x4 1x6) SR: 105.55
text: throat-high short ball angling across Dube. He goes for another hook, this time he holes out to Rashid Khan at deep square leg. Another mis-hit and this goes to the fielder. Dube has been put out of his misery

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Santner, no run
text: short and outside off, 142ks, fended back to the left of Shami
preText: Mitch Santner

text: short and cramps Santner for room, hauled away only as far as long-on
back of a length and outside off, slogged away to deep midwicket off the inner half
postText: Bavithran: "Alzari Joseph in his first over: 1-0-18-0. Alzari Joseph in his last three overs : 3-0-15-2"

text: full and wide of off, Dhoni smears it away along the ground to deep cover
preText:
Little to bowl the last over of the innings. He was bowling to Dhoni at the nets in Surat last season. He will now be bowling to Dhoni on IPL debut. Pandya has a chat with him

Athvait: "CSK need to aim for minimum 180, try to get 185. Any less and their bowling is exposed."

text: Santner makes room, Little chases him with a yorker, strikes the pad and rolls away into the leg side
Bam! On a length and outside off, slot ball, Dhoni sizes it up and clouts it over square leg for a towering six. Welcome back, thala
full and straight, Little errs again and cops punishment. Picks it up off the pads and whips it away over midwicket
Little does something different: takes pace off and takes it away from Dhoni. He slogs early and misses
preText: Mustafa Moudi : "Deepak Chahar would have batted better than Dube. Dhoni must promote him next match to get a few quick runs !!" --- Chaos theory, anyone?

text: slower ball into the pitch on middle, 115.2ks, hauled away to deep square leg on the back foot
preText: Ashish: "Giving length balls to Dhoni in the death. Not a good idea. He can hit those in his sleep."
postText: 9.34pm Dhoni's cameo has dragged CSK close to 180, but at one point when Gaikwad was in control, they were looking good for 200. Dube's go-slow and Titans' hit-the-deck hustle in the middle overs set them back. "Little bit disappointed," Moeen says. "We should've got a bit more and it was a decent pitch. [Playing for] Chennai and the atmosphere here is fantastic". CSK's bowling is their weaker suit. Can they defend 178? Do join Sid Monga to find out.

text: on a length, slight shape, defended
preText:
9.55pm Right. Here we go. Deepak Chahar to Wriddhiman Saha.

9.51pm Ambati Rayudu out for Tushar Deshpande as the first Impact substitute in the IPL. Deshpande is a fast bowler from Mumbai. Used to have no-ball troubles at one point.

9.50pm The ground staff have run their rope on the ground to work on the dew. We don't really if there is much of it. Don't be surprised if Ben Stokes bowls tonight. Shubman Gill and Wriddhiman Saha are the GT openers.

9.45pm Welcome back. An underwhelming score for CSK despite that Gaikwad special. GT, though, are light on batting, and we don't know if they will have Williamson available after that injury while fielding. No Impact Player so far. Let's see what the teams do with the switch.

text: wide outswinger, left alone. Dhoni collects it by his shoe laces
preText: Just one wide slip

text: now the inswinger. Swings big. Beats the inside edge. hits the pad. Headed down leg
thick edge to a wide outswinger. Gets a single to deep third
leading edge to an outswinger, and it squeezes between point and cover

shortText: Chahar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: beaten as he walks at a wide outswinger, but ends up pushing inside the line
massive leading edge. He is looking to flick this length ball over leg, but edges it so well that it clears deep third
preText: Deshpande into action right away

text: he has manufactured this. Not short enough but he stays back to swipe this through midwicket
inswinger, goes past the inside edge, but is headed down and goes for a leg-bye

shortText: Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run
text: another leading edge. This one goes right down, and to cover
that's a Gill special. A short-arm jab to a length ball. This is not short enough by any imagination. Gets it past midwicket

shortText: Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run
text: another leading edge to a length ball just outside off. Stays down, and goes to cover
full and straight, hit on the inside half of the bat for a single to mid-on
preText: Chahar will continue

text: the short-arm jab again but for a single to deep square leg
inswinger, headed down leg, inside edge for one
slower ball, full, on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
a second six for Saha. Not really in control of it, but it sounds sweet. Quite a high bouncer, outside off, and Saha has to fetch it. But he gets enough on it for a six
down the wicket, Chahar slows it down, Saha swipes across the line, gets a single
nearly a wicket first ball. Nearly a yorker, hits his toe, but headed down leg
preText: Debutant Rajvardhan Hangargekar to bowl now

text: slogs a length ball over midwicket for four. This is a good start from Saha
preText: Another free hit coming up

text: ends up sliding it down the leg side. Called wide
preText: Free hit coming up

text: quick, nearly full, Saha late into it, but, hang on, he has over-stepped
goes full, probably too quick, hits the inner half of the bat, but they get a single to mid-on
pushed wide of midwicket for one more

wkt_text: WP Saha c Dube b Hangargekar 25 (16b 2x4 2x6) SR: 156.25
text: wicket number no. 1 for Hangargekar. In his first over. Outswinger from the hand, moves away. It is widish to start off with it. Saha still flashes at it, gets a thick edge, which settles with deep third this time
what a lovely connection first up. Hangargekar gets a touch too straight, and he clips this off his toes. The timing and placement are so good it goes wide of square leg for four
preText: Another impact player. Sai Sudharsan replaces Kane Williamson. Sudharsan comes in at No. 3

text: Gill reprising some of the shots from earlier in the international season. Stands tall to punch a wide length ball between point ad cover
preText: Deshpande gets a change of ends

text: soft hands to run this down to short third for one

a little pick-up off the toes for a six. Deshpande might have reason to believe this is not too0 short of being a yorker, but Gill's driving zone is different becsuse of his back and across movement. Lifts it over wide mid-on
preText: Free hit coming up

shortText: Deshpande to Sai Sudharsan, (no ball) 1 run
text: runs this length ball down to deep third for a single. Oh wow. Deshpande bowls a no-ball too. I am not surprised. I have seen him struggle with no-balls

shortText: Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run
text: hit hard but straight to extra cove
worked away off the pads for a single to deep square leg
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed wide of midwicket for one

shortText: Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: on a length, worked to leg, but not past midwicket
preText: Santner to bowl insider the powerplay

shortText: Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: looks to run this behind square on the off side, but he has no pace to work with
preText: Bowling over the wicket

shortText: Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: goes back to turn a length ball against the turn, but can't get it past extra cover
forget getting it past a fielder, he has gone over his head. Goes back again, gets the length and the width to cut, and this time he doesn't bother about finding a gap. He goes over extra cover
worked into the leg side for one
special shot. Not a bad ball really but he goes back to0 cut the length ball through point for four
fires in a length ball. Punched to long-on for one
preText: Jadeja now. Bowling round the wicket

text: on a length, into the pads, Gill's soft hands when working this to leg let him get two

shortText: Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run
text: fullish, outside off, pushed to short straight extra cover

shortText: Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 leg bye
text: into the pads, worked square on the leg side for one

shortText: Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: quick length b all, slight turn back in, pushed back to Jadeja n
misfield allows them two. Slower in the air but lets him go to back foot. The fielder from point charges at it, but misses the ball. A dot turns into two

shortText: Santner to Shubman Gill, no run
text: this one slides on as bowls on a length. No room, defended
preText: Slip comes in for Santner

text: looks to shimmy down, Santner follows him,  but he gets a single to long-on
another incredible shot. It is not a bad ball at all. On a length, but Sudharsan finds a way to pull this from inside the crease for four
worked wide of cover for one
shimmies down the wicket to loft a wide length ball over extra. Goes off the low part of the bat
pushed towards deep midwicket for one
postText: Time for a timeout

text: full, on the pads, worked to wide long-on for one
preText: Jadeja continues with a slip

text: pulls a quick length ball to deep midwicket for one
preText: Looks like Gill might drop anchor here after the quick start

shortText: Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run
text: quick, on a length, straight, defended back
down the wicket, crisp hit towards long-on. Short extra cover puts in a dive, but the ricochet allows them a second
worked to deep square leg for one
fired into the pads, helped along the way, using his pace, past short fine. Conway slides to his left at long leg to save two runs with some nifty foot work
on a length, into the pads, clipped away to deep square for one
preText: Hangargekar comes back

shortText: Hangargekar to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: Sudharsan looks to cut a length ball. He tends to hang back. But this one beats him for pace
preText: Round the wicket

wkt_text: B Sai Sudharsan c †Dhoni b Hangargekar 22 (17b 3x4 0x6) SR: 129.41
text: oh not the best delivery to get a wicket. Short and wide, Sudharsan looks for the cut, but it is too wide for him, and he just toe-ends it to Dhoni
Pandya's version of the short-arm jab now. Conway saves two with a dive at deep midwicket
preText: Hardik Pandya comes in at No. 4

text: on a length, just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
preText: A wide slip in place

text: gets onto him quickly as he shapes up to pull. Ends up hitting it to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, hit straight to extra cover
preText: It has been a slow game so far. Well past quarter to 11, and we still have 10 overs to go. Jadeja might help the over-rate

text: moves straighter, pushed with an open face for one
clipped off the toes to deep midwicket
angled into the pads, punched down to wide long-on for one
fired into the pads again, well down leg, and the sweeping Gill gets just enough bat on it to beat short fine leg
that's a Gill special. Down the wicket, makes room too, and goes over extra cover for a flat six. Jadeja is not turning it, and Gill is cashing in
on a length, going down, gets as single to long leg
preText: Santner cones back. He ha s slip in place

text: that's fifty for Gill. Santner slows it down, but Gill goes back to cut it to deep cover for one
pushed towards long-off for one
goes back to punch this length ball to deep cover
slows it down, gets nice drift, beats his attempt to sweep
full, just outside off, pushed to long-off for one

wkt_text: HH Pandya  b Jadeja 8 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 72.72
text: Jadeja has not given Pandya anything so far. So he goes down to look to sweep. Jadeja keeps doing what he has been doing. Look to hit top of off. Pandya sweeps from around off, misses it completely, and Jadeja hits somewhere near the top of off
preText: Jadeja continues. They have a slip in place

text: slightly fuller, hits the inside half of the bat
preText: Vijay Shankar is the new batter. This will now test GT's depth

text: goes deep to try to hit it to long-off but can't get beat short extra cover
crisply timed but hit straight to extra cover
soft hands to work this flighted delivery into the leg side for a couple
on. a length, and he goes back to punch it towards wide long-on
lovely sound off the bat as he punches this hard but Santner sets fly at short extra cover to deny him
wide down the leg side
preText: Hangargekar comes back in

text: dug in short, doesn't quite get it high, and he has pulled this right in the gap between long leg and deep square
short of a length, fended into the leg side with soft hands
pulled off the front foot for a single to deep midwicket
pulled to deep midwicket again for another single
dug in short, looks for thr ramp, but it is too high and he pulls out to take the wide instead

top edge for four. Looks for the hook from outside off. The ball is not too high but he has to drag it from outside off. He gets a top edge to fine leg for four. We have a review for a no-ball on height. Replays show the height is okay. And although they are not checking the front foot, it looks extremely close. I assume the third umpire has already checked and cleared it
punched to deep cover for one
preText: Deshpande is back

text: tucked away off the hip for a single to deep square leg
muscles it away. Looking for a pull but it hurries onto him, and he ends up hitting it down the ground. Manages to clear mid-off, though
opens the face for a single to deep third
oh the bat has made sweet noise all night but if Gaikwad had been on the boundary and not in off the rope. It ids a flat flick over midwicket. Gaikwad backtracks but can't get it

wkt_text: Shubman Gill c Gaikwad b Deshpande 63 (36b 6x4 3x6) SR: 175.00
text: this one is an easy catch for eep midwicket. Tries the pull but it goes off the toe end of the bat as he is dragging it from wide outside off. Taken at deep midwicket this time
on a length, into the pads, worked away for one
preText: Rahul Tewatia is the new man in. Shankar on strike. CSK still have a chance. Santner comes back

text: soft hands, open the face, gets a single to the right of point
preText: Tewatia to face for the first time this IPL

text: GT are not letting CSK back in it. Shankar goes back to hit a slow length ball between long-off and deep extra cover. Stokes and Conway converge but neither man dives in the end
driven to deep extra cover
slower in the air, wide, short of a length, can't find a gap
again slow in the air, looks to work this to leg, but ends up playing it too close to Santner
postText: Into the death overs we go, but first a strategic timeout

text: gets a single to short fine leg
preText: Thirty-four off 24. You'd back the chasing side on most occasions

text: on a length, full, pushed to long-on for one
preText: Chahar is back by the way. Around the wicket

text: no room, full and straight, pushed to mid-off
backs away early, Chahar stays on a length, Shankar toe-ends it over the infield for a single to deep cover
gets a short and wide ball, but cuts it straight to extra cover
again short and wide, but seems like a slower delivery, and is cut to deep cover for one
preText: Anish Rijal: "Very long tail of GT, these two needs to take into 19th over with not more than 20 to get. "

text: on a length, angling across him, he is looking to go over extra but is beaten
preText: Hangargekar to bowl out. Chahar and Deshpande might bowl 19 and 20

text: two dots. Nearly two a ball now. Wide length ball, driven hard but straight to mid-off
full, nearly a yorker, driven to long-off for a single
that will relieve some nerves in the dugout. Shankar is probably expecting a short ball, moves back and across early early, and pulls this from outside off to clear midwicket

wide on the crease, wide full toss, not called, and they have reviewed it. This is usually a subjective call so I don't know how you can get it overturned. One thing I can objectively tell you is that Shankar has not shuffled across so the tram line should be a pretty fair indicator. And he is touch and go on that tram line. Probably has gone over the tram line. So the original decision has to stay

wkt_text: V Shankar c Santner b Hangargekar 27 (21b 2x4 1x6) SR: 128.57
text: big wicket. Looks like a slower ball. Shankar is looking to go in the air and down the ground. Gets the right length, right in the slot, but he seems to have bowled a slower ball. Shankar ends up toe-ending it for a catch half way between mid-off and long-off. CSK still alive
postText: Who bowls this over? Chahar, I eould say

text: Chahar it is. Around the wicket
postText: slower ball into the pitch, beats his attempt to cut

text: speared into the toes, Tewatia misses, but the ball kisses the pad, and squirts between the diving keeper and short fine. Dhoni might be cramping as he gets up after diving
shortish, into the pitch, pulled to deep midwicket for one
what a njght for Rashid so far. Wickets early with the ball, and smacks the first ball he faces for a six. Slower ball, right in the slot, Rashid clears the front leg, and goes over midwicket
preText: Two a ball now. Rashid Khan is your new batter

text: this might be the game. Chahar bowls on-pace this time, but shortish and widish with short third inside the circle. Rashid throws his bat at it, and gets enough bat on it to clear short third

shortText: Chahar to Rashid Khan, no run
text: Rashid wants to end this one right here, right now. He jumps out of the crease, but is beaten by the slower bouncer
scores level. Tewatia has guessed correctly that Deshpande is going full and wide. He moves across, gets right behind it, finds the length right in the slot, and clears mid-off with ease
full and wide, too wide. Called too. Thankfully, CSK don't review it
preText: Eight required off the last over. Deshpande to bowl it. Super Over, anyone? Mid-off, short third and fine leg up in the circle. Deshpande goes around the wicket

text: Tewatia holds his arms aloft after drilling one for four past the bowler. Right in the slot again, and he hits it hard and right back at the umpire, who gets out of the way
postText:
12.05am The opening match started on a Friday, but it is Saturday by the time the presentations are done. not quite clinical, but still a comfortable enough win for the defending champions Gujarat Titans. That's all we have for you tonight, but we will be back before you even get a chance to miss us as tomorrow is a double header. See you then.

Midnight The Player of the Match is Rashid Khan. He says: "So happy to get the Man of the Match. Gives me so much of energy for the rest of the competition. Bowling to the leftie was hard but the more I keep it tight, it is better. I had it in my mind to keep it simple. Just bowl the right areas consistently. Batting is all about time spent in the nets. The kind of opportunity and confidence in me by the coaching staff and the captain does give me a lot of batting time in the nets. It helps me in the middle."

11.55pm We will soon be into day of this match with the presentation not yet done. Hardik Pandya says: "I am obviously very happy, but we did put ourselves in a difficult position. We were very happy with 178 because at one point they looked like going past 200. But we kept getting wickets. Having the impact rule makes my job very difficult. There are too many options. Because of it, someone will always bowl less or late. My shot and Shubman's shot put the team in a difficult position. We have some standards inside the dressing room. We have to finish the games, and not Rash and Rahul all the time."

11.45pm "We were slightly short," says MS Dhoni, the losing captain. "Another 15-20 runs would have been good. We all know there would be a little bit of dew. Also it was a 7.30pm start so the ball holds on a little early on. Also we could have batted properly in the middle overs as opposed to trying to muscle the ball. Rutu is a pleasure to watch. He has groomed himself very well, and makes the eight decisions under pressure. We can't afford to bowl no-balls. That is something in our control."

11.38pm That's a pretty comfortable win for the defending champions, GT. Led by Rashid Khan with the ball, they restricted CSL to 20 short of a par score, and then chased it down fairly easily. In the end, two blows from Rashid Khan turned a possibly tight finish to a walk in the park in the last over. The win will be extra sweet because they couldn't use their Impact Player properly thanks to the injury to Kane Williamson when fielding. The pace of the match hasn't been great with more than four hours taken
